loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Agustina is 55 years old.

Agustina has a buy-and-sell beverages business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy beverages to sell like soft drinks, coconut wine, etc.

Agustina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Agustina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell like soft drinks, coconut wine, etc.

loans.name: Jofe

texts.en:
Jofe is 32 years old and married with one child still in school. Jofe works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, etc.

Jofe has been in this business for ten years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, etc

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Don Julián vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo tiene mas de 40 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra de maíz y maicillo y así poder obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julian lives in his own home with his wife. He earns a living growing corn and sorghum. 

He began this work with his own capital over forty years ago, and he sells is products around the area where he lives.

Julian is requesting a loan to buy supplies to plant the corn and sorghum crops, so that he can get better earnings and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies to plant corn and sorghum crops.

loans.name: Roudayna

texts.en:
Roudayna is a 34-year-old Lebanese married mother of three children who has been working in the agriculture sector for four years to help her family to meet the needs of life.

 She is a very hard worker with the aim to always develop her work and her income. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a car for her business that will ease her operations. Roudayna insists that she will be a permanent customer to be able always to develop  her business.

loans.use: to buy a car for her agriculture business

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 65 years old and married. All her children are married already, but, as a parent, she still needs to earn a living and help her children also in their financial needs. 

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for 10 years already and it has been the source of income for her family. She aims to increase her income so that she can help her children also with a living and she can help their children in times of their needs. 

So she decided to avail a loan to buy additional good items for the store to sell to increase her store inventory and generate greater income.

Saturnina's plan for the future is to invest in other business using her business income.

loans.use: To buy additional good items for the store to sell.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en:
Maurecia works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling kitchenware in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of kitchenware to sell. Maurecia has been in this business for 24 years now. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

In the future, Maurecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of kitchenware to sell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Hilaria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Hilaria is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Hilaria has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is 58 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She has a flower pot making business in the Philippines. Melly requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy old tires, wires and paint for her flower pot making.

Melly has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Melly would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy old tires, wires and paint for her flower pot making

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Imelda has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to to buy more fish to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Edwin De Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin, utilizo el préstamo anterior para cuidar de sus cultivos, con lo que las cosechas de maíz y frijol han sido abundantes y la situación económica es muy favorable, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo y no ha tenido dificultades para seguir trabajando en el campo.
Como los créditos son herramientas de gran utilidad nuevamente solicita uno, lo invertirá en abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y semilla para realizar los trabajos agrícolas de la temporada, espera obtener granos básicos en abundancia para abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edwin used the previous loan to care for his crops, with which the corn and bean harvests were plentiful and the economic situation is very good. His family is the same nuclear family and he hasn't had any difficulties continuing with his work in the countryside. 

Since the loans are very useful tools, he asks for another one. He will invest it in manure, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds to do the agricultural work of the season. He hopes to get an abundance of basic grains to supply his family and his customers.

loans.use: to invest in manure, herbicides, insecticides, and seeds to do the agricultural work of the season.

loans.name: Bibata's Group

texts.fr:
Mme  BIBATA est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 21 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes, sac à main et chaussures  depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier.
 Elle veut s’acheter  03pièces de pagnes et 04sacs à main.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité et aider le mari à payer la scolarité des enfants. Elle ambitionne  devenir grande commerçante et pouvoir voyager dans des payer comme Doubaï pour acheter ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Mme  Bibata is the group leader. She is married and the mother of four children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest 7 years old. Three children attend school, and she is responsible for six persons in all.

Mme Bibata has been selling pagnes (lengths of African print cloth), handbags, and shoes for six years. She stocks up on inventoryd in the markets in her district. She wants to buy three lengths of pagne and four handbags. 

She wants to use her profits to bolster her business and help her husband to pay school fees for their children. Her ambition is to become an important merchant and to be able to travel to places like Dubai to purchase her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy three lengths of pagne (brightly colored African print cloth) and four handbags

loans.name: Zarabonu

texts.en:
Zarabonu is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1960. She is living in a big village with her family. She is married and has children who are all married. Her husband is a pensioner.

She could not feed her family with her husband’s earnings. Zarabonu is used to doing business in order to live and feed her family well.  

Now, Zarabonu has 20 years of practice doing business in the domestic market, buying and selling menswear and shoes. During her activity she saved up money, took her daughter for marriage, and bought a car. Her son does business with a car, being a taxi-driver. 

Zarabonu requested a loan from IMON and Kiva for her business to buy a new assortment of menswear and shoes. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of menswear and shoes

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mme MARIAM est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Tous vont à l’école. Elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend du maïs et du couscous de manioc depuis 15ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de Lomé et Bobo Dioulasso.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs de couscous de manioc.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Mme Mariam is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest nine years old. All attend school. She is responsible for two people. 

Mme Mariam sells maize and manioc couscous and has been doing so for 15 years. She buys her merchandise in the markets of Lomé and Bobo Dioulasso. She wants to buy 10 sacks of manioc couscous. 

She intends to reinvest her profit in her business. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of manioc couscous

loans.name: Zenabo

texts.fr:
Mme ZENABO est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend de l’oignon  depuis 14ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 sacs d’oignons.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour réinvestir dans son activité. Mme ambitionne acheter un motocycle.
texts.en:
Mme Zenabo is married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 16 and the youngest is four years old. Two of them attend school. 

Mme Zenabo has been selling onions for 14 years. She stocks up in the markets in her district.  She wants to buy 10 sacks of onions. 

She wants to use her profit to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of  onions

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 50 years old, married and has three children.  

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Myrna requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Flordelis

texts.en:
Flordelis, 36, is a married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Flordelis has a egg-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Flordelis requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell.

In the future, Flordelis would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Irma Teresa

texts.es: Irma de 30 años, cuando se trasladó al barrio donde actualmente vive, identificó la necesidad de colocar un centro de educación preescolar, fundamentado en valores y buenos principios, fue entonces que materializó esta idea de la mano de un grupo religioso al cual pertenece,  para promover  la formación integral desde la primera infancia, con un componente educativo basado en lo académico, deportivo, artístico y espiritual, que aporte a la construcción de la sociedad que habita en este asentamiento. Con cuatro años de funcionamiento para Irma es de suma importancia  aplicar a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual invertirá en mobiliario para uso de los alumnos;  mesas, sillas, tableros y demás.  Esta inversión tiene como finalidad ofrecer comodidad a los estudiantes en las aulas de clases, lo que permitirá un mejor desarrollo del aprendizaje del estudiante.  Irma tiene metas muy claras para su negocio y vida personal, ella desea tener casa propia y  seguir creciendo en su negocio para  brindar más cobertura en su escuela.
texts.en: Irma, 30 years old, when she moved to the neighborhood where she currently lives, identified the need to establish a center for preschool education, based in values and good principles. It was then that this idea materialized from the hand of a religious group she belongs to, to promote integrated development from early infancy, with an educational component based in the academic, athletic, artistic and spiritual, which supports the construction of the society that lives in this setting. With four years of running, for Irma it is extremely important to apply for a Kiva loan, the first financing that she is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest in student furniture: tables, chairs, white boards, and more. This investment has as its end offering comfort to the students in the classrooms, which will allow better development of learning for the student. Irma has very clear goals for her business and personal life. She wants to have her own house and continue growing in her business to offer more coverage in her school.

loans.use: to invest in furniture for the students' use: desks, chairs, white boards, and more.

loans.name: Sombrerito Group

texts.es:
Jessica es una mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene1 hijo de 2 años, y su trabajo es la medicina.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, amigable, de buen trato, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al cultivo de la yuca y el plátano, también en la cercanía al río, se explota la cal para venderla en la ciudad. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 16-23 grados centígrados.
Jessica es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza (de pie, la tercera contando de la derecha, viste chamarra negra con rayas rosadas). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como empleado y con su hijo que ya sabe caminar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para el beneficio de la comunidad la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de refrescos hervidos tradicionales, servicio de moto taxi, reparación de electrodomésticos, venta de ropa de segunda mano, panadería, venta de frutas y venta de comida, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su trabajo es la enfermería, ella trabaja como enfermera en un hospital cercano, también cuenta con un pequeño consultorio en su domicilio donde realiza la colocación de inyecciones y algunas curaciones a pacientes con heridas debido al trabajo diario o enfermedades como gripes y resfriados. Su comunidad es alejada de la ciudad y acudir a un doctor o a un hospital es difícil y en ocasiones imposible, “estudié la carrera de enfermería y trabajo en un hospital, instalé un pequeño consultorio para ayudar a mi comunidad y necesito dotarlo de instrumentos y medicamentos básicos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que realiza un bien a su comunidad, la desventaja es la distancia y la falta de capital para equipar su consultorio con medicamentos e instrumentos médicos. Su sueño es ayudar a mejorar la salud de su comunidad, ella desea comprar medicamentos básicos, para la cura y tratamiento de enfermedades ambulatorias como resfríos, gripes, y otros para ayudar a curar las dolencias de los pobladores de su comunidad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que trabaja como enfermera profesional.
Es por esos motivos que Jessica solicita un préstamo para la compra de medicamentos generales para abrir un consultorio médico para atender a pacientes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jessica is a 24 year old woman. She lives with her partner, has a 2 year old child, and her job is in medicine. She is a good mother, independent, friendly, easy-going, responsible and hard-working. She does her job in the location of "El Torno" where the majority of the residents make a living growing yucca and bananas. They also extract lime powder close to the river to sell it in the city. The city has a hot subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 16-23 degrees Celsius. Jessica has dark skin, brown eyes, long black hair that she wears tied back, a short stature, and a thin physique. Her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with family and she speaks Spanish in public and for her work (in the picture she is standing, the third from the right, wearing a black jacket with pink stripes). 

She shares her life with her partner who is an employee and her son who has started walking. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement with a tin roof and which has electricity and well water that is extracted through an electric pump. They do not have sewerage. 

The need to enlarge her business for the benefit of the community propelled her to lead a bank of people with businesses such as: selling traditional boiled soft drinks, motorcycle taxi service, appliance repair, selling second-hand clothing, a bakery, selling fruit and selling food, in order to ask for a loan and improve their jobs. 

Her job is nursing. She works as a nurse in a nearby hospital and she also has a small office at home where she gives injections and some medical attention to patients with work-related injuries or sicknesses like flus and colds. Her community is far from the city and finding a doctor or a hospital is difficult and sometimes impossible. "I studied nursing and I work in a hospital. I set up a small doctor's office to help my community and I need to supply it with instruments and basic medicines..." she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she is doing something good for her community. The disadvantage is the distance and lack of money to supply her office with the medicines and medical instruments. Her dream is to help improve the health of her community. She wants to buy basic medicines to cure and treat outpatient sicknesses such as colds, flus and others to help heal the illnesses of the residents of her community. 

This is the 1st loan with the institution in the 5 years that she has worked as a professional nurse. It is for these reasons that Jessica is asking for a loan to buy general medicines to open a doctor's office and care for patients in her community.

loans.use: to buy general medicines to open a doctor's office and care for patients in her community.

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee un taller de costura desde hace 20 años su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo es como ha podido salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de telas e hilos, botones, elásticos, zippers, etc. todo por mayor para poder tener lo necesario para atender mejor sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Ana is 44 years old and lives in her home with her husband and 2 children.  She has had a sewing workshop for 20 years.  Her business is located in her home and with what she makes she has been able to help hep husband, which is how they have been able to move ahead.  She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of fabrics and threads, buttons, elastics, zippers, etc. at wholesale to be able to have the necessary things to better tend to her clients and have better earnings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics and threads, buttons, elastics, zippers, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is married and has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines. Maribeth has been in this business for 15 years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Maribeth requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Lee

texts.en:
Ana Lee is 38 years old, married, and has two children. With two children in school, Ana Lee works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Lee runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.  

Ana Lee requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future, Ana Lee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 45 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. Nora  works very hard to provide for them.

Nora runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Nora requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Ann operates a seafood business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. 

Mary Ann requested a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more lobsters, crabs, shrimp, prawns, and other seafood to sell in her stall. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more lobsters, crabs, shrimp, prawns, and other seafood

loans.name: Gena

texts.en:
Gena is 41 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Gena operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Gena requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, trabaja en el campo cultivando granos básicos, es un oficio que aprendió de familia, trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 15 años, su horario es de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde, cuenta con una gran experiencia y con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado mantenerlo en el mercado; vive con su esposa y un pequeño hijo que tiene 2 años de edad.
Invertirá en insumos agrícolas  para iniciar a tratar la tierra para sembrar en el tiempo justo, se ha decidido a utilizar un financiamiento para mejorar su negocio y tener producto suficiente para alimentar a su familia y para surtir a sus clientes, espera poder tener nuevos ingresos económicos.
Los sueños que Manuel tiene son remodelar su vivienda y darle a su familia un nuevo estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel works in the fields cultivating basic grains, a trade he learned from his family.  He has worked independently since age 15.  He works from 6 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon, and with experience and the support of his family he has been able to maintain his market.  

He lives with his wife and 2 year old child.  He will invest in agricultural supplies to prepare the land for planting season.  He has decided to use the financing to improve his business and have enough to feed his family and supply his clients.  He hopes to have new income.  The dreams Manuel has include remodeling his home and giving his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest in agricultural supplies to begin to treat the land to plant at the correct time.

loans.name: Jose Dimas

texts.es:
José, se siente agradecido con los inversionistas Kiva y con Padecomsmcrecrito por el apoyo brindado con el financiamiento anterior, su negocio se ha mantenido con vida y generándole los ingresos necesarios para costear los gastos familiares e ir cancelando las cuotas de la deuda.
Por los buenos resultados que le da el uso de créditos está decidido a solicitar más capital para poder comprar una vaca parida y alimento para sus animales de corral, continuara mejorando la ganadería y también producirá lácteos para tener nuevos ingresos.
texts.en: José is grateful to the Kiva lenders and Padecomsmcrecrito for the given support with the previous loan. His business has kept alive and has provided him with the needed income to afford his household expenses and pay off his debt. Because of the good results of these loans, he has decided to request more capital to buy a newly calved cow and animal feed for his farmyard animals. He will continue improving his cattle, and will also produce milk products in order to have new income.

loans.use: to buy a newly calved cow and animal feed for his farmyard animals.

loans.name: Ada Alicia

texts.es: Ada de 53 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tiene 28 años de dedicarse a las ventas su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa para damas y caballeros por mayor y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Ada is a 53-year-old single mother living in her own home with her daughter.  She makes a living selling clothing and has 28 years sales experience.  Her business is located in the municipal market, and with what she earns she is able to move forward.  She is requesting a loan to buy more men's and women's clothing at wholesale and have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more wholesale clothing for men and women.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sonita

texts.en:
Sonita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a raising pig business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins.

Sonita has been in this business for nine years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Hui

texts.en:
Hui is a 31-year-old married woman without children and living with her old father.
 
She began to feed and sell pigs eight years ago with her husband. The income from pigs was used to support the family for a happy life, for at that time Hui was pregnant. Unfortunately, she miscarried from her hard work to wrest a living from raising pigs. Since then, she and her husband haven’t had a baby. Hui has been undergoing treatment a long time, and it costs almost all of their savings. This couple wishes that one day they could have a baby in the future.

Because of the bad economic environment this year, the business has not gone well. They can just afford the necessities. Last month, some pigs died without any reason. 

Hui and husband decided to request ￥ 10,000 from Microcred in order to purchase more feed. 

Her dream is to do the pig business if she can save up enough money to do so. She is a very hardworking and honest lady.

loans.use: to purchase more feed.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is a factory worker, age 50. She lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines with her husband and three children. She has been in the service for two years through the aid of CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative*.

Maricar works as a Garment Manufacturing Supervisor. She directly supervises and coordinates the activities of production and operating workers, such as inspectors, precision workers, machine setters and operators, assemblers, fabricators, and plant and system operators. 

One of the main dilemmas of employees like Maricar is the improper balancing of their salaries with family expenses. They have no access to savings or credit, a situation that makes them heavily indebted to usurious money lenders who capture their automated teller machine (ATM) cards as loan collateral. 

For this reason, Maricar is asking for your assistance to prevent her from being exposed to any loan sharks. She has also previously accessed loans through CCT Credit Cooperative and she had no problem in repaying them since the loan payment is being deducted every payday. She looks forward to your positive response, and any amount coming from you will surely be of great help. She will use the loan to pay for the acquisition of land ownership.

Maricar prays to God for her family's everyday guidance and strength especially for her child who is working overseas. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

** CCT staff and volunteers regularly conducts fellowship meeting for the factory workers before starting their daily work routine. Bible readings, prayer devotions and spiritual mentoring and discipleship sessions take place during pre and post working hours and breaks, powering up the lives of both volunteer leaders and line workers.

loans.use: To pay for acquisition and ownership of land.

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en:
Umeda is a skillful woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1982. She is living in a small town of beautiful nature and hospitable residents. She is married and has two children. She is a housekeeper and bringing up her babies. Her husband is in Russia working to earn money to feed their family. 

In order to earn money and help her husband, she decided to ask for help from IMON, who provided her training on how to start a business. She learned a lot and gained enough information to open her business. She decided to serve Tajik woman with eyebrow shaping. She has an experience in shaping eyebrows. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a business of eyebrow shaping

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is living in a village with his parents. He is single. 

He is an active student in classes at university. He is well known among friends and teachers. During his free time he works in agriculture. He supports and helps his parents to feed the family. 

He studies law and wants to be a good lawyer and have permanent work to be useful to the nation. 

He has not money to pay his tuition fee for studies. He requested a loan from Kiva lenders to pay higher education costs. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 39 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming corn in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalinda has been farming corn for six years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 26 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Antonia has been in this business for six years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Antonia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marie Abigael

texts.en:
Marie Abigael is 21 years old and single with one child. Marie Abigael works very hard to provide for her child.

Marie Abigael runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Marie Abigael requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, tea, drinks, spices, coffee, sugar, etc.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, tea, drinks, spices, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy and sell ready to wear  business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to to purchase more clothes, underwear, shorts, t-shirts, etc., to sell.

Mayra has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to to purchase more clothes, underwear, shorts, t-shirts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Haihua

texts.en:
Haihua is a 34-year-old married woman with one child aged 8 who was attends school. 

She has been operating a household supplies shop for two years, on the outskirts of the town. She started selling household supplies on the city outskirts because she wanted to bring services closer to the people in the villages. 

Haihua has been able to make good sales and was able to send her child to school and build herself a decent house since there is less competition in the area where she is located. 

Haihua requested a CNY 20,000 loan so that she can replenish her household supplies shop's working capital which she drained recently as she paid school fees and training fees for her child. 

Her main customers are the local community and outskirts customers. She is affected mainly by the fluctuating prices of materials. 

Her dream is to expand the household supplies shop if her working capital increases so that she can meet her customers' demand.  She describes herself as very hard-working and her honesty has drawn many customers to her.

loans.use: to  replenish her household supplies shop's working capital

loans.name: Mariebia

texts.en:
Mariebia is 30 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Mariebia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years.

In the future, Mariebia would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Josephine has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Josephine has been in this business for eight years. In the future,  she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 35 years old and married with four children. With three children who are still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Myrlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, sugar, etc.

Myrlyn has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spices, sugar, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos en el sector donde ella reside, tiene 2 años de tener el negocio el cual inicio con ayuda de su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con sus padres, ella está solicitando un crédito  para la compra de mas productos como queso, crema, quesillo, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para seguir ayudando a su padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: This young lady, whose face has been blurred out because she is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area, works selling dairy products in the sector where she lives. She has had this business, which she began with the help of her family, for 2 years. She lives in her own house with her parents. She is requesting a loan to buy more products such as cheese, cream, farmer's cheese, etc. so she can make a better income to continue helping her parents with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more products such as cheese, cream, farmer's cheese, etc.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elvie is 29 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elvie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvie has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 52 years old and has five children. She is married.

Lolita is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been in this business for 30 years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 46 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Susan is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins.

Susan has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Милая женщина на фотографии это Фируза. Она мама троих детей и верная жена. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сыновья тоже за приделом республики. Она живет с дочкой и невесткой. Фируза домохозяйка и большую часть времени она проводит дома с дочерью и невесткой. Поэтому Фируза решила не сидеть без дел и начать свой бизнес, чтобы зарабатывать сама на жизнь, потому что она каждый месяц нуждается мужу и сыновьям когда они отправляет ей деньги.  Она хочет взять кредит для купли несколько молодых телят. Фируза хочет разводить крупных скотов. Для начала она закупит, телят покормить их несколько месяцев, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Она просит Вас помочь ей по приобретению телят. Фируза ответственная и целеустремленная женщина. Поддержите ее достичь своих целей!
texts.en: The woman in this photo is Firuza. She is the mother of three children and a faithful wife. Her husband and sons work abroad. She lives with her daughter and daughter-in-law. Firuza is a homemaker and spends a large amount of her time at home with her daughter and daughter-in-law. This is why she decided not to sit at home but to start her own business and earn a living since she must wait every month for her husband and sons to send her money. She wants to take out a loan to purchase a few young calves. Firuza wants to raise cattle. To start she will purchase the calves, feed them for several months, and then sell them at the livestock market. She asks for your help to purchase the calves. Firuza is a responsible and dedicated woman. Help her to achieve her goals!

loans.use: to buy a few young calves and start a new business

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
Dilnoza is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is living in a small city of beautiful nature and hospitable residents. She is married and has one child. 

She was busy with making and selling dried fruits with her mother. She planned to open her own business after a three-day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She got enough basic information about how to start a new business and to succeed. 

She is planning to open a business of making dried fruits, such as apricots, grapes, almonds, nuts, etc., for selling. She is requesting financial support from Kiva lenders to open a business in processing fruits. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders. This business would help Dilnoza to support her husband and feed their family.

loans.use: to open a business in processing dried fruits

loans.name: Jeanilyn

texts.en:
Jeanilyn is 30 years old and married with one child. With one child still in school, Jeanilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jeanilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, spices, rice, sugar and other groceries.

Jeanilyn has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, drinks, noodles, spices, rice, sugar and other groceries.

loans.name: Robie

texts.en:
Robie works hard to support her family. Robie is married and has a rice mill business in the Philippines.

Robie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Robie has been in this business for 3 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teodora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a buy and sell vegetables business. Teodora is borrowing PHP 18,500 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell for her buy and sell rice grains business.

Teodora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and has six children. Remedios is a married woman.

Remedios is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins and other supplies to raise livestock.

Remedios has been in this business for 9 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins and other supllies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Mryna works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Mryna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall for her fruit vending business.

Mryna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise like soups, toilet paper, eggs, soap, shoes, shampoo, and toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es: Don Humberto de 68 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa su hijo ya es independiente, el se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 50 años de dedicarse a es actividad por esa razón posee mucha experiencia, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes fijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, pesticidas y pago de maquinaria agrícola para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mas ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Humberto, age 68, lives in his own home with his wife.  His son lives on his own.  

Humberto works in agriculture, raising corn and beans.  He has been doing this for 50 years, so he has a lot of experience.  He sells his produce in neighboring towns; at this point he has established customers.  

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for agricultural machinery in order to continue with his work.  In this way he can have a higher income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides, and to pay for farming machinery

loans.name: H.a.z Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower for H.A.Z Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Abir is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She started this year selling cosmetics from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of her family. She succeeded in a short period of time in attracting customers. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics to satisfy her customers' special requests. 

Abir is the lady standing in the middle. With respect to the other group members, Zainab is the first lady on the right, and Hanaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.en: Dilovar is a creative woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1985. She is living in a small town of beautiful nature and a hospitable nation. She is married and has three children. Dilovar is a housekeeper and took care of her children alone. Her husband is in Russia, working in order to earn money to feed their family. Dilovar participated in three day trainings provided by IMON to startup clients. She decided to do a business at home serving women by doing manicures, pedicures, etc. She has friends and people she knows who are interested in her services. She asks for a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy needed items and equipment to start a new business. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy needed items and equipment to start a new business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age. Jocelyn has been engaged in native powdered coffee processing and selling for 30 years already. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional coffee beans for her powdered coffee processing business. Jocelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to establish a native coffee outlet, not only in her town, but also in other neighboring places.

loans.use: to purchase additional coffee beans

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Mae is 47 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and other groceries to sell.

Ma. Mae has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Mae aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, coffee, milk and ther groceries to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Susan is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Susan has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Susan has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Loida has been in this business for 10 years. Loida earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Loida has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and she is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feeds.

She supplements this income with earnings from farming rice and food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Isabel dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feeds.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred, 42 years old, is a hardworking married man with 10 children. He is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda. His business is the buying and selling of produce. To supplement his income he also does farming, having been in business since 2000. He started his business to support his family with the basic needs of life. 

He will use the loan to buy coffee for processing to sell. Fred has a challenge of high competition, and he needs to invest a lot of funds so as to sell and earn tangible benefits.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, trabaja cultivando granos básicos como lo son maíz, frijol, y maicillo, además ofrece el servicio de un molino nixtamal en su comunidad, trabaja todos los días sin un horario fijo, don Inés vive con su esposa, sus hijos son independientes, su esposa le ayuda a realizar sus actividades.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para la primera cosecha de maíz en el año, espera ampliar el área de cultivo y obtener cosechas mayores en comparación con las cosechas anteriores.
Sus aspiraciones son mejorar la infraestructura de la vivienda y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
Inés works growing basic crops like corn, beans, and sorghum.  He also provides corn grinding services in his community.  He works every day without a fixed schedule.  Inés lives with his wife.  His children are independent.  His wife helps him with his business activities.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies for the first corn harvest of the year.  He hopes to expand the area that he cultivates and get bigger harvests than previous ones.

His goals are to improve the infrastructure of his house and to repay his debt.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the first corn harvest of the year.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don julio vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas, el se dedica a cultivar la tierra, especialmente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, también realiza trabajos como jornal, se dedica a la actividad agrícola desde hace mas de 30 años inicio con capital propio, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, etc. para asistir sus cultivos de esa manera podrá tener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijas una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio lives in his own home with his three daughters. He works farming the land, especially farming corn and sorghum. He also does work as a day laborer. He has been working in agriculture for more than 30 years. He started with his own capital. 

The client is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc to help with his cultivation. This way he will be able to to have better earnings and give his daughters a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, manure, etc.

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida is 61 years old and is married with five children. Flocerfida works very hard to provide for them.

Flocerfida runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, and other products.

Flocerfida has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, coffee, milk, and other products.

loans.name: Estrella Del Rosario

texts.es:
Estrella, se encuentra muy feliz por el nacimiento de su hija, su familia tiene menos necesidades y sus clientes están satisfechos, ella considera que la buena administración del crédito anterior le ha sido de mucha utilidad para ir progresando.
Como sus gastos familiares han incrementado y necesita mantener su fuente de ingresos con vida, ella requiera de un nuevo préstamo para comprar una plancha más grande que le permita producir más tortillas para cubrir las demandas y generar los ingresos que necesita.
texts.en:
Estrella is very happy about the birth of her daughter. Her family has less necessities and her customers are satisfied. She thinks that good administration of her last loan has been very useful for getting ahead.

As her household expenses have increased, and she needs to maintain her source of income for living expenses, she needs a new loan in order to buy a larger grill which will allow her to make more tortillas to meet the demand in order to generate the income she needs.

loans.use: to buy a larger grill which will allow her to make more tortillas to meet the demand

loans.name: Jose Fernando

texts.es:
José, está teniendo la necesidad de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que eliminara la maleza y sus cultivos de granos básicos tendrán un buen desarrollo, espera tener resultados positivos y continuar trabajando en lo que tanto le gusta.
Con el crédito anterior logro comprar todo lo necesario para preparar el terreno y cultivar maíz y frijol, las cosechas han sido abundantes y le han generados ingresos extras, su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida y no ha tenido inconvenientes para continuar trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en: José needs a new loan to buy agricultural inputs to avoid infestation and have well developed basic grain crops. He hopes to have positive results and continue to work in what he enjoys so much. With the last loan he managed to buy everything he needed to prepare the earth and grow corn and beans. His harvest was abundant which generated extra income. His family has better living conditions and he has no problems continuing to work in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to eliminate infestation and have a well developed basic grain crop.

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres De Tierra Linda Group

texts.es:
Valeriana (la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía de blusa rosada) es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad, es cada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 11 y 22 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Tierra Linda.
Valeriana para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 25 años.
Valeriana es una mujer muy afortunada, porque tiene la dicha de saber elaborar los trajes típicos más preciados de su país, ella ahora requiere de un poco más de capital para poder comprar hilos, jaspeado y lustrina, porque lamentablemente los hilos han subido mucho de precio y con el capital que ella posee no se da abasto.
El gran anhelo de Valeriana es poder remodelar su casa para darle a su familia un mejor hogar.
texts.en:
Valeriana (the first one on the right with a pink blouse in the photo) is 43 years old.  She has a beautiful family with four children between the ages of 11 and 22.  This humble family lives in a community in Tierra Linda.

In order to get her earnings and help her husband with the household expenses, Valeriana buys and sells typical clothing.  She has been engaged in this business activity for 25 years.  Valeriana is a very fortunate woman because she has the gift of knowing how to make the typical outfits that are most valued in her country.

She now needs a little more capital in order to be able to buy different types of thread.  Sadly, the price of the different threads has increased a lot, and she does not have enough money to buy them.

Valeriana’s big wish is to be able to remodel her house in order to give her family a better home.

loans.use: to buy different types of thread to make typical clothing.

loans.name: Paula Lisibel

texts.es:
Paula Lisibel es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su historia:
Mi nombre es Paula  Lisibel, tengo 18 años de edad, vivo con mis padres y hermanas en un humilde sector de la provincia de Puerto Plata, en donde he crecido y mi familia me ha enseñado que todas las cosas son posibles si nuestro esfuerzo es del mismo tamaño que nuestros deseos de lograrlas, sin importar las adversidades que se presenten y los sacrificios que estos impliquen.
 Desde muy pequeña me siento atraída por la medicina porque considero que es una de las profesiones más gratificantes, ya que no hay mayor satisfacción que poder ayudar a los demás y tener la oportunidad de por medio de mis conocimientos mejorar sus padecimientos y ayudarles a preservar la posesión más preciada que poseemos que es la vida. Mi familia no posee los recursos necesarios para costear mi carrera debido a que la única fuente de ingresos proviene de mi padre y el dinero que este produce apenas es suficiente para nuestro sustento, mi madre no trabaja ya que ha sido sometida a varias intervenciones quirúrgicas y su delicado estado de salud se lo impide, razón por la cual la aprobación de este préstamo es no solo necesaria sino también esencial ya que de no obtenerlo no me fuera posible realizar mis estudios.
Los empleos que espero obtener luego de terminados mis estudios universitarios son aquellos que me permitan emplear los conocimientos y habilidades adquiridos y ponerlos en práctica, ya sea en el sector público de salud o en alguna institución privada que me dé la oportunidad de desarrollarme como la médico ejemplar y destacada que deseo ser, mis metas  académicas están basadas en obtener buenas calificaciones por medio de mis habilidades y disciplina, ya que deseo realizar una especialidad médica y las calificaciones obtenidas durante los estudios universitarios son tomadas en cuenta a la hora de elegir los participantes, y  mis metas personales son las de convertirme en ejemplo de superación para mi familia y modelo a seguir de las futuras generaciones, ser una profesional confiada en mis capacidades y conocimientos para que así mis pacientes se sientan seguros al momento de dejar en mis manos su salud y la de sus familiares, tener los ingresos económicos suficientes para así ayudar a mis padres y mejorar su estilo de vida. En este momento el único desafío que se interpone para lograr mis metas es la situación económica de mis padres, ya que me considero una persona capaz de lograr las cosas que me propongo y estoy dispuesta a poner todo mi empeño y esfuerzo para alcanzarlas.
texts.en:
Paula Lisibel is a young medical student. She is asking for a loan to be able to cover her educational expenses.  This is her story:

My name is Paula Lisibel.  I’m 18 years old. I live with my parents and my sisters in a humble part of Puerto Plata province, where I was born.  This is also where my family has taught me that all things are possible if our efforts are as great as our desire to achieve them.  It doesn’t matter what obstacles turn up or the sacrifices they require.

From a very young age, I felt drawn to Medicine because I consider it to be one of the most gratifying professions.  There is no greater satisfaction than being able to help others and to have the opportunity, through my knowledge, to improve their afflictions and help them to maintain the most precious possession we have—life.  My family doesn’t have the financial resources needed to pay for my degree.  Our only source of income is from my father, and it is barely enough for our support.  My mother doesn’t work because she has had to undergo various surgeries and her delicate state of health makes it difficult.  This is the reason to approve this loan.  It is not only necessary but essential; without getting it, it wouldn’t be possible to complete my studies.

The jobs that I hope to get after finishing my university studies are those that will allow me to use my knowledge and skills and put them into practice.  This could be in the public health sector or in a private institution that would give me the opportunity to develop as the exemplary and outstanding physician that I hope to be.  

My academic goals are based in getting good grades through my abilities and self-discipline, because I want to complete a medical specialty and the grades one earns during one’s studies are taken into account when it’s time to select participants.  My personal goals are to become an example of self-improvement for my family and a model for future generations to follow.  I want to be a trusted professional with regards to my capabilities and my knowledge so that my patients feel safe when they put their health (or that of their family members) into my hands.  Finally, I want to earn an income that is sufficient to help my parents and improve their quality of life.  

At this point in time, the only challenge in front of me to achieve my goals is my parents’ financial situation, because I’m thought to be someone who is capable of achieving the things I propose to do, and I am included to put all my efforts and determination to work achieving them.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah is 56 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She operates her own sari-sari store, which she has been doing for six years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month.

Devorah has requested a loan from PMPC, which she will use to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products to sell. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for one year. In the future, Devorah hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Gertrudis

texts.es:
Gertrudis, ha enfrentado serios problemas económicos por lo que no puede mejorar su negocio, es por ello que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar aves de corral, cerdos y concentrado, ampliara su negocio y cuidara de sus animales.
El préstamo anterior en sus inicios fue de mucha ayuda, compra prendas de vestir con modelos actuales, posteriormente las ventas bajaron mucho, pese a la dificultad ha cancelado su deuda, iniciado nuevos rubros y le brinda un estilo de vida más digno a su familia.
texts.en: Gertrudis has encountered serious economic problems so she could not improve her business. It is for that reason she is requesting a new loan to be able to buy poultry, pigs and concentrated feed to expand her business and care for her animals. The previous loan initially was of great help. She bought current fashion clothing. Afterwards her sales dropped a lot. Despite this difficulty she paid off her debt and has started in another direction that provides her family with a more dignified style of living.

loans.use: to buy small animals, pigs and concentrated feed to expand her business and care for her animals.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru: Шаходату 39 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих сыновей. Сыновьям 20 и 11 лет. Муж работает загранице. Шаходат домохозяйка, но сидя дома не сидит без дел и сама зарабатывает, предоставляя услуги портнихи. Она давняя рукодельница, шить и кроить научила ее тетя. Такая работа приносит ей ежедневные средства.  В течение 5 лет пользуется таким ремеслом. Для нее время, проведенное за швейной машинкой, доставляет больше удовольствие. Шаходат шьет подушки. Она берет кредит для расширения бизнеса и увеличения бюджета.  За счет кредитм Шаходат хочет купить  больше ткани, чтобы сшить больше подушки на продажу. Она рассчитывает на Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahodat is 39 years old. She is married and has two sons. Her sons are 20 and 11 years old. Her husband works overseas. 

Shahodat is a homemaker, but she does not merely sit idly at home. She earns a living by offering tailoring services. She has been a seamstress for a long time, having learnt to sew and cut from her aunt. She gets a daily income from doing such work. She has been profiting from this profession for five years. For her, time spent behind the sewing machine gives her the greatest pleasure. 

Shahodat sews pillows. She is taking a loan to expand her business and increase her budget. Shahodat wants to buy more fabric with the loan, so that she can sew more pillows to sell. She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy more fabric in order to sew more pillows.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy and sell cosmetics like perfume, eyeliner, cream and shampoo.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es un hombre de 26 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 6 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rigoberto para que a sus hijos no les haga falta nada trabaja desde hace seis años como destazador de pollos, esta labor le ha permitido a él sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Rigoberto con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha empezado a construir su casa, pero ahora se ha dado cuenta que ya no está dentro de sus capacidades terminar la construcción, porque los precios de los materiales de construcción son muy altos, es por eso que solicita un crédito para poder comprar cemento, arena hierro y terminar la construcción de su casa.
Rigoberto tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguir el crédito para terminar su casa y darles a sus hijos una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a 26-year-old man. He is married and has a lovely family with two children between the ages of 2 and 6. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

Rogoberto has worked for the last six years butchering chickens so that his children will not lack anything. This work has made it possible for him to help them get ahead. Through his efforts at work, Rigoberto has begun construction on his house, but now he realizes that he is unable to finish the construction because of the high prices of materials. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy cement, sand and metal to finish construction of his house.

Rigoberto hopes to obtain the loan to finish his house and give his children a better life.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and metal.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is a 53-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening as his main source of income and also practices farming, where he earns an extra income.

He aspires to develop his farm of cattle into a modern one, but his main setbacks are price fluctuation of the output and cattle diseases.

He is requesting a loan to buy more bulls for fattening at the farm.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening at the farm.

loans.name: Mti Mrefu Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 33 years old, married and has three children who are still schooling. For six years she has been supporting her family by running a genge (grocery stall) selling fruits and vegetables. She is happy since commencing this business because she is now able to help support her family needs. A credit support from Tujijenge, Kiva's partner, supported Joyce to start her business.

This is her third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to replenish her genge with more fruits and vegetables. She has paid back her previous loans successfully. Joyce managed to earn an extra income, which she used to cover household expenses and school fees for her kids. She dreams to be successful in her business.  

She will share this loan with her group Mti Mrefu, which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Joyce will use the current loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her genge.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her grocery stall

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, with great enthusiasm, wants to inform you that the loan assistance which he has previously accessed through CCT has helped him provide for the immediate needs of his family. He was able to support his family and even pay for the funeral expenses of his extended family. He was relieved during those times of test because his financial inadequacy had been filled through your support.

Still, he is facing different challenges everyday but he managed to become strong for his family. He aims to become successful at his chosen field of work and he would love to see their lives progressing along. For this to happen, he would like to request a new loan amounting to 11,000 PHP. He needs to pay the enrollment fee and other educational costs of his children. He wants to give them the best education possible.

Romeo has been working as a factory worker in Carmona, Cavite since 2013 through the aid of Covnenant Community Service Cooperative (through the financial assistance of CCT). He regularly meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every day, and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

loans.use: To pay for his children's upcoming school enrollment.

loans.name: Las Comerciantes Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 4 hijos de 5, 7, 9 y 11 años, y su negocio es la elaboración y venta de queques. 
Ella es buena madre, independiente, generosa, comprensiva, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Sur’ un lugar caracterizado por el crecimiento constante de su población y del comercio en todas las áreas, sitio que agrupa a diferentes culturas y etnias de todo el país. Se encuentra a una altura de 400 metros sobre el nivel del mar. De clima cálido con una humedad relativa y temperaturas medias de 30 grados Centígrados en verano y de 16 grados centígrados en invierno.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que administra (sentada al centro, viste blusa color lila). Su vida la realiza con su esposo que trabaja y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de expandir su negocio la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; taller de soldadura, venta de salteñas, venta de vajillas, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de edredones, servicio de transporte y venta de celulares, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de Queques. El Queque es un bizcocho horneado con harina, huevos, leche y azúcar que se puede comer a cualquier hora solo o acompañado con café o alguna infusión. Negocio que inicio en su hogar, realizando una mínima inversión con la venta de alfajores, queques de vainilla y de chocolate que llevan insumos fáciles de encontrar en el mercado, a medida que recuperaba su capital, invertía en la oferta de postres para sus clientes, “mi negocio crece como bola de nieve, horneo según la cantidad de ingredientes y luego salgo a vender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus horneados son agradables y se pueden comera a cualquier hora, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de ingredientes por mayor. Su sueño es abrir una pastelería, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de varios tipos de harina, azúcar, huevo e insumos necesarios para su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina y otros ingredientes por mayor para hornear variedades de queques y abrir una pastelería.
texts.en:
Maria is a 33 year old woman, she is married and has 4 children aged 7, 9 and 11 years old. Maria has a business making and selling cakes. Maria is a great mother, she is independent, generous, understanding, responsible and hard-working. 

Maria has developed her business in the South zone, a place famous for constant population growth and plenty of commerce. In this region different cultures and ethnicities from all over the country come together. Santa Cruz is situated 400 meters above sea level, with temperate weather, moderate humidity and an average temperature of 30 degrees in Summer and 16 degrees in winter (Celsius). 

Maria has brown eyes, long black hair,she is short and robust. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and her second language is Spanish which she speaks generally and to run her business (Maria is sitting in the center of the photo, wearing a lilac blouse). 

Maria's life revolves around her husband who works and her children who study at school. They live in their own home made from cement and bricks with a calamine roof, they have running water, electricity and sewage. 

The need to expand her business led Maria to join a group of people with businesses such as: a welding workshop, crockery, second-hand clothes, bedding, transport services and cell-phones, to seek a loan and improve their businesses. Maria's business is the making and selling of Queque. Queque is a cake made from flour, eggs, milk and sugar that you can eat at any hour, by itself or with coffee or tea. Maria started this business in her home, with a small investment of money, selling alfajores and vanilla and chocolate cakes, which have ingredients that are easily found in the market. In this way Maria recuperated her capital, and invested in offering desserts to her customers "my business grew like a ball of snow, I baked as much a I could and then went out to sell", Maria says.

The positive of Maria's business is that the cakes are very agreeable and you can eat them anytime of day, the negative is that she lacks the capital to buy wholesale ingredients. Her dream is to open a bakery, Maria wants to buy wholesale: different types of flour, sugar, eggs and the other ingredients she needs for her business. 

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years that she has been involved.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients wholesale in order to bake cakes and open a bakery.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 32 years old, married, and has eight children. She lives in Pagadian. 

Lorena is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to purchase fertilizer. 

In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a 59-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Juditha has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

Juditha has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, utilizo el préstamo anterior para poder trabajar en sus cultivos, las cosechas no han sido las esperadas y por lo que con dificultades cancelo su deuda, toda la familia se encuentra en perfectas condiciones y su deseo por superarse continua vivo.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en los costos de preparación de la tierra para su próxima siembra, con el resto comprara cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, fortalecerá sus actividades esperando tener mejores beneficios.
texts.en:
Franciso used the previous loan to be able to work with his crops. The harvests have not been what was expected and that is why it has been difficult to pay off his debts. The whole family is all doing perfectly and his desire to get ahead is still alive. 

He is asking for a new loan to invest in the preparation of the land for his next planting. With the remainder, he will purchase swine and pig feed to feed them. He will strengthen his work, hoping for better earnings.
