loans.use: to invest in the preparation of the land for his next planting. With the remainder, he will purchase swine and pig feed.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en: Rio is 34 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three children who are of school age. Rio earns a living buying and selling wood and lumber in partnership with her husband, who is the chainsaw operator. The couple earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase additional board feet of coconut, gemelina, and mahogany trees to be processed into lumber for their existing business. Rio has been a member of Kiva's partner, Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, for almost 11 years. In the future, Rio hopes to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase additional board feet of coconut trees, gemelina and mahogany trees

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 37-year-old married mother of four children. She has been making crafts since eleven years ago to help her husband, who traveled outside Lebanon seeking a better income, in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Rania gained experience in this domain from her father since her childhood. She is very creative and has professional skills that helped her attract customers.

Rania is an ambitious lady and sacrificing mother who is trying hard to develop her business and take care of her children during the absence of their father. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary crafts raw materials (cords, ribbons, beads, glue, glitter, etc.), which will allow her to provide her customers with special unique crafts. She also wants to pay for her son's surgery expenses.

Rania wishes her son a long life, as she hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own crafts shop.

loans.use: to buy crafts raw materials (cords, ribbons, beads, glue, glitter, etc.) and pay for her son's surgery expenses.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 48-year-old married mother of four children. She started 25 years ago working in beauty care from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She has professional skills in this domain and succeeded throughout the years in gaining loyal customers. 

As her children are growing up, their needs are increasing, thus she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income to provide her children with a better life. 

Samira hopes to develop her two businesses more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling clothes as a second source of income

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en: Pacita lives in Pagadian and supports her two children by vending in her sari-sari store business. She has applied for another loan, which she used to purchase additional inventory and also as working capital. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and have working capital

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 56 years old and lives in Birayan, Rizal, Philippines. She is married with four children. Cristina has a sari-sari store and has had this business for five years.

She requested a loan to buy two piglets for another source of income.

Cristina has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy two piglets.

loans.name: Litchel

texts.en: Litchel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. Litchel earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Litchel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of a loan from Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening and also earns supplementary income from farming.

He has been able to generate funds and improve his cattle fattening business. He desires to buy a pickup vehicle to help with easy milk supply in various areas, but his capital is not enough.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for fattening to mature quickly for sale.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to mature quickly for sale.

loans.name: Marlene Yanet

texts.es:
Marlene, vive con su hijo único y es acompañada, tiene como negocio la venta de prendas de vestir, calzado, carteras y otros productos, lo hace para tener ingresos con los que subsiste con su familia, aprendió el oficio cuando trabajaba como ayudante, inicio a vender ropa de forma ambulante, poco a poco incluyo otros productos y logro tener su propio local, según sea la temporada vende ambulante, su negocio ya cuenta con más de seis años de estar en el mercado.
Con el crédito piensa comprar faldas, pantalones, camisas, carteras, ropa interior, etc., para tener nuevos productos que sean del agrado de sus clientes, esta inversión le servirá para atraer nuevos clientes, aumentar sus ventas y tener nuevos ingresos  para tener un hogar con menos necesidades.
Sueña con mantener su negocio bien surtido con productos novedosos y con tener recursos económicos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Marlene lives with her partner and child. She has a business selling clothes, underwear, bags and other products. Marlene has this business to make money to support her family, she learnt the work when she had a job as an assistant, and begun by selling on the street. Little by little Marlene sold different products and was able to open her own shop. Her business has now been in the market for over six years. 

With this loan Marlene would like to buy skirts, pants, t-shirts, bags, underwear, etc., to have new products to the liking of her customers. This investment will help her to attract new customers, increase her sales and make some more money and be able to have a home that is less lacking. 

Marlene's dream is to keep her store well stocked with new products and to have enough money to fulfill her obligations.

loans.use: to buy skirts, pants, t-shirts, bags, underwear, etc., to have new products to the liking of her customers.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is the age of 25, a responsible housewife, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the vegetables. 

Therefore, Iram, his wife, has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal vegetables. 

Iram says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for her husband's vegetable shop

loans.name: Tabeeta

texts.en:
Tabeeta is 20 years old, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She maintained her household activities properly. She has been running a beauty salon for the last few years. She is good trained beautician. Due to her efficient and good work, her number of clients increases day by day. So she requires some beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc. 

Therefore Tabeeta made contact with Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC staff visited her enterprise and issued a loan. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy some beauty salon related items such as facial creams, combs, and furniture items like dressing chairs, mirrors, etc.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 52-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started his own business of selling welding material a few years ago. 

Shabana is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, welding rods so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. 

He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. 

Shabana hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more material for her husband's welding shop

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one daughter and two sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. 

For the past many days his rickshaw has not been not working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Saeeda has requested  a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Saeeda is very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover the repair cost of her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Sharifbek

texts.ru: 45 летный житель города Душанбе Шарифбек. Он честный и умный человек. Шарифбек женат и отец одного сына. Его жена домохозяйка, она ведет домашнее хозяйство. Шарифбек сам предоставляет услуги такси. Он служит людям и получает денег, чтобы покормить свою семью. Еще он каждый вечер после работы перевозит овощи из районах, и утром перепродает их оптом на рынке.  Вот так Шарифбек старается, чтобы обеспечить и улучшить условия жизни семьи. Сейчас он нуждается за кредитом, чтобы отремонтировать свою автомашину. С помощью машины он зарабатывает на жизнь. Он не хочет потерять источник дохода. На оставшуюся часть денег он хочет, перевозит больше овощи на продажу. Шарифбек верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Sharifbek is a 45-year-old resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is an honest and smart person. Sharifbek is married and a father of one son. His wife is a homemaker and takes care of the household. Sharifbek provides taxi services. He serves people and earns money to provide for his family. He also transports vegetables from the districts every evening after work and resells them wholesale at a market in the mornings. This is how hard Sharifbek tries to provide and improve his family's life. Now he needs a loan to repair his car. He earns a living with the help of this car and does not want to lose his source of income. He wants to use the remainder of the money to bring in more vegetables for resale. Sharifbek believes in You and You support.

loans.use: to repair his car and also bring in more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia lives at Piat with her family. She is 47 years old now and she is married. She manages a small restaurant offering daily meals and snacks to the people in her village. 

Amalia's income goes for school expenses, meals and other bills at home. The other part of her income was also used as revolving capital in her business. 

Amalia is requesting a loan of P15,000 in order to improve her business. She will buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks and ingredients for the food business. This will help enhance her food business. 

She hopes to continue offering delicious food with good services as well.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks and ingredients for the food business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is from Pagadian. She makes and vends garlands for a living. She is 62 years old and has four children.

In 2009, she became a member of PMPC. She used her loan to purchase materials for making garlands. Her business helps and supports her family’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making garlands.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vevenciana

texts.en:
Retailing helped Vevenciana survive for the family. She has a sari-sari store business.

Vevenciana plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan from PMPC to buy a variety of commodities. She wants to display more canned goods, noodles, milk, sugar, and oil.

Vevenciana smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is driven by passion in selling. At the age of 27, a widow in Pagadian, she runs a store that primarily supports their family. Every day, she never gets tired of tending her store.

Marilyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default. Now, she borrowed another loan to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell. Having enough inventory would mean income opportunities.

In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for inventory of sugar, milk, oil, and noodles to sell.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 40, a responsible housewife, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruits at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this fruit shop. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales out of the fruits. Therefore his wife, Parveen, requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal fruits. 

Parveen thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit for her husband's shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring for and harvesting, and earning income as well. Rosita has supported her husband doing this type of work.

Like a farmer, Rosita has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she could always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for seedlings and compost.

Someday, Rosita hopes to purchase another plot of banana land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to pay for seedlings and compost.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Menchie

texts.en:
Availing loans has been a typical practice for small business entrepreneurs like Menchie. You can never improve your business without getting into credit, unless you have enough capital or investments. Menchie has paid all her loans availed through CCT, and she is very confident about applying for new ones.

She would now like to request a PHP 15,000 loan. Just as she did with her previous loans, she will buy assorted grocery items, more toiletry products, and beverages to increase her income from her sari-sari store. She believes that you will not fail to meet her request. Once she gets the assistance, she assures you that she will repay you in due time.

Menchie aims to send her children to the best schools that will give them quality education. She dreams of business expansion and continuously flourishing profit. She is an active community partner of CCT. She meets with her fellowship group* every Thursday.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, bricks, iron, and a flush toilet to build a water storage tank and restroom.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is the age of 44 and a responsible housewife, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a vegetable shop and has been selling fresh vegetables for many years. He offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop.

Nowadays, the needs of his family suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So, he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables.

Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more seasonal vegetables. Nasreen says thank you to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's vegetable sale business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen used her previous loan to purchase additional fish like bangus, tilapia, and tulingan. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Helen is requesting another loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish, ingredients, and other supplies for her grill business. By offering more items for sale, her customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Helen to sustain her family's needs.

Helen hopes to expand her business in the following years. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fish, charcoal, and ingredients for grilling.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a 45-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one son and two daughters. 

Jameela's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last six years. For many days his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. For this reason, he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

Her husband wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Jameela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Jameela is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Emery

texts.en:
Emery is a 48 years old, married and has three children. She engaged in a piggery business, raising pigs to sell in the market. 

She want to increase her income for her family, so she decided to take a loan again to buy feed for the pigs. This will help her to raise high quality pigs and increase the income she can earn from selling the pigs. 

Emery's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: To buy feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Manizha

texts.en:
Manizha is a cheerful girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in small town of blossoming nature and hospitable nationality. She is single. She is a goal oriented, responsible and confident person. 

Manizha appealed to IMON and participated in start-up training to learn how to do business. She wants to open a beauty salon and start doing business to help her parents and to live better. She requests a loan from Kiva lenders to buy equipment and items for serving women in her beauty salon. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy equipment and items for serving women in her beauty salon

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah city. He is an employee at a local firm, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family needs. 

Ayman would like to improve himself, so he decided to register at the university to get a higher education degree. He is now a student studying elementary education.

Ayman took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ayman will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Ayman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Maida es una mujer de 46 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 18 años, y su negocio es la venta de horneados tradicionales.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, comprometida con su trabajo, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla de forma ambulante en la localidad de ‘El Torno’ que se encuentra ubicado a 32 kilómetros al sudoeste de la ciudad, considerado capital de los cítricos, tiene una producción citrícola de 5 mil hectáreas. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-24 grados centígrados. 
Maida es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo hasta la altura de los hombros, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza (al centro, sentada en la silla). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como transportista y con su hijo que acaba de terminar la escuela, trabaja y se prepara para estudiar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos la impulsó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de queso, venta de leche, servicio de moto taxi, venta de refrescos hervidos tradicionales, venta de ropa de segunda mano, panadería, venta de frutas y venta de comida, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su trabajo es la venta de horneados tradicionales como el cuñapé, que es un panecillo hecho a base de queso y harina de yuca, es de tamaño pequeño y se suele acompañar a media mañana y media tarde con cualquier bebida caliente o consumido solo, “En mi tierra, a partir de las cinco de la tarde, después de la hora de la siesta, se comen las masitas acompañadas por un café batido…”, comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los clientes tienen por costumbre comer masas horneadas de este tipo, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de harina, queso y otros ingredientes. Su sueño es abrir una panadería, ella desea realiza la compra de diferentes tipos de harina, queso, levadura, leche y otros ingredientes, por mayor, para aumentar la producción de su horno y vender mayor cantidad. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maida solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina y otros insumos por mayor para hornear masitas y abrir una panadería.
texts.en:
Maida is a 46-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has an 18-year-old son. Her business is selling traditional baked goods. She is a good mother, enterprising, optimistic, has a good attitude, committed to her work, responsible, and hard working. 

She is a street vendor in the area of “El Torno,” which is located 32 kilometers southeast of the city and is consider the capital of citrus fruits. The area has a production of citrus fruits of 5,000 hectares. The area has a sub-tropical climate, with a temperature that varies during the day between 18 and 24 degrees Celsius.

Maida has brown skin, brown eyes, long black hair that falls to her shoulders, a short stature, and a medium physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family; she speaks Spanish for daily life and for her work. In the photo, she is in the middle, seated on the chair.

She shares her life with her partner, who works as a driver, and with her son, who just finished school, work, and prepares to study. They live in their own room, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof. The home has electricity and well water, which is extracted with an electric pump. They do not have indoor plumbing. 

The need to grow her business to improve her income drove her to lead a loan group with people who have businesses such as selling cheese, selling milk, providing motortaxi services, selling traditional drinks, selling second-hand clothing, running a bakery, selling fruit, and selling food. The group requests a loan to improve their businesses. 

Her work is selling traditional baked goods, such as “cuñapé,” which is a bread roll made from cheese and yucca flour; it is small and is usually eaten mid-day and mid-afternoon, with a hot drink or by itself. She says that in her land, from 5 in the afternoon (after the afternoon nap), the small pastries are eaten, accompanied by a frothy coffee. The advantage of her business is that the clients have a habit of eating baked pastries of this kind. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to buy flour, cheese, and other ingredients. 

Her dream is to open a bakery. She wants to buy different types of flour, cheese, yeast, milk, and other ingredients wholesale to increase her production and sell more pastries. This is her third sequence of loan with the institution in the four years that she has been doing this work.

It is for these reasons that Maida requests a loan to buy flour and other supplies wholesale to bake more small pastrics and open a bakery.

loans.use: to buy flour and other supplies wholesale to bake more small pastries and open a bakery.

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es:
Isabela es una mujer de 33 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijas de las edades entre 8 y 13 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad Chichicastenango.
Isabela con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace 8 años ella eligió esta labor pues es a lo que se dedicaba toda su familia.
Isabela es una mujer digna de admirar porque se esfuerza día con día para superarse, ella junto a su esposo han empezado a construir su casa, pero lamentablemente ahora ellos ya no cuentan con más recursos para terminar la construcción, entonces Isabela decidió solicitar un prestamo para comparar, cemento, cal, arena, hierro para poder finalizar la construcción.
  El gran sueño de Isabela es terminar de construir su casa para darles una mejor vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Isabela is a 33-year-old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with three daughters, who are between 8 and 13 years old. This beautiful family lives in the community of Chichicastenango.

Isabela has the desire to generate an income and take her family forward. She has been dedicated to making traditional clothing for 8 years. She decided to do this work because it is what her family does. 

Isabela is a worthy woman, who is admired because of her daily efforts to improve herself. She and her husband have started to build their home, but unfortunately, they don’t have enough resources to finish the construction. As a result, Isabela decided to request a loan to buy cement, quicklime, sand, and iron to be able to complete the construction.

Isabela’s biggest dream is to finish building her home to give a better life to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy cement, quicklime, sand, and iron to finish the construction of her home.

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.es:
María, se dedica a desarrollar labores domésticas así como también a la crianza de ganado, cerdos y cultivo de granos básicos, es casada, actualmente vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos, los demás ya están casados y son independientes, gusta mucho de realizar sus actividades económicas y las práctica desde siempre, es así como obtiene ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, su esposo y su hijo le ayudan en el negocio.
Está solicitando un crédito para comprar concentrado para el ganado y los cerdos, también invertirá en la preparación del terreno para cultivar granos básicos, piensa que así fortalecerá su negocio y mejorara la situación financiera familiar.
Aspira con tener mejores cosechas y vender los animales a un mejor precio para recuperar la inversión y cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
María works doing domestic duties as well as raising cattle, pigs and growing basic grains. She is married and lives with her husband and one of her children. The other are now adults and married. She enjoys doing her economic activities and has always been doing them. It is how she obtains income to cover the family expenses. Her husband and son help her with the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed for the cattle and pigs as well as investing in preparing the land to grow basic grains. She thinks this will strengthen her business and improve the family's financial situation. She hopes to have better harvests and sell her animals at higher prices to recover her investment and pay her debt.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed for her cattle and pigs and also invest in preparing the land to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Seema

texts.en:
Seema is 35 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her son has owned a vegetable business for many years. He purchases fresh and seasonal vegetables daily from the main market at wholesale prices and sells them from his vegetable shop on retail. He generates a reasonable profit, as he is an honest enough businessman. He manages household necessities from his earnings through this vegetable business. He speaks with a tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He wants to increase his vegetable stock on a daily basis. Therefore, his mother Seema made contact to BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, for a loan. In this way she can support to her son's business. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase in her son's vegetable sales business

loans.name: Noshaba

texts.en:
Noshaba is a 45-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five daughters and three sons, and her husband has been running his own business of meat for the past 10 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household.

Noshaba's husband wants to purchase animals for his meat business, but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore, Noshaba has requested a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his meat business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

Noshaba is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to grow her husband's meat business

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is 43 years old with three children. As much as possible, she has to have all the needed commodities for her snack vending business.  

In the future, she dreams of renting a place where she can comfortably vend her food to have higher daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, oil, and other ingredients for her snack vending business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot for farming to increase the harvest to earn more income.

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy operates a parlor business. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To continue his business, he availed a loan to purchase scissors, powder, and chemicals for his beauty parlor business. He dreams to have an extension of his salon.

loans.use: To purchase scissors, powder, and chemicals for his beauty parlor business

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Osias Jr.

texts.en:
Osias is 36 years old and lives in Guintomoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children now at school age. 

Osias earns his living from hog fattening and other agri-farming business. He’s been in the business for five years already and is earning an average monthly income of PHP 3,500 doing this type of business. He has requested a loan to purchase an additional three piglets, as well as feed and vitamins for his hog fattening business. 

Osias has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Osias hopes to expand his hog fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase an additional three piglets, as well as feed and vitamins

loans.name: Walter Alexi

texts.es:
Walter, realiza la siembra de maíz y frijol para alimentar a su familia y vender otra parte para tener ingresos con los que puede cubrir las necesidades de su hogar, lo hace de manera independiente desde hace 4 años, sus padres son agricultores y con su ayuda don Walter aprendió el oficio, su familia la formo hace dos años, vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos.
Comprará abono, herbicidas, semillas y pagara los costos que implican preparar el terreno para realizar la siembra de maíz y frijol, tendrá a su disposición todos los materiales para seguir trabajando la tierra y tener nuevas ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir mejorando su negocio y hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para que su familia viva en un mejor entorno.
texts.en:
Walter grows corn and beans to feed his family, and he sells the rest of the crop to have an income with which he can cover his household’s needs. He has done this independently for 4 years. His parents were farmer, and with their help, Walter learned the work. He started his family two years ago; he lives with his wife and their two children.

He will buy manure, herbicides, and seeds and will pay for the costs involved in preparing the land to grow corn and beans. He will then have at his disposal all of the materials to continue working the land and to have new earnings.

His goals are to continue improving his business and to make improvements to his home, so that his family can live in a good environment.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and seeds and to pay the costs involved in preparing the land to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Nazra

texts.en:
Nazra is the age of 45 and lives in Lahore with her husband and four children.

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has been using salon instruments for many years, wearing out the instruments, so they need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy them.

Due to her husband’s low purchasing power, Nazra requested a loan so that her husband can become empowered and he can easily buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair.

Nazra hopes that this loan will work positively and that she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. Nazra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, front mirror and revolving chair, for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 27-year-old single man from Rafah city. He is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income that is barely enough to cover all his family's needs. Shadi would like to improve himself so he registered at the university to earn a higher education degree.
Shadi now is a student studying business administration.
Shadi took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. With this loan, Shadi will be able to do his homework and reports easily.
Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies..

loans.name: Shohida

texts.en:
Shohida is a bright woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is living in a small city of pretty nature and generous and warm people. She is married and has two children. She is a responsible, honest and patience person. They live in poverty, and her husband went to Russia to earn money to feed their family. 

Shohida wants to ensure her children are fully supported, so she has decided to open a business. She participated in training provided by IMON to start-up clients and plans to serve Tajik women with traditional women's dresses. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy a sewing machine and start doing business. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and start doing business

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer, 38, is a father of two children. He has a motorcycle transport business to support his family and his wife works as a private employee. He wants to earn more income and serve more passengers. Elmer needs financial assistance to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance so he decided to take out a loan. 

Elmer's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador de 65 años de edad que vive junto a su compañera de vida  en casa propia la cual lograron construir hace 11 años. Prestando sus servicios domésticos y de mantenimiento se gana la vida, obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos que le permiten sostener la economía de su hogar. José desea realizar la instalación de aguas negras en su vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con ellas, y la contaminación que esto causa ha empezado a causar enfermedades a su compañera de vida y a el mismo, por lo que su preocupación es muy grande, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, tuberías y mano de obra especializada para instalar aguas negras en su vivienda evitando la contaminación actual.
texts.en:
José is a hard-working 65 year old man who lives with his life companion in his own house which he manged to build 11 years ago. He makes a living offering his domestic and maintainable services. He earns good economic income which allows him to sustain the household economy.

José wants to install sewage in his house as he doesn't have it at present and the contamination that this causes has started to make his life companion and himself sick and he is very worried about this. So he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, tubing and specialized labor to install sewage in his house to avoid the current contamination.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, tubing and pay for specialized labor to install sewage at his house.

loans.name: Madvani Nakulabye Group

texts.en:
The members here belong to Madvani Nakulabye Group in Rubaga Road, Uganda. Fred, a 40-year-old married man, is the group's chairperson. He has four children, all in school. To meet the family's financial obligations, Fred started a roadside food stall for his wife. His initial capital was small, but it is able to supplement his limited income from his boda boda (motrcycle taxi) business.
He joined the Madvani Nakulabye Group to help him save and also to borrow money since he has no collateral. He will use the loan of UGX 500,000 to buy green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, cabbage and onions to boost his wife's food-stall business. This will help raise their profit and income. His dream is to educate all his children. He is hard working and innovative. The group appreciates the financial boost from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy green bananas, irish potatoes, and vegetables for his wife's food-stall business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a proud United States Navy Veteran. After retiring from service, Nancy decided to start a small business installing glass tinting on homes. For years, she managed the business, which generated enough profit to cover her family’s living expenses and a bit more that she put away for retirement. After the recession hit, Nancy struggled to generate enough business to keep the doors open. She eventually lost every penny she saved and was forced into bankruptcy. Fortunately, Nancy was able to keep her home through re-financing and directing most of the household funds towards the mortgage. Nancy’s dream is to be able to save money for retirement so that she will not be a burden to her children in later years. Although Nancy has recovered well after a major setback, she still needs some help. While the business has begun to generate profit once again, it does not generate much more than what is needed to cover basic living expenses; therefore, she does not have enough funds to cover some much needed repairs for her home. With the summer months fast approaching, her major concern is a non-functioning air conditioner.  The unit is very old and inefficient, but she could not possibly finance the unit through a bank or repair company due to her damaged credit and bankruptcy. 

Nancy is hoping that she will be able to finance a high efficiency air conditioner to improve the livability of their home and save money on energy bills.

loans.use: to finance a high efficiency air conditioner to improve the livability of their home and save money on energy bills.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income, so this income barely covers all the family needs. 

Mohammad would like to improve himself so he decided to register in the university to take a higher education degree. He now is a student where he studies health management.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. by taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his home works and reports easily  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his university studies in health management

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in a small town of blossoming nature and where a hospitable population lives. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a constructor.

She works hard and tries to earn money to feed their family. She is a teacher at a secondary school, and in her free time she keeps and feeds livestock to further sell. In her town, the average salary that she earns is not enough for food and clothing expenditures. That is why she has to work and earn money to ensure her children live better.

She wished to start a new business. She considers that there is an opportunity to do a business of processing dry fruits. It would help her live better and have time to spend with her children. She also participated in startup training, where she got information on how to do business successfully.

Now, she is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fruits and process them into dry fruits for sale.

loans.use: to buy fruits and process them into dry fruits for sale.

loans.name: Julynda

texts.en:
Julynda is 39 years old, married and has two children to provide for. She wants to help her husband in providing for their family needs.  She is engaged in a fish vending business. Her nature of business is to sell fish to the market and also in her neighborhood. 

She aims to increase to increase her income and to make this happen.  She and her husband need to catch more fish to sell in the market and to have more sales. She needs a financial assistance to buy materials for their fishnet repair, so she took a loan for this.

Julynda plans for the future to buy a fishing boat for fishing.

loans.use: To buy materials for fishnet repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks like chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar and pay for her mortgage

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en:
Shoira is a serious woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is living in small city with beautiful scenery each season. She is a widow and has two children. She has 18 years experience working at secondary school as a teacher. She is a teacher of math. She is well known among teachers and friends. 

She was a participant in Startup training provided by IMON to its clients. She learned how to start a business and succeed. She had a plan to open additional classes (lessons) in math to students individually. She wants to get a loan to start doing business of teaching additional lessons to students. It is useful to educate students who desire to learn more. 

Shoira awaits KIVA lenders kindness.

loans.use: to start doing business in teaching math as additional lessons to students

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela, 45, is a married woman with eight children, of whom four are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Angela has a fishing business in the Philippines. Angela requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Angela has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Angela would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new engine for her fishing boat, to be able to continue sending her children to school

loans.name: Mrs. Sarom ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Sarom was selected to be the group leader for a loan that was requested from Maxima. In the group there are three members and they live in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Sarom  (pictured) is 49 years old. She lives at Meanchey district,Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She had been married since 1983, has three sons and five daughters. Two are married, two are garment factory workers and the others are attending school.

Sarom has been a weaver for 6 years, while her husband has been a motor-taxi driver for 4 years.  She is applying for a loan to buy fabrics to make rugs and also groceries for sale.
The other group member included Mrs.Sinat has been a seller and Mrs. Samoeun has been a seller too.
Sarom is next to her husband with the other group members.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to make rugs and also groceries for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' demand

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: Veronica de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene más de 25 años de dedicarse a esa actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, vende sus cosechas en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Veronica is 41 years old. She lives in her own home with her husband. 

She cultivates corn and sorghum. She started with her own capital and has been doing this work for more than 25 years. She sells her crops around the area where she lives. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seed, fertilizers, pest control, etc. to improve the field shown in the photograph so she can continue sowing and thus have better income.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers, pest control, etc. to improve the field where she grows her crops

loans.name: Classic Group

texts.en:
Prisca is a businesswoman dreaming of managing a nice and classic restaurant in her town. She is currently managing a mamalishe business, cooking several foods: ugali, rice with beans, vegetables, meat, and fruits. She also sells tea to her customers. She has been in this service for seven years now, working from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 p.m. She is really working hard and receives a very small profit per month.

Business working capital to enable Prisca to cook more types of food, have a nice business place, seats, and clean water is the problem, and it is difficult to reach more people in her business.

Prisca is 43 years old, a widow, and blessed with a boy and girl who are in school. She needs support, both financial and educational, to make her dreams come true.

Prisca approached Tujijenge Tanzania, Kiva's partner, and this is her eighth credit. She used the previous credits, paid back successfully, to buy bricks with which she expects to build a house for her family. She also bought business inventory: kilos of rice, maize and baking flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She is now able to maintain her business demand, since cooking items are available for her store. Prisca received an extra income, which she used to pay rent for the business place and to cover family welfare.

With this credit request, Prisca will buy food cooking ingredients: liters of cooking oil, rice, maize and baking flour, vegetables, sugar, and others.

She will share this loan with her group, "Classic", which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients: litres of cooking oil, rice, maize and baking flour, vegetables, sugar, and others.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Cherry is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional baskets of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Cherry has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of fish to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a sixty-year-old second hand clothes dealer in Mariakani Kenya. She is the married mother of five adults, whose husband provides additional income.  She has been in business for the last twenty years and is doing great.

This marks her fifth borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase bales of second hand clothes, ladies bags and shoes and the anticipated profit to service her loan, she hopes to open several outlets for second hand clothes in coast region in future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes, ladies bags and shoes, to enable her business to expand

loans.name: Neelam

texts.en:
Neelam is 27 years old, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of 2 children. Her husband has been running a property business for the past 10 years, to fulfill the needs of his entire family and manage the household.

Neelam's husband wants to purchase property in different areas to fulfill the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints her he is not in the position to buy these properties for reselling purpose. To fulfill his business needs Neelam has applied for Kiva Loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy property to fulfill his business needs. This will also helpful for him to increase his daily sales and earn more profitable income to manage the business and family's needs.

Neelam is very happy and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's expanding property business

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 58 years old and married with four children. Angelita works very hard to provide for them.

Angelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, drinks, coffee, spices and other personal care products.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, drinks, coffee, spices and other personal care products

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 57 years old and married with nine children, three of whom in school, Conchita  works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like chips, milk coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Conchita  has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like chips, milk, coffee, eggs, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Angeela

texts.en:
Angeela is the age of 30, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a motorcycle mechanic by profession; he repairs and troubleshoots the motorbikes. He has been doing this business for many years. He provides the services nearby to his hometown. Mostly people who have bikes like him to repair their bikes.

He has been running this business for many years and using very expensive tools for repairing, which have depreciated. He wants to replace these tools with new ones, but he does not have money to buy new tools.

Therefore, Angeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy new motorbike repair tools and some spare parts for repairing motorbikes.

Angeela says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband's motorbike repair shop.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad was born in 1975. He is married and has one child. Zeyad has been running his own gas distribution store for many years ago. He started his project to distribute a small quantity of gas tanks for cooking uses. 

Now, he wants expand his project and to raise his profit to be able to cover his only son's needs and to provide him with the best education, by buying a larger quantity of gas tanks. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of gas tanks for cooking use, to be able to fund his son's studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1981. He is married and has two kids living with his family, in a sector in Amman. He decided to improve the standards of living for his family by running his internet cafe. 

Now he wants to stock his cafe with a larger quantity of services, in order to raise his sales and profit, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he has applied for this loan.  He needs your support to achieve his dreams to have many branches and to expand his work.

loans.use: To stock his internet cafe with a larger quantity of services, in order to raise his sales

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance expenses on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to maintain his taxi. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Shamim's husband can afford the maintenance expenses easily and provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Shamim also plans to save some of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her husband's taxi

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 41-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married and supports five people in his family. He has been blessed with three children who are three, six, and 10 years old.

He provides motorbike transportation, a business he has been doing for the last five years. It generates a monthly income of 18,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund, which he will use to purchase a new motorbike in order to support his family and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for eight years. Her husband is responsible to provide for the needs of the entire family. He needs to perform maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance expenses on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to pay for the maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Sumaira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Sumaira's husband can afford the maintenance expenses easily and provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Sumaira also plans to save some of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. Sumaira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Bibioysha

texts.en: Bibioysha is 31 years old, married and  lives with her family in the Qubadiyon district. Her children are minors and their living conditions are not good, which is why her husband has gone to Russia as a migrant worker. While he is away, Bibioysha runs a small farm where she grows many kinds of vegetables that she can sell in the local market. She has been doing this for two years and is requesting this loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. She is grateful for any help that Kiva lenders can provide.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Two years ago, Mohammad decided to start his own business, which is a store that sells clothes. This is the only source of income for the family.
 
Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of women's clothing for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of women's clothing

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es: Andrés de 38 años de edad se dedica a la apicultura (producción de miel de abeja) desde hace 6 años comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de azúcar y cambiar las colmenas que muestra en la fotografía y asi continuar con su trabajo para generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Andrés, 38 years old, makes a living by beekeeping (production of honey). For 6 years, he has sold his products in different markets located close to his house. With what he earns from his sales he is able to pay off some household expenses. He is requesting a loan to purchase sugar and change the beehives shown in the photograph, and therefore continue with his work in order to generate a better income.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and change the beehives.

loans.name: Moisesa

texts.en: Moisesa lives in Alegria, Cebu with her family. She is married and the mother of six children who range in age from two to eighteen. She sells various food items for income, including cabbages, spring onions, tomatoes, dried fish, bananas, seasonings and eggplant. She also sells trendy clothes to her neighbors. Moisesa is asking for this loan to buy more items to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more successful.

loans.use: to buy items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to do maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Azra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Azra's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Azra  also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Azra is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Greta

texts.en: Greta is 42 years old and she lives with her two sons in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. Greta’s husband is abroad and works in Russian Federation and from there he transfers money for his family needs. Greta has the specialty of musician but she never managed to work in this field. For several years she worked in textile fabric as a tailor. Now her only occupation is farming and agriculture. In the farm Greta has cows, a calf, pigs, sheep and chickens. She sells her farm products (milk, cheese, curd, meat and eggs) from her house to her regular customers and neighbors.  Greta’s sons are still school-aged and they perfectly help their mother in farming and also in potato cultivation. Greta wants to enlarge the number of her farm cattle and it will also enlarge the number of her farm products. She will use this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of one more cow and also a lot of fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of one more cow and also a lot of fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.en: Fravia leads this loan group. She is 52, married and the mother of six children who range in age from 2 to 27 years old. Four of them go to school. The group is called UBUMWE, which means “Unity” in English. They sell different products and wish to expand their business so they can improve their lives and have a better future. Fravia earns a living by selling food stuffs and has been in a business for the past 15 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, cassava and beans to sell. The profits from this business will allow her to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum, cassava and beans to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 33-year-old, single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a simple house. A few years ago, Mohammad decided to start his own business, which is a store for selling clothes. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new collection of children's clothing for his store. This will increase his sales and also his income. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's clothing for his store.

loans.name: Helma

texts.en:
She is Helma, a very enthusiastic entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City. As seen in the photo, she is proud to present to you her very own tailor-made products. These are just few of what she needs to produce every week and she needs more supplies for business to cater to all of her clients' demands.

Back-to-school season is just a few more weeks ahead and the demand for uniforms will be large. Helma will be expecting more customers in the coming days, so she would like to ask for your help. She will need to purchase more fabric, thread, needles and other items needed in her business. This is why she is asking for loan assistance amounting to 25,000 PHP. She hopes that you will consider this request and she would gladly appreciate any amount coming from you.

Helma unceasingly prays for sustaining strength and good health in every day. She also wants to have business expansion in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional sewing tools and accessories like fabric, needles, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is 35 years old, single and the mother of four children who lives in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and works very hard to look after her family, especially to ensure that her children attend school. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the previous loan she got because she used it to expand her business. Despite her success, she usually has to inject more funds into her business to serve customers' increasing demands and transform it into a wholesale operation. She wants a loan to buy general merchandise like soap, sugar and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, vive con sus hijos, pero ellos ya no dependen de ella y todos colaboran para cubrir los gastos del hogar, tiene cuatro años de vender ropa, ya es muy reconocida en su localidad por el buen servicio y productos de calidad que les ofrece a sus clientes.
Invertirá en camisas, vestidos, chores, faldas, blusas y otro tipo de prendas de vestir para que sea fácil mantener a sus clientes satisfechos, el objetivo de la compra es aumentar sus ingresos y disminuir las necesidades existentes en su hogar.
Adela sueña con tenar un negocio más competitivo, disminuir sus deudas y tener un nuevo estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Adela lives with her children, but they do not depend on her anymore. They all contribute to cover the household expenses. She has been selling clothing for four years and she is very well known in her neighborhood for the good service and the quality of the products she offers to customers.

She will buy shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, blouses and other types of clothing, so she can keep her customers happy. The reason for the purchase is to increase her income and reduce the existing needs in the home.

Adela hopes to have a more competitive business, to lessen her debts and to have a new home life.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, shorts, skirts, blouses and other types of clothing, so she can keep her customers happy.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en:
Dilafruz is a generous girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is living with her family in small town, with fresh nature and hospitable residents. She is single and studies at the university. 

During her weekends, she is interested in sewing traditional women's dresses. She has experience in sewing and her friends are likely to order a dress from her. She participated at a three day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She received enough information and learned how to start a business and work to have success development.  

She is planning to get a loan from IMON and Kiva lenders to buy a computerized sewing machine and starts to get orders for sewing traditional women's dresses at home. Her friends are interested to be her clients, because she sews modern style and prettily designed dresses. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a computer generated sewing machine to start to get orders for sewing traditional women's dresses at home

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 30-years-old married man from Khan Younis city.  He lives with his wife and two kids in a simple house.  A few months ago, Mohammad decided to start his own business which is a stall for selling clothes. This is the only source of income to the family. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new collection of kids clothing for his stall.  This will increase his sales and also his income.   Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new collection of kid's clothing for his stall

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira is a confident woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1991. She is living in a small town with beautiful seasons. She is divorced and has a child. After some difficulties in her life, she wanted to start a business to ensure her child would have all of life's necessities while growing up. Samira's mother helped her start the business. IMON supported her in a difficult period of her life and trained her how to start a new business and succeed. She has a business of sewing traditional women's dresses. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a computerized sewing machine. She hopes to succeed with her business as a tailor so she can feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. 

Christine sells used shoes at the market, both retail and wholesale. She serves all kind of people. She has been in this business for the last five years and works seven days a week. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Christine has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used shoes. 

She would like to build a residential house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy bales of used shoes

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is a 34-year-old single man responsible for taking care of three dependents in Masindi, Uganda. He is a reverend father whose businesses are piggery and crop production, growing mainly sugar cane and ground nuts. He is a hard-working man and loves his businesses. He hopes to to develop his businesses further and fully explore the local market despite being affected by unpredictable climatic changes.  Alexander intends to use the loan to buy more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for his farm to sell.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
This nice and cheerful lady’s name is Nune and she lives in the village Arzumanyan of the Syunik region. Nune has no higher education. Several years she worked at the factory as a worker but now she is skilled farmer, who perfectly manages her farm work. In her farm she has cows, chickens and a lot of bee coloniea. 

Nune cares of her farm with great pleasure, but as she mentions bee keeping and honey production is the most interesting for her. During the years she mentions that she taught all the skills and details of this occupation and, as a result she always manages to have very testy and healing honey. The quantity of her farm’s honey is great but the number of her customers is even greater, so that she manages to sell it only to her regular customers. She sells her farm’s honey with her farm milk and eggs.  Nune also has an orchard which gives her harvests of apples, apricots, pears and peaches which she sells locally . 

Nune is married and she has two children. This loan of 700.000 Armenian drams she asks as she wants to buy fodder for her chickens, also wax papers and special medicine for her bees.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her chickens, also wax papers and special medicine for her bees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell in his shop, like soda, cooking oil and maize.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a third-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, applying for a loan of UGX 3,000,000. He is a married father of two preschool children. Stanley is a special hire driver and has been able to save some money to purchase a small piece of land. He is building a small house on the land but got stuck along the way and decided to put a roof over only two rooms that he is now occupying with his family. The two rooms are in good condition as can be seen in the photo.
He opted to borrow money to plaster the two rooms and also have the other rooms completed. He wants to gradually have the whole house fully constructed with the help of other loans from UGAFODE. He appreciates the services of UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdallah is a fourth time borrower and is applying for a loan of UGX1,000,000.   Abdallah is a married young man with two children. He rents a small two roomed house in the outskirts of the city. 

Abdallah is a businessman in one of the markets in the neighbourhood of his residential area.  He mainly deals in the selling of avocados and Irish potatoes. Abdallah's working capital is still small, this is his main challenge. He applied for the loan to use to go to a village and purchase bags of Irish potatoes that are in high demand in the market. This high demand is mainly because many of the residents of the area are university students who consume more fast foods in the form of french fries.

He hopes to work very hard and be able to expand his business and also save some to acquire a piece of land.

loans.use: To boost his Irish potato business by buying more Irish potatoes to sell, for use as french fries

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Ramadhan, who is in his early 30s, is a single parent of one child.  He has been selling chips since 2004.  He works from 5 a.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Ramadhan's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, salt and charcoal for cooking and has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for the support of Mt Elgon Group.  He used his profits to buy a television set, a radio, a cupboard, build his house and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.  He dreams of becoming an international businessman.

Ramadhan will share this loan with his loan group which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Twikuremubukene Group

texts.en:
Twikuremubukene is a group led by Clementine, who is 31 years old. The group name means “Poverty reduction” in English. She is married with four children aged between 5 and 12 years. 

She sells local drinks and has been doing in a business for the past 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for making soft drinks for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and also to buy insurance for them.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making soft drinks for sell.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 40-year-old married man and a father of four children. He is working in laundry. He has been hoping to give himself and his family a better future and to get a university degree that he didn’t get because his family was not able to pay for his education.

Day after day, his children's needs increase, and he has become unable to cover all the household expenses along with the educational expenses.

Therefore, he decided to open his own business and start selling washing and cleaning tools. Now he is applying for a loan to buy more products to sell and increase his income. He is working hard to achieve his dreams, so he needs your financial support to let him start his road to success.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell and increase his income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with six children and five go to school. She sells used clothes on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of from MCDT-SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She moves door to door selling used clothes, and works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of getting a permanent business premise and becoming a wholesaler. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food .

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes, with the hope of having a permanent business location

loans.name: Rafayel

texts.en:
Rafayel is 58 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Rafayel has a vocational education with the specialty of welding. For many years he worked at the Kapan combine as a locksmith and welder. Rafayel has managed his business for many years.  

In his own workshop he makes iron gates with nice and various patterns on them. He works by order and as he mentions he has no lack of orders from the whole region. He works very properly, beautifully and quickly. 

Rafayel is married and he has two children, who are married and they live abroad. Rafayel needs this loan as he must buy different iron items and also electrodes for his interesting and not easy occupation.

loans.use: to buy different iron items and also electrodes for his interesting and not easy occupation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to prepare for his new beehives.

loans.name: Leyla Encarnacio
