texts.es: Leyla de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, yuca y también a la crianza de ganado, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas para poder tener una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Leyla is 36 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own house with her daughter. She farms basic grains, cassava, and also raises cattle. She has done this work for several years. She sells her products in areas near where she lives. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides in order to have a good harvest and improved income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Laura

texts.es: Maria vive sola en casa propia ya que su esposo y su hijo vive en estados unidos, ella se dedica a la siembra de yuca y maíz tiene mas de 35 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola, comercializa sus productos a comerciantes mayoristas que se encuentran cerca de la zona donde ella reside, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas y pago de mano de abra que utilizara para que le ayuden en la siembra y asi pueda tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria lives alone in her own house, since her husband and son live in the U.S. She makes her living growing yucca and corn. She has been in the agricultural business for more than 35 years. She sells her products to commercial wholesalers who are in the area where she lives.

She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers, compost, and pest control, and to pay for labor that she will use to help her during planting, so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, and pest control, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is a conscience woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a family of workers. She is living in a small town of hospitable residents and fresh beauty nature. She is married and has three children. 

She is a teacher of literature in the domestic secondary school. However, she keeps livestock at home. In order to feed a family there is not enough income to work at one job. The most common business in area where she lives is doing agriculture keeping, feeding and selling items in a market. She was participated at a three day training provided by IMON to start-up clients. 

She decided to buy additional livestock and to do business, in order to earn money to feed her family. She asked for a loan to buy a livestock. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start doing business to help provide for her family

loans.name: Vehanush

texts.en:
Vehanush is 48 years old, and she lives with her son in the village of Tsovagyugh in Armenia's Gegharkunik region. She graduated from the State Pedagogical Institute in pedagogy and psychology. For several years she taught kindergarten.

Now Vehanush is unemployed and works instead on her farm. Here she has cows, calves, a pig, piglets, sheep and chickens. With the help of her son Vehanush sells her farm goods such as milk, cheese, butter, curd, meat and eggs. As for many farmers in this region, her potato cultivation is quite profitable. Potato retailers buy her potatoes rather quickly, as they are fresh, tasty and well-farmed.

Vehanush will be very happy to be granted a 700,000 AMD loan through Kiva's field partner Nor Horizon to support her farm. With this loan she will buy potato seedlings, one more calf and fodder for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, one more calf and fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is a farmer and he lives with his wife and son in the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region.

Khachik has a very cute farm but he hopes that during several years he will surely enlarge it and its income as well. Still he takes care of his small farm, where he has cows, heifers, a calf and sheep. He organizes meat sales (beef, pork and mutton) from his farm to his regular customers, who are mainly city butchers.

With the help of his son, Khachik also cultivates potatoes on his plot of land. This vegetable he mentions as a very popular, tasty and profitable vegetable for cultivation and sale as well. So this loan will serve for the purchase of diesel fuel, fertilizer, potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: purchase diesel fuel, fertilizer, potato seedlings and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children. She also takes care of additional family members. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major expenses include food and home utilities. She operates a canteen at the market on a retail basis. She works six days a week and serves all kinds of people. She has been in this business for the last 11 years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, sugar, soda, boxes of mineral water, and cooking oil. Her future plan is to start selling on a wholesale basis. This will help her increase her capital base.

loans.use: to buy boxes of sweets, biscuits, soap, sugar, soda and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Noshi's Group

texts.en: Noshi is a 48 years old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last 10 years. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of new rickshaw. Therefore Noshi has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Noshi is very thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth previously obtained a 17,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI, which she used in her recycling business. Her earnings were a big help in supporting her children’s education, her household, and business expenditures.

Elizabeth would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more scrap for her recycling business. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and the children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this loan with sincerest thanks.

Locally, all CCT community partners and clients such as Elizabeth are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for her recycling business.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a beauty shop in a place that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair relaxers, rollers, treatments, braids, weaves and oils. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, rollers, treatments, braids, and weaves

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is very grateful that there are people like you lenders who have helped her get through her food stall business by granting her previous loan. It indeed became a great help, not just to her, but also to the entire household. Through this, she was able to sustain the family necessities. In addition to this, she also operates a piggery where she earns part of her total income. 

As of today, she still envisions expanding her business. This is why she is planning to ask a for a 19,000 PHP loan that she will use to improve her piggery. She is planning to buy more hogs and other materials that will be needed to improve her livelihood. 

If you would allow the loan, Rosita would be very thankful and eager because of the given opportunity. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more hogs and other materials that are needed for improving her livelihood.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
In the frontier village Aygehovit in the Tavush region lives Amalya. She became a widow when she was only 27 years old and since then she brought up her three children alone.  Amalya both worked and took care of her children, and during many hardships she managed to bring up her children as good and honest people. Both her children are now married and they live with their families. Now Amalya lives alone and her happiness is unbelievably great when her grandchildren visit her, stay with her several days and they also greatly help their grandmother about the farm. 

Amalya has a large orchard where she has fig and persimmon trees. She also has a sweet harvest of grapes in her orchard. In her vegetable garden, she plants and sells beans, corn, garlic and onions. All these harvests Amalya sells at the city’s wholesale market. With her agricultural work, Amalay also works at the school as a cleaner. 

This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams she asks for, as she wants to repair the fence in her orchard and she will also make water lines in both her orchard and vegetable gardens.

loans.use: to repair the fence in her orchard and also to  install water lines in both her orchard and vegetable gardens

loans.name: Carlos Orlando

texts.es:
Carlos, es propietario de una mini ferretería, el negocio nació hace cinco años con la motivación y apoyo de su papá, trabaja de lunes a domingo, está soltero, vive con sus padres y les apoya con los gastos familiares, por el momento no representa problemas para administrar su negocio.
El crédito le será de ayuda para comprar cemento, pinturas, brochas, hierro, bloques, etc., con estos materiales incrementara su inventario y ofrecerá mejor mercadería a sus clientes, pretende tener estabilidad económica para pagar sus deudas y seguir apoyando a sus padres.
Sus sueños son formar su propia familia y seguir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is the owner of a small hardware store. The business was born five years ago with his father's motivation and help. He works from Monday to Sunday. He is single, lives with his parents, and helps them with family expenses. He does not currently have any problems running his business.

The loan will help him buy cement, paints, brushes, iron, cinder blocks, etc. With these materials, he will increase his inventory and offer his customers better merchandise.

He hopes to be financially stable in order to pay his debts and continue supporting his parents. He dreams are to have his own family and to continue expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy cement, paints, brushes, iron, cinder blocks, etc.  With these materials, he will increase his inventory and offer his customers better merchandise.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida, 45, is single and lives in Tagbilaran City, Bohol. For the past ten years she has earned a living by cooking and delivering to her clients lechon, or roasted suckling pig, a very popular dish in the Philippines.

Aida is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy four piglets to roast. With a loan like this Aida will gradually become financially stable, able to settle her obligations and put aside money for emergency purposes. She is working to develop her business into a productive, profitable and sustainable one.

loans.use: to buy four piglets to roast for lechon.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is a 56-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of 4 children. She has been doing a business of purchasing and selling animals for many years. Sakeena is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

Now, Sakeena has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is a 49-year-old, married woman. She does hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, Tahmina has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment; this will allow her to cater consistently to more customers. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Priyono

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Priyono. Priyono lives in Semarang, located in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Priyono is a guy who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Priyono is a kind and cheerful guy. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Priyono needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Priyono’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Priyono is the one who is smiling and standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Desi Cotton Growers Association Group

texts.en: Ishwar lives in Shagoti village, Gadad District. After completing 12th grade, he started to do agriculture with his father. He grows groundnuts, onions and cotton. Earlier he used to cultivate hybrid cotton. When he realized how hazardous this hybrid cotton was to the environment and to the cattle, he stopped cultivating hybrid cotton and started cultivating indigenous varieties of cotton in 2011. After harvesting, he faced marketing problems and unfortunately he was forced to sell it to the local dealer who procures hybrid cotton. Later Ishwar formed a group in his village named “Desi Cotton Growers Association” with the farmers who were interested in cultivating indigenous varieties of cotton and the members of this group cultivated only indigenous varieties of cotton. As of now, farmers from nearby places are also members of this group. This group consists of 16 members. Now Ishwar and his 15 group members have planned to install a small processing center for making threads to sell, so they need to buy a cotton carding machine that combs, brushes and separates the cotton fiber for which the group is seeking this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cotton carding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Saefudin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Saefudin. Saefudin lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his family. Saefudin is a guy who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Saefudin is a really hardworking guy and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Saefudin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Saefudin’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to offer an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Saefudin is the one who is standing in his stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, pipe and labor for installation of a sanitary sewer system in her home.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is the age of 39 and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own general store as well. Some of his relative like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relations, his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Shamim requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Shamim thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, and biscuits for her husband's general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Parveen has been doing her business of selling clothes for the past six years and contributes her income to manage the household.

Parveen needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

For this financial assistance Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothing business

loans.name: Muhtabar

texts.en: Muhtabar is 61 years old. She lives in the city of Khujand. Khujand is a very beautiful city. There are many interesting places and fresh weather. Muhtabar lives there with her family. She divorced her husband a few years ago. After the divorce from her husband, it was hard to live for Muhtabar, and she decided to start her own business. She has started to sell fabrics in the local market of their city. She gets a good income from her business. Also she can sew women`s dresses. Currently, her business is not going well and Muhtabar decided to buy new fabrics and expand the business. She does not have enough money. Muhtabar needs your help very much.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics and expand the business

loans.name: Mirian Elizabet

texts.es: Mirian de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, tiene 13 años de tener su negocio el cual esta ubicad en el mercado municipal, con lo que obtiene de su ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder tener mejores ganancias ya si seguir teniendo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marian is forty-six years old and lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She works in the sale of clothing for women, men and children and has had her business for 13 years in the municipal market. With what she earns from her sales and with the help of her husband, they are making headway. She is asking for a loan to buy more clothing at wholesale in order to be able to achieve higher profits and continue to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 27; she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns a business packaging kids' toys. He has been running this business for the last five years. At the beginning, it was not very profitable, but with the passage of time he has established it on a grand level. 

Now there are six co-workers working with him. He purchases raw materials from the market such as cornstarch glue, cardboard, brightly colored inks, a cutter machine, etc. He takes orders from different toy-manufacturing companies and after packaging the toys in different styles, he supplies them to the shopkeepers. He manages his household necessities from his business as well.

Due to regular use, his toy-packing machine is not working properly nowadays. For this reason he is in need of a new toy-packing machine. Therefore his wife, Nasreen made contact with BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner, for a loan. In this way she can support her husband's business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new toy-packing machine for her husband's business

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat  is 49 years old, a married woman and a mother of three children. She has been doing a tailoring business for many years to help her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. 

Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces for meeting orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Mussarat  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces so as to meet orders on time.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is the age of 32 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knits blankets at home. For knitting blankets, wool is used to make the blankets. There is no better kind of the blanket than ones made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones. 

Her husband is very expert and knits very fine blankets. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing from time to time. However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knitting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. 

Therefore, Naseem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy wool for knitting blankets and increase his income.

loans.use: to increase her husband's blanket sale business

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon is a clever young man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan, into a family of workers. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a student and studies law at a university, where he is well known among his fellow students and friends. 

Umedjon wants to be a high-quality specialist lawyer. The area where he lives needs such specialists, because most of the people doing this type of work are going abroad and less of them are working here. He wishes to be useful to his nation and to mitigate the demographic scarcity of specialists in his area. At the same time, he wants to have a permanent work place to earn money and help his parents live better. 

He has asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Seema

texts.en: Seema, age 48, is a very enthusiastic person who has been successfully running a small general store. She offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, Seema  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has requested a loan of PKR 50,000  to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc., to consistently meet the increasing demand at her store and make better earnings.

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia  is 41 years old, a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and they make enough to meet the expenses of their three children. 

Currently, Aasia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Munir

texts.en:
Munir, age 45, is a married woman and the mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all of their household expenses, so she started her milk sales business.

She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Currently she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Majidan

texts.en:
Majidan is a 49-year-old married woman. She deals in business, selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales to expand her business and income level.

loans.name: Syani

texts.en:
Syani is 35 years old, married woman. She has 4 children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Syani  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 45-year-old, married woman from a village near Jenin City. She is a mother for five sons and one daughter. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low income. Majeda works as a farmer in the family agricultural land where she plants fruit trees.

Majeda took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seedlings for her farm. This will increase her productivity and also her income. Majeda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic goods ranging from noodles, canned goods, beverages, and cooking oil to biscuits, eggs, powdered milk and toiletries.  She is a 42-year-old woman with two children, ages 3 and 11 years old.

She has requested a loan to buy assorted canned goods, soft drinks, and biscuits.  These will help improve the inventory of her store and she will be able to attract more buyers to come. In this way, Marina's income will grow and she will be able to provide her children with nutritious food.

Marina dreams of expanding her business to make it successful for the welfare of her growing children and for sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy assorted canned goods, soft drinks, and biscuits

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 26 year old, hardworking woman. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Saima’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. 

Saima has requested for a loan amount 40000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Rene Americo

texts.es: René de 43 años de edad viven casa propia con su compañera de vida y su madre, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su camión desde hace 13 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo prefieren por la responsabilidad que tiene a la hora de manejar, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de llantas y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y poder tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: René is 46 years old and lives in his own house with his common-law wife and his mother. He has been a truck driver for 13 years and he has many clients who prefer to call on him because he shows up on time for a job. He has been able to pay his household bills from his work. Now he is asking for a loan for the purchase of tires and maintenance for his vehicle, since it is his only source of work and [with the loan] he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tires and maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Ngomeni S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Dorothy is the lady raising her hand in the photograph. She is a member of Ngomeni S.H.G. She is 41 years old, married, and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the trainings, especially on enterprise development. 

She makes ropes and sisal bags, which she sells locally to earn a living. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more sisal to enable her to make more bags for more stock, thus more income.  This will enable her to meet her family's basic needs with ease. Dorothy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more sisal to enable her to make more bags, for increased stock and income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Kusar

texts.en:
Kusar is 50 years old, a married lady and is running a small general store in her community for many years with her son, who is also shown in the photo.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Kusar  makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR which she will used to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Kusar  wishes to utilize part of her revenues on providing good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 54 years old and married with 6 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. 

She operates a grocery shop and she is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more fruits so as to add stock for increased income.  This will enable her meet her family's needs such as food, access to better health care and education.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits to add stock to her grocery shop for increased income to meet her family's basic needs.

loans.name: Sarwary

texts.en:
Sarwary is 36 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 3 children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales, so as to earn a good income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a 32-year-old, married woman from a village near Jenin City. She is a mother for one son and three daughters. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low income. Rama works as a farmer in the family agricultural land where she plants fruit trees.

Rama took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seedlings for her farm. This will increase her productivity and also her income.  Rama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 28-year-old married woman from a village near Jenin city. She is the mother of two daughters. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low income. Iman works as a farmer in the family agricultural land where she plants fruit trees.

Iman took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seedlings for her farm. This will increase her productivity and also her income. 

Iman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 45 years old woman. She is running a business of milk selling to bear her household expenditures. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Yasmeen’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Now she needs to earn more income for her everyday expenditures. 

Therefore, Yasmeen  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing a better standard of living for her family.

loans.name: Kakulunga Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Bridgit. She is 32 years old and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training on business skills and enterprise development. 

Bridgit sells fruits and vegetables in the nearby market to the local community. She is taking a Kiva loan to buy more fruits to enable her to supply the local schools. This will also increase her income thus able to support her family basic needs.

She is promising to pay her loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for increased stock to provide fruit to local schools

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Wahyu. Wahyu lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city. He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Wahyu owns a small stall where he sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He feels that since he joined Ruma he learnt a lot about how to improve his business, as well as gave more contribution to his community. His community sees him as a kind, cheerful and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business keep growing, Wahyu is hoping to get another working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Wahyu improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Wahyu is the one who is smiling and standing. He will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give his community a better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Nelson Mandela School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Head Teacher of Nelson Mandela School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kyabakuza in Masaka with 641 students. Nelson School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system, to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children.  Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nelson School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance, by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a widow and has two grandchildren that she is taking care of. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012 so as to benefit from the training, especially on enterprise development.

She practices farming and also operates a small kiosk.  She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy cereals so as to add stock to her kiosk for increased income to enable her to take care of her grandchildren's basic needs. 
  
Esther is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy cereals so as to add stock to her kiosk for increased income to enable her to take care of her grandchildren's basic needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees for this semester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soap for resale.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda, elabora pupusas para vender, vive con su familia formada por sus tres hijos de 32, 20 y 16 años de edad, solo dos hijos dependen económicamente de ella, con su negocio puede ir mejorando el estilo de vida familiar, trabaja desde hace 10 años de viernes a domingo, hasta el momento no tiene dificultades para mantener el negocio funcionando.
Con el capital podrá surtir su negocio cuando sea necesario con  la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas, comprara quesillo, chicharrón, maíz, tomates, bebidas, etc., así podrá continuar trabajando y no tendrá limitantes para hacerlo, espera que la afluencia de clientes sea mayor y que pueda cubrir la demanda.
Su visión es seguir trabajando para que su negocio siga activo y pueda tener los ingresos necesarios para darles a sus hijos educación superior y un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Griselda prepares pupusas to sell. She lives with her family, which is made up of three children who are 32, 20, and 16 years old. Two of her children are financially dependent on her. Her job allows her to improve her family's way of life. For the past 10 years, she has worked Fridays through Sundays and, up to the present, she has not had difficulties in keeping the business functional.

With the capital, she will be able to stock her business when necessary with raw materials to make pupusas, like fresh cheese, pork, corn, tomatoes, beverages, etc. This way, she will be able to continue working without limits. 

She hopes that she will have more customers and that she will be able to cover the demand. Her vision is to continue working so that her business continues to be active and so that she can earn the income necessary to provide her children with a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cheese, pork, corn, tomatoes, beverages, etc. so that she can continue to work without limits.

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk is from Nor Kharberd village where he lives with his wife and two chidlren. 
His son is a student in the university where he specializes in the department of musical art.

Manuk works hard to support his family's living. He asks this loan to pay for his son Karapet's university tuition and give him an opportunity to continue education.   Manuk and his family members hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for his son Karapet's university tuition in musical art

loans.name: Susan Daly

texts.es: Susan de 30 años vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 6 años, tiene muchos clientes por la calidad con que elabora el pan, con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante con las gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, jaleas de sabores, moldes, etc. Para poder seguir con su trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Susan, who is 30 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. She has owned a bakery located in her home for the past 6 years. She has many customers because of the high quality of her baked goods. 

With her earnings, she contributes to pay the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase flour, sugar, flavored jams, molds, etc. in order to continue working so that she can earn more income and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, flavored jams, molds, etc.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: Antonia de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos para damas desde hace mas de 15 años, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con las ventas que realiza logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonia is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her family. For more than 15 years, she has made a living by selling women's shoes. Her business is located in the municipal market, so she has many customers.

With the money she earns from her sales, she is able to pay expenses that arise. She is requesting a loan to purchase shoes in bulk so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
The name of the lady in the photo is Beatrice.  She is married and the mother of five children.
Her economic activity is onion farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received trainings on enterprise management and financial planning. These trainings have equipped her with skills of effectively running her onion business. 

Beatrice requires a loan in order to purchase certified seeds and fertilizer. She believes this will increase her proceeds and thus boost her income. She will therefore be able to improve the overall living standards of her family such as medical care and quality education.
Beatrice is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make payments on time.

loans.use: To buy onion seeds and fertilizer that will boost proceeds thus more income.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
This is Ruth. She is forty five years old with seven children. Two of her children are in primary school while one is in secondary school, the rest have finished schooling. 
She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and runs a business of maize and potato farming. 

She is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers for her business which she has been operating for ten years. With this loan, she hopes that her business will generate profit that will help increase her level of income. This will enable her to be in position to provide basic necessities for her siblings which include food and education. 
Ruth is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: To buy fertilizer that will help boost farming potatoes and maize, thus more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering

loans.name: Nefoz

texts.en:
Nefoz is a 22-year-old single woman from a village near Hebron City. She lives with her family in a small house. Nefoz has a sewing business where she makes different types of clothes. She sells her products in the local market.

Nefoz took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income. Nefoz appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 49-year-old, married woman from a village near Jenin City. She is a mother for three sons and five daughters. Her husband is a construction worker where he gets a low income. Samar works as a farmer in the family agricultural land where she plants fruit trees.

Samar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more seedlings for her farm. This will increase her productivity and also her income. Samar appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 47 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de tres hijos, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Pedro con el afán de generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la siembra de arveja china desde hace 20 años, y para mejorar sus ingresos su esposa se dedica a la elaboración de güipiles típicos.
En estas épocas es la temporada de la siembra de arveja, es por ello que Pedro ha estado preparando la tierra para empezar a cultivar, pero se ha dado cuenta que no le alcanza para comprar sus fertilizantes químicos y orgánicos como también sus semillas por tal motivo solicita un crédito para poder cubrir esta necesidad.
El gran sueño de Pedro es poder exportar su producto en exterior para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 47 year old man. He is married and has a beautiful family with three children. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá. In order to generate income and move his family forward, Pedro began growing snap peas 20 years ago. In order to supplement their income, Pedro's wife earns money by selling traditional textiles. 

Snap pea season is occurring now, so Pedro has been preparing the land in order to begin to cultivate, but he has realized that he will not be able to purchase the chemical and organic fertilizers or seeds. This is why he is requesting a loan. He will use the loan to cover these essentials. Pedro's greatest dream is to export his products so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase chemical and organic fertilizers, and pea seeds.

loans.name: Parmanand

texts.en:
Parmanand thanks all his Kiva lenders for helping him with his rice cultivation. 
He repaid his previous loan fully and with the profits, he paid for the tuition of his children and could save for his family future. 

Parmanand wants to continue with the rice production and needs another loan of SRD 12.000 to pay for the inputs such as diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To pay for the inputs such as diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Fedda

texts.en:
Fedda is 54-year-old, married woman who lives in Irbid. Fedda started her business with a low quantity of clothes after her husband retired and became blind because of illness, to get income to provide a living for her family.
 
Fedda is running the project. The problem that they are facing is the high cost of the products. She is applying for the loan to buy new clothes and new supplies to sell. Fedda intends to enlarge her project to become an independent shop from her home. That’s why she needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and new supplies to sell.

loans.name: Kisab Women Group

texts.en:
The person raisind her hand in the photo is Mercy, a member of Kisab Women Group. She is 29 years old, with four children. She is married and lives with her family. Mercy does mixed farming such as maize, beans and potatoes. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa savings training she received which equipped her with business knowledge. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to boost and expand potato farming business by buying pesticide and manure. This will enable her to improve productivity. She intends to use part of the profit in providing food to the family and to pay school fees.
Mercy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and manure that will help boost productivity thus more profits to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 46 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa par Adams y caballeros, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal gracias a sus ventas es como ha logra salir adelante, ella nuevamente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She makes a living by selling clothing for women and men. Her business is located in the municipal market. Thanks to these sales, she has been able to move forward.

She is requesting another loan to purchase more clothing in bulk so that she can continue to make sales in order to earn more money and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Prewesh

texts.en:
Prewesh feels blessed with the help of the Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot for their support. 

He repaid his loan to his Kiva lenders on time and with the profits he could send his sister to high school and paid for her studies. 

Prewesh is now married and already has a child. To take for his whole family, he wants to continue with the rice production and for this he needs a loan of SRD 10.000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his rice production.

loans.name: Mwamko Mpya Community Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Freshia. She is 55 years old with three children. Two of her children have already completed schooling and the rest are in college. She runs businesses of maize farming and cabbage selling in Nakuru, Kenya. 

She is taking a loan to purchase fertilizers for better productivity, as well as to add stock for her cabbage business. This will enable her to reach out to more customers. She hopes that her businesses will generate profits that will help increase her level of income. Freshia is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more stock of cabbages to boost income from improved sales.

loans.name: Valley Hope Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising hand in the photo is Rebecca, a member of Valley Hope Women Group. She is 52 years old, married, and a mother of six. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013. She does vegetable farming as her main business. She is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise and financial management, that has enabled her manage the business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy quality farm inputs such as manure and pesticide, so that she can increase her output, and in return increase her profits from sales. This will assist her to cater for her family’s well being. She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticides that will increase farm proceeds.

loans.name: Kibakenge Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rael, raising her hand in the photo is a member of Kibakenge Small Scale Farmers Self Help Group. She is sixty one years old, married and lives with her five children.
She runs a farming enteprise of maize, beans and potatoes in Nakuru, Kenya. 

She is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs e.g. fertilizers for her business. She hopes that this will generate profit that will help increase her level of income. This will enable her be in position to provide necessities for her siblings which include food and education with ease. 
Rael is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly

loans.use: To buy farm inputs especially fertilizer that will boost her farming business to support her income

loans.name: Basajjabalaba School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mushin. He is the head teacher of Basajjabalaba Secondary School, a mixed school in the rural area of Bushenyi with 500 students. 

Basajjabalaba School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Basajjabalaba School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mushin ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five. Alia has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. Her 22-year-old daughter Haya appears in the photo instead of Alia, who is a conservative woman.

Haya is a university student majoring in math, and she is in her third year. She is seeking to pass her Bachelor's so that she can experience work life. But because of the financial crisis her family has been facing, she couldn't pay for her upcoming semester fees.

Alia, like all mothers, wants to help her kids to complete their education. Therefore, she is applying for an education loan to pay for Haya`s university fees and to help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees and to help her achieve her dreams

loans.name: Kisalizi-Kimigi Group

texts.en:
Rapheal, whose hand is raised in the group photograph, is a fifty-three-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. 

He sells foodstuffs in the market and also deals in buying and selling produce. He started this business ten years ago and he has managed to look after his family using the proceeds. Rapheal usually complains of price fluctuations of agricultural products, which hinders his expected returns though he is assured of business continuity. 

He wants a loan to buy more foodstuffs like yellow bananas, tomatoes, and onions to sell.

As a loving father, he works hard to ensure that his children attain the best education.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Flor Elizabeth

texts.es: Flor de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 30 años, su taller de costura lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes por la calidad con que realiza la ropa, Flor está solicitando un crédito para la compra de hilos, agujas, variedad de tela, botones, elásticos, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
46-year-old Flor lives in her own house with her family. She has worked as a seamstress for 30 years. Her dressmaking studio is set up in her home and she has many clients because of the quality of the clothes she makes.

Flor is requesting a loan to buy thread, needles, a range of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc. so that she can continue with her work, which brings her a good income.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, a range of fabrics, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 42-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. David used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children.

He has been making crafts for many years and works hard to sustain his business. David also runs a transport business for additional income. He maintains his dream of educating his children up to the university.

David will use the loan facility to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.name: St. Mary's Kyamuhunga Schools

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Felix, the head teacher of St. Mary's Kyamuhanga Schools, located in the rural area of Bushenyi with 1,450 students. St. Mary's Kyamuhanga Schools has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment systems with 750 and 1,000 liter tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Mary's Kyamuhanga Schools will repay their loan from school fees, which they collect each term. Felix ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Arkadya

texts.en:
Arkadya, who lives in the town of Kapan with his mother and his only brother, who serves in the army, has been providing auto repair services in a rented garage for two years now. He is the main breadwinner of the family, his income vital for his family's well-being. 

Arkadya is requesting this loan to purchase equipment for the  renovation of tires. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tire-renovation equipment

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en: Yasin a father of seven children and is a 40-year-old married man living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. His business is produce selling, alongside farming for supplementary income. He engages himself in these businesses in order to earn income. He is a hardworking man who dreams of building  himself a good  permanent home. However, he usually complains of price fluctuations of produce and bad roads that make it difficult for him to deliver his products to his customers. Yasin intends to use the loan to buy coffee for selling.

loans.use: buy coffee

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is a 23-year-old married woman living with her husband and one school-aged child. She, in cooperation with her husband, works tirelessly to be able to satisfy their requirements and always improve their lifestyle.

Amira works as a farmer and has been in this business for the past two years. Today, with her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will buy seeds and seedlings for planting for her business.

She is well known in her region by her good reputation. She is sure that with the new merchandise, she will be able to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is a construction worker and living in Gyumri town. He provides renovation work, repairing doors and windows and other services for local people in Gyumri town. This business is the only source of income for his family, which includes his retired mother (77-years-old), wife and three children (17,15 and 4 years old). 

Hovhanes works day and night so his family will have basic means for living. He has applied for this loan to purchase a car that he needs for his construction work. The car is important for Hovhannes to transport construction materials and make his work effective. 

Hovhannes has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: buy a car

loans.name: Bishop Ogez School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Deusdedit. He is the head teacher of Bishop Ogez High School, a mixed school with 1,000 students in the rural area of Ishaka in Bushenyi. Bishop Ogez School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining two UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase two UV water treatment system with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bishop Ogez School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Deusdedit ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: buy a water filtration system

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward deals in a retail business alongside a cocoa selling and farming for additional income.  He is married with six children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He has future prospects of educating his children and is building a residential house for his family. However, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital that hinder the expansion of his business. Edward has asked for a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt, soap and also buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Mbarara Central School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joweia. She is the Director of Mbarara Central Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Mbarara Town with 450 students. Mbarara Central School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mbarara Central School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joweria ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: buy a water filtration system

loans.name: Domitilah

texts.en:
Domitilah is 46 years old and a mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) so as to benefit from the trainings, especially on enterprise development and financial management.

She is currently involved in weaving of mats, purses, baskets, and bags using beads. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more weaving materials such as beads for increased production to enable her to meet her customers’ demands.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more weaving materials such as beads for increased production to enable her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Mbulutini S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is called Syombua. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014 mainly to benefit from the enterprise development training. 

Syombua practices dairy farming and supplies milk in the nearby urban centers, schools and hotels to carter for her family needs. Before she joined HiH EA she was a house wife but after the training, she was able to do farming as a business. She is borrowing to put up a simple greenhouse to grow tomatoes and be able to provide for her family as well as giving her cows the quality feeds for more production. She is thankful for HiH EA for the training and also to Kiva and their lenders for the support.

loans.use: build a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en: Dalia is 25 years old and is from Minia. She is married to a part-time motorcycle taxi driver and has 2 sons and 3 daughters.  Dalia has a small grocery store which she considers a very important source of income to her family. She wishes to expand her business and increase her sales to cover her family's increasing expenses. So she requested a 3000 EGP loan to buy more products for her grocery store such as rice, sugar and oil.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, pipes, and labor to install sewage pipes in his house.

loans.name: Helmuth

texts.es: Con una larga trayectoria y experiencia Helmuth de 36 años, se dedica a prestar servicios de pintura y acabados en paredes,  actualmente trabaja como contratista en una obra de construcción ofreciendo servicios de pintura y estuco.  Desde sus 12 años aprendió este oficio ayudando a pintores y albañiles. Este emprendedor hombre ha logrado sustentar a su familia con el fruto de su trabajo, él es padre de dos hijos menores de edad a quienes les ofrece bienestar y desea brindarles a futuro estudios universitarios en las profesiones que deseen; para cumplir con sus propósitos es consiente que debe continuar trabajando con mucho compromiso y dedicación.  Helmuth ofrece un servicio a todo costo, en el que incluye materiales como pinturas, brochas, rodillos, aditivos y estuco, lo que le permite generar mayores ingresos, por eso está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en pinturas y estuco. Para Helmuth esta inversión tiene como finalidad, permitir ofrecer un mejor servicio, mediante la comodidad y confianza de la escogencia de materiales ideales para los acabados de las paredes.
texts.en:
With a long career and a great deal of experience, 36-year-old Helmuth earns his living providing painting and wall-finishing services. He currently works as a contractor on a construction project, providing painting and stucco services. Starting at 12 years old, he learned this trade by helping painters and builders. 

This enterprising man has managed to provide for his family with the fruit of his labors. He is the father of two minor children whose wellbeing he ensures. In the future, he would like to provide them with a university education in their desired professions. To achieve his objectives, he is aware that he must continue working with great commitment and dedication. 

Helmuth offers a complete service; he includes materials such as paints, brushes, rollers, paint additives, and stucco, which allows him to generate greater income. That's why he is applying for a Kiva loan—his first financing—through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to invest in paints and stucco. For Helmuth, the purpose of this investment is to allow him to provide a better service by offering the ease and confidence of an ideal choice of wall finish materials.

loans.use: to invest in paints and stucco

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 40-year-old Lebanese married man with two children. His wife is a housewife taking care of her children. He is the main income provider in his family.

He owns a minimarket and a grocery store. His income is barely sufficient. That’s why, currently, Ali is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay his children’s educational fees with the aim to ensure them a good education.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.en: Suzanne is a 25-year-old, divorced Lebanese woman living with her mother and two siblings. In 2013, she started running her own shop selling flowers. Her income is important to help with the family expenses. She has a wide variety of flowers and decoration accessories. Today, she is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to expand her store’s inventory of flowers and to renovate her shop. Her intention at this stage is to augment her sales to increase her income. In the future, she is planning to enlarge her business and collect higher revenues.

loans.use: to expand her store’s inventory of flowers and to renovate her shop

loans.name: Hawraa

texts.en: Hawraa is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children who are still attending school. She works really hard to be able to satisfy her family's needs and demands. Four years ago, she has opened a room in her house to prepare homemade foods and has gained a fair number of customers so far. She’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase more food provisions to increase her sales and therefore her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase more food provisions

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
Héctor, vive con sus hijos y su compañera de vida, su pareja desempeña labores domésticas y él se dedica atender su taller mecánico, lo posee desde hace 10 años, por su experiencia y buen servicio ya es muy reconocido en la localidad, de esta manera lleva el sustento diario a su casa.
Se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito para comprar cables, juego de llaves, aceite, etc., tendrá herramientas de trabaja en mejor estado para realizar sus actividades, espera que los clientes mantengan su fidelidad y así tener nuevos ingresos con los que respaldará el pago de la deuda.
Su visión es tener un negocio mucho más grande y cubrirlas necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Hector lives with his children and his life partner. His partner carries out household tasks and he works in his mechanic shop. He has had the shop for 10 years. Because of his experience and his good service he is already well-known in the area. This way he is able to bring home a living wage.

He has decided to request a loan to purchase wires, a wrench set, oil, etc. He will have work tools in better condition to conduct his business. He hopes that his customers continue to be loyal so that he has new revenue with which he can secure his loan payment. His vision is to have a much larger business and cover all of his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase wires, a wrench set, oil, etc. to have tools in better condition to conduct his business.

loans.name: Believers Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
Comfort is the leader and group representative of Believers Wood Cavers. She is a 37-year-old woman who comes from Ajumako Kokobeng in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married with five children, and all of them are currently in school. The ages of her children are as follows: 1, 5, 9, 13 and 15.

She is a woodcarver and has 15 years experience. She sells the masks she makes at organised craft centers in the city. Her group has been with the field partner since 2008, with good repayment records. Comfort has been able to improve her business year after year through her previous microloans. Comfort wants to see more growth in her business in the next five years. She needed additional working capital to increase her productions/sales to earn more income.

Apart from the woodcarving business, she also grows cassava and plantains, which serves as another source of income to support the family. Comfort plans to use the income from her craft-work to support her family and the future growth of her business. Comfort is grateful to all her microlenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy wood and finishing materials for crafting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy anti-malaria drugs to treat customers with malaria parasites.

loans.name: Razmik

texts.en:
Razmik is a construction materials worker from Kapan town. He specializes in stone production and processing. Razmik needs financial support to purchase tools and materials needed for stone processing. 
Razmik has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
Razmik hopes for lenders' support and the chance to improve and develop his business.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for stone processing

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 45 years old and lives in the Cape Coast Metropolitan Assembly of the Central Region of Ghana. He is married with four children. The ages of the children are 4, 9, 18, and 22. George is a welder and has been in business for 15 years. He has one employee who assists George in his business. Apart from his welding, he has a commercial truck as another source of income. George produces quality metal products like gates and also performs motor vehicle maintenance work. George has been with the field partner since 2009.  George has plans of acquiring a new site to expand production to meet the demand of clients and to train young people in the future. For now, George needs to buy more metal plates and rods to fill customer orders on time and to attract new customers. He needs micro loan assistance in the form of working capital to enable him buy the materials needed for his work. George plans to use the income to support his family and reinvest into the business. George thanks all his Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy metal plates and metal rods for welding

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 9 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y pupusas, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por mayor y cal para poder continuar con la elaboración de las tortillas y así poder tener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Evangelina is 48 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has been making and selling tortillas and pupusas for 9 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. With the income from her sales she is able to support herself.
