She seeks a loan to buy corn at wholesale and lime in order to be able to continue making tortillas and thus be able to have better income in order to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale and lime.

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en: Hassana is a 46-year-old, married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two children. She has been working for thirty years in tailoring and she owns a small shop in her town to help her family meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region by her good reputation and good work. To better develop her work, Hassana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a tailoring machine for her business. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and therefore to improve her income and percentage.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine for her business

loans.name: Kelvin Heraclinton

texts.es: Kelvin de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de artículos para el hogar (ollas, sartenes, etc.) tiene 2 años de dedicarse a la venta y lo hace de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener emjores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Kelvin is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has been selling household items (pots, frying pans, etc.) for 2 years. He sells them as a street vendor in different neighborhoods near his home. He seeks a loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale in order to continue with his sales and in this way have better income.

loans.use: to buy pots, frying pans, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Domingo es un padre de familia entusiasta que trabaja de sol a sol para darle a su familia lo mejor, él tiene 61 años de edad, es casado  y tiene ocho hermosos hijos de las edades de 12 y 32 años, ellos viven en una comunidad denominada San Andrés Semetabaj.
Domingo desde hace 45 años labora como jornalero en su comunidad, pero para mejorar sus ingresos su esposa elabora blusas típicas, con el apoyo mutuo han sacado adelante a sus hijos.
Domingo solicita un prestamo para poder comprar fertilizantes y pagar la mano de obra para cultivar maíz, pues esta es la temporada que se deberá cultivar para tener maíz el próximo año, ya que Domingo en este momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente.
El gran sueño de Domingo es poder construir dos cuartos para sus heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Domingo is an enthusiastic father who works from morning to night to give his family the best. He is 61 years old, married, and has 8 beautiful children between the ages of 12 and 32. They live in a community named San Andres Semetabaj.

For 45 years Doming has worked as a laborer in his community, but in order to improve their income his wife makes traditional blouses. By supporting each other they have been able to raise their children.

Domingo seeks a loan in order to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to cultivate corn, as this is the season that he should plant in order to have corn next year. At this time Domingo doesn't have enough capital for these items.

Domingo's dream is to be able to build two rooms as a legacy for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Moh'd

texts.en: Moh'd is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Moh'd joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having enough income to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Moh'd will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides and improved seed that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Moh'd now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beans, ground nuts and peas for selling.

loans.name: Nhyira Wood Carvers Group

texts.en: Godfred is a 39-year-old man from Ajumako in the Central Region of Ghana. He is married with four children, ages 6 to 12 and all attending school. Godfred is a wood carver who sells his crafts at a market in the city. He has been in this business for 10 years. He has an electrical appliances shop which serves as another source of income. Godfred wants to see his business grow in the next five years by opening about two more shops. Godfred and his group have been financing their business with microfinance assistance from the field partner since 2012 and have established a good credit history. Godfred needs additional working capital support to buy wood and finishing materials for his craft work. Godfred uses the income from his business to support his family and children's education; and gradual support for the future expansion of his business. Godfred is thankful to all his micro lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To buy wood and finishing materials for crafting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Tsovinar

texts.en:
Tsovinar lives in Kapan town with her mother. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and works hard to support his family. 
To help her parents financially and to be able to cover basic daily costs, Tsovinar runs her small business. Tsovinar sells cosmetics from her house. She receives orders and provides her customers with a large variety of cosmetic goods. Tsovinar asks for this loan to purchase cosmetics to sell to customers and cover current orders. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
Tsovinar will be very grateful to lenders for their support and hopes to enlarge her business in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to sell to customers and cover current orders

loans.name: Nkabom Wood Carvers Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 43-year-old man who comes from Ajumako in the Central Region of Ghana. He is married with three children, ages of 20, 17 and 12 years;  two of them are in school. Stephen has been in the craft work for about 20 years now with three employees. He produces wooden masks and sells them at an organised market in the city. He has a commercial vehicle which serves as his other source of income. 

Stephen wants to see an improvement in his business in the next five years by purchasing more materials for his work to produce on a larger scale. Stephen and his group members have been with the field partner since 2012 for financial support of their businesses. Stephen needs additional financial support to buy finishing materials and  wood for his craft work.  The income from his business will be used to support his future expansion, after using a percentage for catering for his family. Stephen thanks all his micro lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: To buy finishing materials and wood for craft work

loans.name: Hamza

texts.en:
Hamza is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko village. Hamza joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Hamza will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hamza now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmers' yields

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik is from Kapan town where he lives with his parents and 14-year-old sister.  One year ago, Hovik rented a vending machine and started providing coffee service in his local town. Realizing that there is a growing demand for that type of machine and service, Hovik now would like to expand his business. He asks for this loan to purchase a new vending machine which will be his own. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 
Hovik works hard so his family members have appropriate living conditions. He hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a new vending machine to expand his coffee selling service.

loans.name: Zohra

texts.en: Zohra is 23 years old from Minia. She is married to a part-time farmer and has two children. Three years ago, Zohra started a small poultry business in her house to help her husband with the family income. Since she has much experience in raising poultry, her business became very successful. Zohra wishes to expand her poultry business so she requested a 3,000 EGP loan to buy more chickens to increase her sales and income for her family.

loans.use: To buy more chickens to increase her sales

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is 26 years old and comes from Minia. Her husband is a teacher with a very small income and she has three school-aged children. 

Four years ago, Rania started a small grocery store project in her house to help her husband with the family income. Rania wants to buy more products for her project such as rice, sugar, butter, and pasta to cover the increasing demand of her customers, especially in the Ramadan and feast season.

loans.use: To buy more products for her project such as rice, sugar, butter, and pasta.

loans.name: Jose Abraham

texts.es: Jose de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su sobrino, el se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y hortalizas, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esa actividad vende sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, gracias a las ventas que realiza logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. para poder tener una buena cosecha y poder generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his mother and nephew.  He works planting basic grains and vegetables.  He has worked for over 20 years at this and he sells his products in different markets that are near his house.  Thanks to the sales he has made, he's been able to resolve some household expenses.  He is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, pesticides, etc. so that he can have a good harvest and generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, compost, seeds, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Iris Noemy

texts.es:
Iris, es viuda, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, ya tiene hijos que son independientes y el menor es el único que depende de ella y estudia 7° grado, administra una tienda de insumos para el hogar y otros productos, el negocio lo inicio con capital propio en el año 2009, su propósito de tener una actividad económica es generar ingresos para salir adelante con su familia, trabaja de seis de la mañana a siete de la noche.
Comprará bebidas, huevos, granos básicos, detergentes, etc., al por mayor  para abrir un nuevo punto de ventas en casa de su padre, no pagara alquiler y tendrá oportunidad de generar nuevos ingresos para ir mejorando su estilo de vida familiar y disminuir sus deudas.
Su objetivo principal es ahorrar lo suficiente para finalizar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en: Iris is a widow.  She lives in her own house with her children. She has children who are already independent and her youngest (who is in 7th grade) is the only one who depends on her.  She runs a general store, selling household supplies and other products.  She started the business with her own capital in 2009, with the goal of having a business which would generate income to help her family move forward.  She works from six in the morning until seven at night.  She will purchase beverages, eggs, basic goods, detergents, etc. at wholesale to open a new business location at her father's house.  She won't have to pay rent and will have the opportunity to generate new income to continue improving her family's lifestyle and decrease her debts.  Her main goal is to save sufficient funds to finish the construction of her home.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, eggs, basic goods, detergents, etc. at wholesale to open a new business location .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, pans, tins, etc.

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
Donatila, comercializa ganado para generar los ingresos que utiliza para cubrir los gastos familiares, es una actividad que le enseñaron sus padres, de forma independiente lo práctica hace 4 años; es un apersona soltera, tiene un hijo de 24 años de edad y le colabora en su negocio, no tiene apoyo de familiares en el extranjero.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar ganado para ir mejorando su actividad, con la inversión espera incrementar sus ventas, atender a nuevos clientes y lograr estabilizar su situación económica para resarcir su deuda y tener un mejor estilo de vida.
El objetivo de Donatila es adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos para mantener su negocio en el mercado.
texts.en: Donatila sells cattle to generate income that she uses to cover household expenses.  Her parents taught her this business, and for the past fours years, she has practiced independently.  She is single and has a son who is 24 years old and he helps with the business.  She doesn't receive financial support from family living abroad.  She will use this loan to purchase cattle to continue improving her business.  With the investment, she hopes to increase her sales, attending to new customers and to stabilize her financial situation so that she can pay off her debt and have a better life style.  Donatila's goal is to obtain experience in the use of loans to maintain her business in the market.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to continue improving her business.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre y su hermano, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace 20 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, con las ganancias que obtiene es como, logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Lorenzo, 45 years old, lives in his own house with his mother and his brother.  He has made a living growing corn for 20 years.  He sells his products in the adjacent towns and has established customers.  With the profits he earns, he manages to offset some of the household expenses.  He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pesticides, etc., so that he is able to continue with his work to have better profits.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 28 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 8, 10 y 11 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior de mujer.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Sur’ que se caracteriza por la procedencia de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, migrantes del todos los rincones del país se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido subtropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (al centro, viste solera negra y calza negra). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; llantería, venta de productos médicos naturales, panadería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de empanadas, librería y reparación tv color, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa íntima de mujer como; Sujetadores; con relleno, de deporte, tallas extra grandes, Bragas, culotte, Tangas, Ligueros, Conjunto lencería, Body, Corsé, Lencería; moldeadora, sexy, Lactancia, embarazo, etc. Actividad que realiza de forma ambulante recorriendo comercios y ferias del lugar todos los días de la semana en horas del día, “mis necesidades básicas son la falta de capital para invertir en mi negocio,  y pienso abrir otro puesto de venta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus prendas se venden constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda propia de lencería femenina, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa íntima de mujer por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa íntima de mujer por mayor para abrir una tienda y pagar los gastos de sus 3 hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old woman, single, and has three children who are 8, 10 and 11 years old.  Her business is women’s intimate apparel sales.  She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, persistent, responsible and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in the zone “Sur,” that is characterized by the origins of its inhabitants: Aymaran, Quechuan, and Guaraní.  Migrants from every part of the country appropriated the area and formed an ever-growing economy.  It has a warm, subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees Celsius [70 and 95 degrees Farenheit.]

Maria has dark skin, brown eyes, brown hair, which she ties back, a short stature and a thin body type.  Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, while she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for her business.  She is in the center, wearing a black shirt and black leggings.  She enjoys her life in the company of her children who are in school studying.  They live in their own house made of brick and cement that has drinking water, electricity and a sewage system.

The need to improve her business led her to form a bank of people with businesses such as: a tire shop, natural medicine sales, a bakery, secondhand clothing sales, empanada sales, a bookshop, and television repairs, in order to request a loan and improve their professions.  Her business is women’s intimate apparel sales, such as: push up, sports and plus size bras, a variety of underwear, garters, lingerie sets including body suits and corsets, and a variety of other lingerie including shaping, sexy, maternity, etc.

She carries out this profession by moving about markets every day of the week during the daytime.  She comments, “My basic needs are the lack of capital to invest in my business, and I am thinking of opening another market stall.”  The advantage of her business is that her garments are sold constantly, and the disadvantage is the lack of capital to be able to invest and grow her business.  Her dream is to open her own women’s lingerie store.  She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of women’s intimate apparel in bulk.  This is her first sequence of loans with this institution in the six years that she has made a living in this profession.

It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to purchase women’s intimate apparel in bulk in order to open a store and cover the expenses of her three children.

loans.use: to purchase women’s intimate apparel in bulk in order to open a store and cover the expenses of her three children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to build a bathroom and install a toilet in order to continue improving her home.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad lives with his wife and two children in Kapan town, where he trades fruits and vegetables.
For four years now, Murad has rented the shop where he organizes his sales. Murad purchases fruits from Yerevan town and transports them to Kapan using his own truck. He works hard because this is the only source of family's income. Murad's children attend the local secondary school and his wife takes care of the household.

Murad has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. He plans to purchase new stock of fruits and vegetables for selling in the store and gathering income for the family's living. Murad hopes to receive lenders' support and enlarge his business in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of fruits and vegetables for selling in the store and gathering income for his family's living.

loans.name: Rudradew

texts.en: Rudradew is very thankful to all the Kiva lenders for their support. He once again repaid his loan fully and on time. The previous season was not so good for Rudradew because the price of rice was too low and he could not save enough to buy a tractor. But he hasn't lost hope and continues with the rice cultivation. He lacks finances and needs a loan of 10,000 SRD to buy inputs for rice production.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Teresa con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a oficios domésticos desde hace cuatro años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos cuenta con una venta de consumo diario.
Teresa es una joven muy emprendedora que lucha día con día por sus sueños y uno de ellos es amueblar su casa, pero ella no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder comprar los muebles, entonces tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar  los muebles y que su casa necesita para que tengan  más comodidad.
Teresa sueña también con poder comprar un terreno y construir una mejor casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Teresa is a young person of 21 years old. She lives with her parents in the community of Sololá.
She has the intention of earning an income to support her parents with household expenses. She has worked as a maid for four years, but she supplements her income by selling basic items. 
Teresa is a very entrepreneurial young person who strives day by day for her dreams. One of those dreams is that she can furnish her home, but she does not have sufficient money to be able to buy furniture. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to be able to buy furniture necessary to make her home more comfortable.
Teresa also dreams that she will be able to buy land and build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.en:
Adolfo is a weaver from Peru who specializes in tapestries and handbags. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wool Adolfo has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story: "From the time I was a little boy, I'd watch my family create marvelous textiles of Ayacucho, where I was born, and I dreamed of one day being able to create works of color and imagination with my own hands. My artistic formation comes from my ancestors. We all carry this art in our blood. For me, this work is more than just a job – it's the excitement and passion of my life. From the age of 14, I've designed and woven my own pieces. My motivation comes from the tradition and culture in every skein of yarn. I enjoy transmitting the things that I like. I bring my life, my examples, my people, my ancestors, all my beliefs and experiences to my work. I share messages through my work, such as our history and culture of our artistic world so that people can know them. My greatest challenge is that people admire this art that for some remain unknown. I feel proud to have learned this art form, and even more when I teach someone else to weave and design the things I know."

"I'd like to thank each of you for your support, as this micro-credit is going to help me refresh and expand my product line." Use the link below to view Adolfo's tapestries and handbags on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6133

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wool

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en: Usaini is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Galadima Mayau Village. Usaini joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usaini will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Usaini now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm's yields.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two daughters (7 and 4 years old).
Last year Hayk started providing vending machine service in the Kapan town. Realizing the growing demand for that business, Hayk continues to work on developing it. He asks for this loan to be able to pay for renovation of the coffee vending machine and purchase raw materials for coffee making. It is very important to repair the machine, make it function well and continue his business, which is the only source of his income.

Hayk has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

He hopes for lender's support and goodwill to his start up and developing business.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for coffee making and renovation of the coffee vending machine.

loans.name: Manodj

texts.en:
Manodj once again thanks all the Kiva lenders for the great job they are doing by helping poor rice farmers and other people. He repaid his loan fully and with the profits he could renovate his house. 

Manodj wants to save for the study cost of his children when they are going to enter higher school and also for the future of his family. He needs a loan of SRD 10.000 so he can buy fertilizers and pesticides and continue with the rice cultivation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides, so that  his children will be able to continue with their education

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es: Jorge de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee un negocio de venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 10 años, el cual está ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de más frutas y verduras por mayor, ya que de esta manera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposa.
texts.en: Jorge is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  For the past ten years, he has owned a business selling fruits and vegetables, which is located near his home in a well-traveled area, and for this reason he has many customers.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables wholesale, since in this way, he and his wife will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk, using his own truck, is involved in selling wheat in Hayanist village of Masis town. He lives there with his wife and two children. Hayk, as the only breadwinner in the family, works day and night to support family's living. Unfortunately the truck is currently damaged and needs to be renovated, to function well and continue the work. So that's the reason Hayk has applied for this loan. He plans to pay for truck renovation, which is the most vital for him among other problems that he faces.

Hayk has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his truck for transporting wheat and selling it.

loans.name: Constancio

texts.en:
Constancio is 59 years old and he owns his own house  Constancio works as a driver and he needs a loan to buy another car.  He has some savings but he needs more money to buy a new car (he will sell his old vehicle to have more money) that will be very useful for him 

Constancio is married and he has 4 children so he needs your help.  Constancio is healthy and he works hard.  He hopes you can help him, because his wife is unemployed

loans.use: to buy another car, as he is a driver.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is from Meghri town where he lives with his wife and parents. He is engaged in construction works, which helps him to cover family's basic expenses.  Since the construction work requires some important tools and equipment that are vital in working process, Hayk asks this loan to purchase them. 

He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Hayk hopes to receive lenders' support and be able to enlarge his construction works.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing construction work

loans.name: Shehaaf

texts.en:
Shehaaf is very grateful to know how Kiva lenders help him in realizing his long-terms goals. He repaid his loan of last season fully. With the profits, he started building his own house. 

Nowadays he is completing the building of his house. Shehaaf wants to have his children be married and for this he needs to save. That's why he continues with the rice production and needs finances to buy pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizers, to save money for the marriages of his children

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa sells shoes from a small rented boutique in the center of Vanadzor town. She has been involved in a retail business for 11 years and over those years was able to gain a big client base and a good reputation as a seller. Alisa lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and two sons. Her income from her retail business is very important for her family's living. 

Alisa has applied for this loan to purchase new inventory of spring and summer collection shoes to sell in the store. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy spring and summer collection shoes

loans.name: Ola

texts.en: Ola is 38 years old, from Minia. She is married to a bus driver and has 4 sons and 3 daughters. A few years ago, she started a small grocery store project to improve her monthly income and the living conditions of her children. She requested a 2000 EGP loan to buy more products for her store such as rice, pasta and oil to meet the increasing demands of her customers, especially in Ramadan and feast season.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store such as rice, pasta and oil.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 43-year-old man who is married, with eight children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He buys and sells cocoa in Bundibugyo. This is his main source of income. James started this business in order to sustain his family. 

He used the previous loan for cocoa business and hopes to have a bigger business, even though he faces a difficulty of seasonality changes. He intends to use the loan to buy cocoa for selling to cocoa companies.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling to cocoa companies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling, for family sustainability

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela es una mujer de 24 años de edad es soltera vive junto a su hijo de un años en una comunidad de Sololá.
Marcela lucha día con día para darle lo mejor a su peque hijo, ella trabaja en la agricultura desde hace tres años, para ella trabajar en el campo es una bendición porque le gusta compartir con la naturaleza.
Marcela ahora solicita un crédito para poder comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes porque ella no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder adquirir sus insumos. Ella espera poder contar con el préstamo para poder cultivar en esta temporada para poder obtener sus ganancias y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Marcela is a 24 year old woman. She is single and lives with her one year old child in the community of Sololá.
Marcela strives day by day to give the best to her young child. She has worked on a farm for three years. Working in the country is a blessing for her because she likes to share with nature. 
Marcela is now requesting a loan to be able to buy seeds and fertilizer because she cannot count on sufficient capital to acquire her supplies. 
She hopes to be able to count on the loan in order to cultivate in this season and use her earnings to build her house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Issaka

texts.en:
Issaka is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in traditional African carvings. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, nails and polish.

Issaka has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I work with wood, aluminum, copper, calabash and aluminum," says Issaka as he introduces his art. "I feel my works are very unique and beautiful, and this has not changed. My dream is to become known as an artist. I like to keep busy and find motivation in educating others about art. In fact, I have taught the craft to others. Although my work has been exhibited in hotels and is prized by my clients, my greatest challenges in life have been financial, and also promoting my art."

"I say thank you to all who are helping to fund this loan."

Use the link below to view Issaka's traditional African carvings on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7133">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7133

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, nails and polish

loans.name: Los Radicales  (Manta) Group

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América. Aquí decidieron unirse 10 mujeres y 2 varones y formar el Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades y que con la ayuda de los créditos esperan mejorara sus negocios y su calidad de vida
Une de las socias de este grupo es la señora Yulexi,  tiene 23  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos  de 9 y 1 año de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela.  Su esposo es maestro en construcción. 
Doña Yulexi es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recurso se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todas las mañanas a realizar sus recorridos, aprovecha que su hija está en la escuela y solo tiene que llevar al niño mas pequeño aunque a veces su mamá le cuida al bebé y sale con más facilidad,  ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene casi 3 años dedicada a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes y cosméticos.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, bisuterías y cosméticos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y espera seguir muchos años más recibiendo la ayuda de los créditos. Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered to be the most important, popular, and visited seaside resort in Ecuador due to its lovely, inviting beaches. It is the first deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

Ten women and two men from this city decided to get together and form a communal bank called “Los Radicales”. They make a living from different kinds of work. With the help of the loans, they hope to improve their businesses and their quality of life.

One of the members from this group is Yulexi. She is 23 years old and is in a common-law marriage. From this relationship, she has two children, aged nine and one. The eldest is at school. Her husband is a master builder.

Yulexi is a housewife who earns some money by selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women). She sells the products door to door. She goes out every morning to do her rounds, making the most of the fact that her daughter is at school and she only has to take her one-year-old son with her. Sometimes her mother looks after the baby and it is easier for Yulexi to do her work. She sells her products on credit and she collects the money every eight days. She has been doing this work for nearly three years and it is going very well for her. She mostly sells perfumes and cosmetics.

This loan is for buying perfumes, creams, costume jewellery, and cosmetics. This is her first loan cycle in the communal bank and she hopes to keep receiving the loans for many years to come. Her dream is to keep getting ahead in her business and to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, costume jewellery, and cosmetics

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.en:
Martha Elizabeth is 27 years old, is married and has three sons and they all live in her in-laws house. Martha Elizabeth started selling flowers when she was a little kid because her grandparents had a store in a Mexico City market.  When she grew up, her grandparents transported her to their locale and she became independent.

She asked for a loan to invest in her flower shop for Mothers Day, which is the best season of the year. She says that one of her goals is to go to college and study a technical degree.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her flower shop, so that she can continue with an advanced technical education

loans.name: Ximena

texts.en:
Ximena is a single woman. She doesn't have children but she takes care of her parents. She works at a restaurant as a waitress and also washes the dishes there. Ximena also works by herself every Sunday selling fruit juices at El Alto fair.

Ximena wants to have a bigger business so she needs a loan to buy more fruits to prepare more fruit juices at the fair. Ximena needs your help because her parents have their own debts and she wants to quit her job at the restaurant because of the hard work and the low pay she gets. She hopes you can help her to improve her business. She would like to have her own restaurant in the future. As you can see in the picture, her house is very humble.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to prepare more fruit juices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize for milling, packing and selling.

loans.name: Zannet

texts.en: Zannet is a resident of  Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 28 years old and a very hardworking woman but still single. She operates a human drug shop with three years experience alongside crop farming.  She has a business goal of transforming her drug shop into a pharmacy but is only limited by a low capital base. She wants a loan to buy more human drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more human drugs to sell.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is a 62-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in cattle fattening to earn an income and support his family. He also gets extra income from farming. His vision is to buy a vehicle to help him easily access markets for the milk though he is limited by inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cows to fatten at his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cows to fatten at his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes for selling

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla es una mujer solidaria y servicial, desde joven siempre le ha gustado ayudar los que la necesitan, por eso decidió estudiar licenciatura en enfermería, porque de esta forma puede crecer como persona y sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. 

Ella está en segundo año de su carrera universitaria, y solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora, así podrá apoyarse con esta herramienta tecnológica y facilitará su  proceso de aprendizaje. Karla espera culminar con éxitos su carrera y especializarse en ginecobstetra.
texts.en: Karla is a supportive and caring woman.  Since her youth, she has always enjoyed helping those in need.  For this reason, she decided to study to become a licensed nurse, since this will allow her to grow as a person and help her two daughters succeed.  She is in the second year of her college career, and she is requesting a loan to purchase a computer, so that she'll be able to support herself with this technological tool and facilitate her learning process.  Karla hopes to complete her degree with success and specialize in obstetrics and gynocology.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Rosa Delfina

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres niños de las edades entre 7 y 9 años de edad, esta linfa familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosa con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la venta de pollos por libra en la plaza de su comunidad desde hace cinco años.
Gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a los clientes Rosa tiene mucha demanda en su negocio, es por ello que para abastecer las necesidades de la clientela ahora solicita un préstamo para comprar más pollos por quintal  y luego venderlos por libra.
El gran sueño de Rosa es terminar la construcción de su casa y darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old. She is married and has three children between the ages of 7 and 9 years old. This beautiful family lives in a community of Sololá.
In order to generate income and support her family, Rosa has worked for five years selling chickens by the pound, at the square of her community. Thanks to the kindness with which she serves her customers, Rosa has a lot of demand in her business. In order to stock up for the needs of her customers, she is now requesting a loan to buy more chickens by the quintal (centner) and later sell them by the pound. Rosa's biggest dream is to finish building her house and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens by the pound.

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Micaela es una mujer de 42  años de edad es casada tiene una linda familia de  seis hijos de las edades entre 10 y 19 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Micaela con el afán de generar sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa casual desde hace 18 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la venta de refacciones los días sábados y domingos.
Micela es una mujer muy  optimista que tiene el sueño de hacer crecer su negocio, pero para hacerlo ella necesita de un buen capital, por tal razón está solicitando un crédito que lo invertirá comprando una variedad de ropas casuales para damas, caballeros y niños para luego venderlos a un buen precio.
El gran sueño de Micaela es que todos sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Micaela is a 42 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of six children between the ages 10 and 19. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.
Micaela has the intention of generating income. She has worked buying and selling casual clothing for 18 years, but in order to improve her income she also works selling snacks on Saturdays and Sundays. 
Micaela is a very optimistic woman who has a dream of growing her business, but in order to do so she needs good capital. 
For this reason she is requesting a loan that she will invest in buying a variety of casual clothing for women, men and children, that she will then sell for a good price. 
Micaela's biggest dream is that all her children graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy and sell casual clothing for women, men and children.

loans.name: Rony Estuardo

texts.es:
Rony es un joven de 24 años de edad es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rony para obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la construcción de macro túneles desde hace cuatro años.
Rony es un joven que le preocupa mucho la comodidad de su familia es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo para poder remodelar el techo de la cocina pues las láminas  que tiene se encuentran en muy mal estado.
El gran sueño de Rony es poder construir su casa y graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Rony is a 24-year-old young man. He is single and he lives with his parents in a community in Sololá. 

Rony has been building macro-tunnels for four years in order to obtain some income and help his parents with the household expenses.

He cares a lot about the comfort of his family; for this reason, he is requesting a loan in order to remodel the roof of the kitchen as the metal sheets are in a very bad state.

Rony’s great dream is to be able to build his own house and graduate from university.

loans.use: to remodel the kitchen roof

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is a weaver from Peru who specializes in alpaca apparel. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool.

Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"My artistic origins come from my family. My uncles worked in textiles and little by little they introduced me to this world," recalls Fernando. "I love being able to translate materials into beautiful designs. My work means everything to me: it's what I love and cherish, and I love the fact that I can provide for my family thanks to it."

"I feel very proud to have been born in Peru, which has such a rich history of traditions and culture. Alpaca wool has been used for centuries to create wonderful apparel, and I feel blessed to have the opportunity to carry forth that tradition while selling to a worldwide audience. Thanks to everyone who supports me through this micro-credit, and who appreciates everything that we artisans have to offer and  helps us continue to grow and prosper."

Use the link below to view Fernando's alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of alpaca wool to continue his unique creations.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis is 75 years old.  He is a widower and he has 3 sons who are adults already.  Luis has his own house-  it is a little place but he is comfortable.  Luis needs a loan to fix his room. 

He needs to buy cement. Luis needs your help because he can't receive a loan from other institutions because of his age

He appreciates the help you gave him in the past and he hopes you can help him again, because his relatives can't do it right now ... they have their own expenses.  Luis is convinced that the investment in his house is a good idea because the place is located in a good location, so that is why he is improving the place little by little.

loans.use: to fix his room so that his house will be in a better condition

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a mother of two children at the age of 40. She wants to earn a living and help her husband in providing for the needs of her family, so she engaged in a piggery business. As time goes by, her family's needs are increasing. She needs to increase her income to meet the needs of her family. She also needs to increase her store inventory and have more sales in order to increase her income. She decided to avail a loan again to buy additional pigs for the piggery so that she will have more pigs to sell.

In the future, Jessica plans to buy a new vehicle for delivery of pigs in the market.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs for the piggery.

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Eddisam

texts.en:
Eddisam is married with 4 children who all go to school and he lives in Kasese, Uganda.  He is a farmer growing crops, animal rearing and poultry keeping - mainly broilers for selling. 

He desires to improve his poultry house by expanding it, so that he can rear more chickens, which will help him supply to full capacity. Eddisam is a hard working man faced with the challenge of pests and diseases which can limit his expected returns.

He is asking for a loan to buy bricks, sand and pay for labour to build his poultry house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, sand and pay for labour  to build his poultry house.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah used the previous loan to buy wheat flour to use for baking. She is still in the baking business along with arts and crafts and is faced with challenges of low capital and losses. Besides that, she has future prospects of making a bakery center. Sarah has asked for a loan to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for baking bread.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and cooking oil for baking bread.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking, honest man. He is married with eight children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. William is a farmer dealing is poultry and crop production for additional income. William began the business in order to look after his children. He has a dream of being the best poultry farmer in the area. However, he is faced with a challenge of diseases and market competition. William is requesting a loan to buy poultry feed like chicken mash to feed his chickens.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed like chicken mash to feed his chickens

loans.name: Saul

texts.en: Saul is a 37-year-old married man with five children, four of whom go to school in Kasese, Uganda. Saul used the previous loan to buy salt to sell.  He has owned a general store for eleven years now and carries out farming for additional income growing crops like maize, cotton, and coffee. Saul started his business to cater to his family. Saul hopes to become a great businessman by transforming his business into a wholesale business to increase his profits despite being challenged by price fluctuations and high transport costs. Saul intends to use the loan to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, soap, and rice for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cassava flour, soap, and rice for resale

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en: Alex is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group, where members guarantee each other. He is aged 30 with one child, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and at the same time has a retail shop that adds more income. He faces a challenge of banana bacterial wilt disease that destroys his banana plantation so heavily, leading to low yields. Besides that, he is looking forward to expanding his plantation to new areas. Alex needs a loan to mulch his banana plantation. The extra member is still saving and hopes to borrow in the next cycle of borrowing.

loans.use: to mulch his banana plantation.

loans.name: Erimia

texts.en: Erimia used the previous loan to complete payment for land. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas and sweet potatoes to sell. He faces the challenge of unpredictable weather changes. Besides that, he hopes to build a permanent house and educate all his children to higher levels of learning. He has asked for a loan to rent two gardens of sweet potatoes to harvest and sell.

loans.use: to rent two gardens of sweet potatoes to harvest and sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 30-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of transport and farming selling bananas. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital that hinders progress of his business. However, he has future prospects of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Moses needs a loan to complete payment for a motorcycle.

loans.use: to complete payment for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Buhara United Group

texts.en: Clovice is a member of Buhara United Group, where members guarantee each other. He is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh foods and at the same time grows bananas and sweet potatoes to sell. He faces challenges of price and weather changes that hinder progress of his business. Clovice needs a loan to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and trim his banana plantation. The rest of the members in the photo are savers and hope to borrow in the next cycle.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods like tomatoes and trim his banana plantation.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.en:
Ciro is a weaver from Peru who specializes in wool tapestries. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wool yarn and cotton thread, as well as acquire new weaving tools for his workshop.

Ciro has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

Ciro has been making tapestries since 1976. "From the time I was very young, I was interested in learning the weaving art from master weaver Gregorio Sulca. Everything I know was learned in his workshop," he says. "For me, no matter how simple it may be, this art is something beautiful. It's exciting when I feel the wool in my hands and begin to delineate the different forms according to my own inspiration. This is a great motivation for me. I try to transmit all the wonderful heritage of our ancestors in my work. I don't want this to die out."

"I am very grateful for this micro-credit. It is thanks to support like this that I have been able to grow my business. I look forward to creating new designs using the funds from this loan."

Use the link below to view Ciro's wool tapestries on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/5925">http://www.novica.com/kiva/5925

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wool yarn and cotton thread, as well as to acquire new weaving tools for his workshop

loans.name: Cintia Marisela

texts.es: Cintia es madre soltera, a sus 21 años de edad  tiene un hijo de 2 año, ella comenta vive con su madre, su padrastro y con su hijo, Cintia es una joven tranquila que creció en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de ganado y al jornal de trabajo en el campo, Cintia es una madre amorosa que trabaja para tener los ingresos suficientes para salud y alimentación de su hijo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que comenta que mediante el ordeño de las vacas y la venta de leche es como puede obtiene sus ingresos. Cintia con el crédito anterior compro terneros y en estas fechas  los vendió y con el dinero del crédito reunió el capital con el que le alcanza a comprar una vaca. Cintia tiene la aspiración de seguir creciendo su negocio para el bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Cintia is a 21-year-old single mother. She has a two-year-old son. She says that she lives with her mother, her stepfather, and her son. Cintia is a calm young woman who grew up in the country. She raises cattle and works as a day labourer in the field. Cintia is a loving mother who works to obtain the necessary income for feeding her son and looking after his health. She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow because she says that by milking the cows and selling the milk, she will be able to obtain more income. Cintia used the previous loan to buy calves and she has now sold them. With the money from the sale, and the money from the loan, she will be able to buy a cow.

Cintia hopes to continue growing her business for the well-being of her son.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ariunchimeg

texts.en: Ariunchimeg, 25 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a data entry clerk at a bank since 2011. Her husband grows vegetables in the countryside. Their daughter goes to kindergarten. They just moved into an empty new apartment, so she is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy a sofa, television set and carpets in order to create a comfortable environment for her family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy a sofa, television set and carpets for her new apartment.

loans.name: Miroslava

texts.en:
Miroslava is divorced. She has a daughter. Miroslava works in a pizza restaurant as a waitress. She is a punctual and hardworking person.

Miroslava is asking for a loan of 12 000 UAH to buy a notebook. Using a laptop she could help her daughter with school, get a part- time job, and just follow the news. Miroslava plans to open a small business and give her a daughter a high education.

loans.use: to buy a laptop so that she help her daughter with her education and also follow the news

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is a hard-working and diligent mother. She has never tired of supporting her family, especially her grandchildren. Agapita is engaged in a snack vending business. Her business is doing well and she works hard to earn for her family. Agapita has maximized her profits and kept pursuing her goals for the good of her family. 

Agapita has taken out another loan from PMPC to buy additional raw ingredients for the food snacks that she makes and sells. She hopes and prays that her business will grow and that she will make more snack recipe to increase sales to continuously benefit her family, especially her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for the food snacks that she makes and sells to help her grandchildren

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 37 years old, married and has two children. She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for four years already and it helps them with a lot of their family needs. But Rachel still is aiming for a better income for her family so she wants to increase her income through her sari sari store business. To have this she needs financial assistance to buy additional goods to sell in the store and that's why she availed herself of a loan to buy these goods.

Rachel's plan for the future is to save money from her business.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in the store.

loans.name: Jecris

texts.en:
Jecris is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jecris is 22 years old and has one child in school.

Jecris has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.  Jecris has been in this business for one year. In the future, Jecris would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Virgilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Virgilia is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Virgilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies to provide a secure foundation for her family

loans.name: Avelinda

texts.en:
Avelinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Avelinda is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Avelinda has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Avelinda has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Avelinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Bosco

texts.en: Bosco is a 29-year-old married man with two children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business running a beauty salon and at the same time is a photographer. He started these businesses with the hope of employing himself to get an income, and in the future, he dreams of establishing a salon in town. Bosco needs a loan to buy salon equipment like dryers and chemicals.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment like dryers and chemicals.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka is an artisan from Indonesia who specializes in wood carvings. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood as well as new carving and wood pressing tools for her workshop.

Eka has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is her story:

Eka is inspired by her children and family. "My children are my biggest motivation to work. I always keep my spirit up and go on strong for my children. Thanks to them I do not falter, and thanks to all of you for always supporting me and for encouraging me to develop new ideas and designs for sculptures so they will always be liked."

"Thank you to all those who support me with this loan, as it will really benefit my business. I am hopeful that the new tools will make my product quality even better. Thanks!"

Use the link below to view Eka's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/7351">http://www.novica.com/kiva/7351

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood as well as new carving and wood pressing tools for her workshop

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is the father of four children and has worked as a motor cab driver for the past nine years. His business involves motor for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his family. 

For him to continue his business, he asked a loan to pay for spare parts, overhaul and supplies for the maintenance. Arnold dreams of owning motor units to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, overhaul and supplies for the maintenance of his motor cab

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Faith has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business.Faith wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en: Lenie makes a living through her junk shop business. she runs a junk shop in D'ban, Calamba, Philippines and earns a promising income to support her family. She has signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to gain access to capitalization. She wants to increase her inventory. Now, she has requested a loan to purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital in her junk shop business. Lenie hopes to sustain her business and dreams of sending all her children to school and owning a  second-hand motor cycle for service.

loans.use: to buy scrap and metal junk

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en: Rose Ann, a hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of various fruits for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more kilos of various fruits for retail to provide her family with a better life

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia has mastered her swine production and makes a good earning in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her husband in raising their family and sending her children to school. 

She wants to increase her profit, so Virgilia approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase additional bags of feed and animal vitamins. She has high hopes that she will have more savings for the repair and expansion of her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of feed and animal vitamins to be able to expand her home eventually

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old, married and has three children. To earn a living and be able to help her husband for a living, she is engaged in a sari-sari store business for 15 years already.  Since she was single until she get married, she still has done this kind of business. 

As their family grows, needs are increasing also, so she wants to increase her income also and to have this she needs to increase her store inventory. To make it happen she decided to take a loan to buy additional grocery items for the store to sell.

Myrna plan for the future to expand her business by renovating her store building.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her store to sell for the future renovation of her store

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 49 years old and married with six children. With two children in school, Remedios works very hard to provide for them.

Remedios runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries.

Remedios has been in this business for 7 years now. 

In the future, Remedios would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, beverages, personal product care and other groceries

loans.name: Luis Edmundo

texts.es: En una ciudad de Ecuador vive Luis un hombre de 55 años de edad, él se dedica a la crianza de pollos en un corral que construyo él mismo y también trabaja al jornal, Luis tiene dos hijos, el de 29 años ya es independiente y el de 28 años depende de su padre ya que sufre de una enfermedad que le impide caminar normalmente, don Luis es viudo y por este motivo tiene que luchar solo para salir adelante junto a su hijo que camina con muletas ya que sus pies no le funcionan, Luis va a invertir el credito en la compra de pollos, la mayor aspiración de este señor es mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo para obtener  mas ganancias y los recursos necesarios para cubrir los gastos de salud de su hijo, la alimentación de su hogar y de ser posible quiere comprar una pequeña casa donde puedan vivir más tranquilos, ya que en la actualidad paga arriendo por una casa en la que vive con su hijo.
texts.en:
Luis is a 55 year old man who lives in a city in Ecuador. He works raising chickens in a pen he constructed himself and he also works as day labor. Luis has two children. The 29 year old is independent and the 28 year old still depends on his father as he suffers from a sickness that impedes him from walking properly. Luis is a widower and for this reason has to fight alone to get ahead with his son who uses crutches to walk as his feet do not function.

Luis will use the loan to buy chickens. The biggest wish of this man is to improve his business and expand it to obtain more profits and the resources to cover his son's medical expenses and food for the house. And if possible he wants to buy a small house where they can live more peacefully as at present he is leasing a house where he lives with his son.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Roselyn is 20 years old.

Roselyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. Roselyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Beatriz is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Beatriz has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients and raw products for her business.

Beatriz has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and raw products for her business to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Loimata

texts.en: Loimata is 44 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as rice,sugar,salt,chicken etc. She has been doing this for 3 years. Loimata needs a loan to buy a freezer, display cooler, snacks, toiletries etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and also to support her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, display cooler, goods and daily items, to help support her children's education

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana engages in farming. She grows and sells rice.  She is a married woman with seven grown children from San Miguel, Bohol. Aside from rice farming, she also raises and sells hogs. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 6 years now.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers and medicines. These  are very essential tool that would improve her both sources of income.  Thus, her finances will become stable and start to expand her business.

She is hoping that she will have a bountiful harvest that would help improve her earnings and to have a sustainable living in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and farm supplies like fertilizers and medicines

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has a coconut farm in Aloran, Philippines, which is the primary source of income for her family. To generate additional earnings, she wants to plant bananas and grow root crops.  Rebecca makes it a point to have good land preparation in order to have maximum yield and a good income. 

She recently needed a loan to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings, which she borrowed from Paglaum MPC.  Rebecca wishes to have more produce and to be able to supply agricultural commodities in the market.  In the future, Rebecca hopes to engage agricultural business ventures to have more income for her family.

loans.use: to pay for clearing and plowing land, and for the holing and planting of seedlings, to have more income for her family

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine has mastered her hog raising business in Tudela. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail of credit to fully support her business. Just as how she takes care her hog raising business and so with her membership with PMPC. 

She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always run for any financing needs. Now, the loan of Php 14,000 will help her build a concrete pig pens that would support sanitation and care for the environment.

loans.use: to build a concrete pig pens with better sanitation and care for the environment

loans.name: Benjamín

texts.es:
Benjamín es un hombre de 34 años de edad, es soltero tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 3 y 7 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Benjamín con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas desde hace 10 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes.
Benjamín por ser un hombre que tiene mucha experiencia en el campo ha considerado que esta época es la más adecuada para cultivar zanahoria, pero Benjamín no cuenta con el  dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus semillas de zanahoria y comprar sus fertilizantes, por tal razón solicita un crédito para poder cultivar en esta temporada.
El gran sueño de Benjamín es poder construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Benjamín is a 34 year old man. He is single and has a beautiful family of three children, between the ages of 3 and 7. This humble family in the community of Sololá.

In order to generate income and support his family, Benjamín has grown vegetables for 10 years, but in order to improve his income, he has a small store where he sells groceries.

Because he is a man who has a lot of experience in the fields, Benjamín considers this to be the best time to grow carrots. However, Benjamín  doesn't have enough money to to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer. That is why he is asking for a loan to be able to plant during this season. 

Benjamín's big dream is to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ugiloy

texts.en:
Ugiloy is a hardworking girl. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of farmers. She is single and lives with her parents. She studies at the pedagogical college. Her parents are in agriculture and she also has a practice keeping livestock and planting agricultural products. Ugiloy wants to be educated and work at a school to teach students. 

In order to get a higher education she needs money to pay for it. She decided to have a business and earn money to her education. She asked a help of IMON and participated at start-up training which was useful to her how to do a new success business. She is asking financial support from Kiva lenders to buy livestock and start doing business. She hopes to spend earned money to her education. Her parents are ready to help and support her in her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start doing business in order to continue her advanced education

loans.name: Losi

texts.en: Losi is 58 years old and a widow with four children. She makes and sells crafts, such as fans to earn a living, and has been doing this for four years. Losi has requested a loan to buy paint, materials, a paint brush, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint, materials, a paint brush,  etc.

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia Noemí pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continúa dedicándose al negocio de ferretería, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia sigue vendiendo pinturas, cementos, clavos entre otros para sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pintura entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower, Noemí, belongs to the SAN RAFAEL communal bank. She continues to work in the hardware business. She is a responsible and hardworking person. She continues to sell paints, cement, nails and more for her clients who ask her for these things. This is the way that the borrower gets her family ahead.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint, among other things.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is from the village of Tudela. He is 30 years old and single. Jessie owns and operates a sari-sari store business in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years. In 2013, Jessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. 

He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jessie is requesting a new loan of 14,900.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital and improve the living condition of his family

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. Jovencia tried her luck on doing a business focusing on her hog raising activity. She feels she owe her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. 

Jovencia loaned another amount to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins. Jovencia looks for better business opportunities and would love to be in the position to help others.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins to be able to help others

loans.name: Dalia

texts.es: Doña Dalia tiene 40 años; es casada; tiene tres hijos; tiene su propio negocio de fabricación de tamales, los cuales vende al público, de esta manera colabora con los gastos familiares.  Está solicitando un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) este dinero lo invertirá en mejoras en la infraestructura del local en el cual elabora este producto.
texts.en:
Doña Dalia is 40 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She has her own tamale-making business, which she sells to the public. By doing so, she is able to help out with household expenses.

She is requesting one million Costa Rican Colones (¢1.000.000). She will use this money to invest in infrastructure improvements for the premises in which she makes her product.

loans.use: to invest in infrastructure improvement.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Hard work pays when you know you are doing the right thing. Mylene has proved once again that she is worthy of your trust. She may have tried and handled different types of industries where she used her previous loans availed from Kiva but she she never fail to pay it on time. Her last loan was able to cover the maintenance cost of her laundries and also increase her profits.

She is very positive that she could improve her laundry shop more if you will lend her again an amount of PHP 50,000. Mylene will use the new loan to pay the maintenance cost of her laundry units, and if she will still have enough budget, she plans buying new ones.
