She could have more clients who will bring their laundry to her shop if the units are regularly maintained and operating well.

Mylene hopes to have a bigger space for her laundry shop so she could accommodate more clients and laundries. She desires to have a better life and a flourishing business to support the needs of her family. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance of her laundry to improve her service and for it to be expanded due to demand .

loans.name: Karen Roxana

texts.es:
Karen, es cosmetóloga, tiene su propio local y ofrece sus servicios a domicilio, vive con su hija de tres años y su esposo, en su comunidad son muy reconocidos por ser personas trabajadoras y honestas, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 7 años, contaba con pocos clientes, hoy en día ya han aumentado, atiende de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, trabaja sola, el oficio lo aprendió asistiendo a clases a una academia de cosmetología de la cual se graduó.
Necesita de un préstamo para comprar un mueble, un espejo y cosméticos, equipara mejor el negocio, de esta manera tendrá un local más cómodo y ofrecerá a sus clientes nueva mercadería, espera tener mejores ingresos para responder a sus obligaciones.
Sus aspiraciones son expandir su negocio y darle a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Karen is a cosmetologist. She has her own local, and she travels to customers' houses to offer her services. She lives with her 3-year-old daughter and her husband. The people of her community are well-known for being hard-working and honest. She has had her business for the past 7 years. At first, she had few customers, but now she has more. She serves customers from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. She works alone. She learned this work by taking classes at a cosmetology academy, from which she graduated. 

She needs a loan to buy furniture, a mirror, and cosmetics in order to stock her business better so that she can have a more comfortable local and offer her customers new merchandise. She hopes to earn a higher income in order to attend to her responsibilities. She dreams of expanding her business and giving her family a more decent life.

loans.use: to buy furniture, a mirror, and cosmetics in order to stock her business better so that she can have a more comfortable local and offer her customers new merchandise.

loans.name: Lumenica

texts.en:
Lumenica is a 39 years old and married. To earn for living and help her husband for their family needs. She engaged in a sari-sari store business in preparation also for having a child. She wants to increase her income so she needs financial assistance in increasing her store inventory and to make her income increase also so decided to take a loan again to buy additional goods for the store to sell.


Lumenica wants for the future to save money out from her business.

loans.use: To buy additional goods for the store to sell and be able to save money

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy salt.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 59 years old, married and has ten children but eight are married already. To earn a living and to help her husband to provide her family needs, she engaged in a water melon garden. Her nature of business is to plant water melon and sell it to the market. 

Because of the increasing demand of her children's education, she needs to increase her income so she decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for the water melon plants to come up with a good harvest and have a good quality of water melon to be sell in the market.

Milagros plan for the future to build a new house for her family out from her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the water melon plants to help build a new house

loans.name: Bertha Luisa

texts.es:
Bertha  es una señora de 40 años de edad, es casada tiene una hermosa familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 3 y 22 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Bertha con el afán de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos desde hace 15 años, ella eligió esta actividad pues es a lo que su familia se dedica, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica también al cultivo de arveja y papa.
Bertha es una mujer muy emprendedora  porque ahora ha tomado la decisión de comparar un lote de terreno para seguir ampliando su cultivo, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, es por tal motivo que solicita un crédito para comprar su terreno.
El gran sueño de Berta es  que sus hijos se gradúen y construirles una casa.
texts.en:
Bertha is a 40 year old lady, she's married, and has a beautiful family of 3 children of ages between 3 and 22. They live together in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj.

Bertha, wishing to generate income and help her husband with household expenses, has been working in the production of traditional fabrics for 15 years. She chose this activity because its the family business, but to improve their income she also works in the cultivation of peas and potatoes.

Bertha is a very entrepreneurial woman because she has now decided to buy a plot of land to continue expanding her crops, but one of the difficulties she has is that she does not have enough money available. This is why she is requesting a loan so she can buy a plot of land.

Bertha's dream is for her children to graduate and to buy them a house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café ha incrementado en un 30%, y con ello los ingresos que ha aprovechado para mejorar las condiciones de su familia, y realizar pequeñas inversiones en su finca.

Para continuar con esas inversiones, este año Victorino está solicitando un financiamiento para renovar dos manzanas de café, lo cual le permitirá incrementar su producción en los próximos años, así como sus ingresos.

En el futuro, este pequeño productor se ve produciendo como mínimo 500 quintales de café de buena calidad. Para ello, uno de sus principales desafíos es aumentar el área de café y darle un buen manejo.
texts.en:
Victorino is a small coffee grower and he lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. In the last 3 years, his coffee production has increased by 30%, and with it, his income. He has used it to improve his family's living conditions and make small investments in his farm. 

To continue with these investments, this year Victorino is asking for a loan to renew two hectares of coffee. This will allow him to increase production in the next few years, as well as his income. 

In the future, this small farmer will be producing a minimum of 500 quintals of good quality coffee. To do that, on of his main challenges is to increase the area of coffee and manage it well.

loans.use: to renew two hectares of coffee an increase his income for his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, pipes and manual labor to install waste water pipes in her home.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza es una mujer de 56 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en vivienda de su propiedad desde hace 28 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de tener un lugar donde descansar después de sus arduos días de trabajo. Esperanza se gana la vida vendiendo minutas, que es un raspado de hielo con jarabes de diferentes sabores, además vende pasteles de carne y yuca frita con lo que logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, también su esposo apoya con los gastos de su hogar. Esperanza desea mejorar su calidad de vida ya que actualmente cuenta con un servicio sanitario de hoyo seco y ella desea instalar tuberías de aguas negras y de esta manera mejorar la sanidad de su hogar, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, tuberías, arena y mano de obra para instalar tuberías de aguas negras en su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera mejorar la sanidad de su hogar  y la de sus vecinos.
texts.en: Esperanza is a 56 year old woman who has lived for 28 years in her own house with her husband. She feels very happy to have a place to rest after her hard days of work. Esperanza earns her living by selling "minutas", shaved ice with sugar syrup of different flavors. Also, she sells meat pies and fried cassava. With this she supports her family. Her husband also helps with household expenses. Esperanza wants to improve her quality of life, because she currently has pit latrines and she wants to install sewerage pipes to improve her home's sanitation. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest in: cement, pipes, sand and hand labor to install sewerage pipes in her house as soon as possible, and in this way to improve the sanitation of her home and that of her neighbors.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, pipes, sand and hand labor to install sewerage pipes in her house.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut is the head of Sari Karya group. She’s responsible for the payment of the group and represents the whole members, she brings the money to the Loan Officer of MUK. Ni Ketut, 50, has 2 children. She’s a hard working woman and her daily life involves work as a farmer. Ni Ketut had sold her pigs and earned a net profit of 2.000.000 IDR. Now the price for 1 kg pork has fallen dramatically, from 30.000 IDR to 22.000 IDR. But Ni Ketut still feels grateful for the result. She can fullfil her family's daily needs and saving.
The Sari Karya group applied for a new loan, with the same 14 members. They still need a loan until they can have enough saving for working capital. They will use the loan to buy more pigs, and to buy feed and vitamins. Ni Ketut will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior feed. Now she has a sow and 6 healthy piglets, and she will sell them after 4 months. Although Ni Ketut is a widow, she keeps her spirit to run her life. She hopes the price for pork will rise again and she will be able to save all the profit. One group member is not pictured because of a religious ceremony at her temple.

loans.use: to purchase superior pig feed

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y es padre de 8 hijos. Se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 20 años, en una alejada comunidad al norte de Nicaragua; donde existen condiciones climáticas favorables para la producción de café.

La producción de café de este emprendedor ha venido mejorando en los últimos tres años, y para mantener este incremento está solicitando un crédito que le permita la renovación de dos manzanas de café. Esta actividad, le permitirá sustituir plantas de edad avanzada que ya no están produciendo, por nuevas plantas que le garantizarán mejores rendimientos y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia, la cual es la prioridad  para este emprendedor que día a día se esfuerza para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ramon is 50 years old. He is married and is the father of 8 children. He has earned a living as a coffee farmer for more than 20 years in a remote community in Northern Nicaragua where there are favorable climate conditions for growing coffee.

The coffee production of this entrepreneur has been improving in the last three years, and in order to sustain this growth he is requesting a loan that will allow him to renovate two manzanas [plots of land] of coffee. This will allow him to replace the aged plants that are no longer producing with new plants that will guarantee him greater yields and greater income for his family. Family is the priority for this entrepreneur, who strives day after day to give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies that will allow him to renovate two manzanas of coffee and achieve greater production yields.

loans.name: Balon Group

texts.en:
The Balon Group is led by the 42 year-old young farmer Ono, who is standing from row, second from the right, pointing his thumb up in the photo and wear a black sleeveless-shirt. The other farmers in the group are Mini, Mardi, Hartoyo, Anto, Ukir and Tarwo. Because Anto were unable to attend at photo-taking process, he were represented by his wife, which have agreed to be displayed on Kiva. They are standing in front of a cow house. Ono has a family with three children. All of them live in a small village in Karanganyar, Indonesia.

Ono has been running a small-scale vegetable farming and have a few cows to be fattened to resale. His business is going well. Recently, he also works as a bio-digester mason for Household Biogas (BIRU) program. However, he was deeply concerned to see the cow dung was wasted without further processing in the area around his residence, and it also polluted the surrounding neighborhood with a pungent odor.

After advised by Yayasan Rumah Energi and LKM “Rukun Makmur” (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) to install bio-digester, Ono realized that biogas is a good solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he knows that bio-slurry (biogas residue) is a good organic fertilizer for his plants. Ono invited six of his friends above to form a farmer group. He is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other farmer group members to make it possible.

He have an optimism that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation, which can increase his family revenue. He hopes that in the future, he can invite the whole farmers in his village to use biogas. He also want to share the remaining bio-slurry to his farming neighbor.

loans.use: To build bio-digesters facility and utilize bio-slurry (biogas residues) as organic fertilizers

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is a 56-year old mother of 11 children, all of whom are married. She is engaged in a business, buying and selling vegetables. Even though she doesn't have any children to provide for, she still aims to earn income for her and her husband's needs.

Benita decided to take a loan to buy more vegetables to sell and generate more income from her profits. She plans to save money for the future to sustain the needs of her and her husband.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living with her parents in their apartment. She is divorced and has one child. She participated in three days of training provided by IMON to startup clients. She has a plan to sew traditional women's dresses. She has had experience sewing dresses and sewing fabric. She is well known among friends and tailors for her beautiful modern designed dresses. She has requested a loan from KIVA and IMON to start her business at home, serving Tajik women with clothing (traditional dresses). She is planning to buy a computerized sewing machine to decorate her dresses. She hopes to be supported and do business in order to help her child grow and feed her family.

loans.use: to buy a computerized sewing machine to decorate her dresses

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La Socia Amelia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de andamios meatlicos,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales para hacer trabajos de andamios metálicos como metales, pinturas y clavos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Amelia continues working in her business of selling metallic scaffolding. She is a hard working woman who through this business wants to help her family get ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy materials to build metallic scaffolding such as metals, paint, and nails. She is happy for the loan and is committed to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: To buy materials to build metallic scaffolding such as metals, paint, and nails.

loans.name: Andrea Marisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de ropa, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in the business of buying and selling clothing. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She wants to get ahead through this business. She is applying for a loan to purchase pants, blouses, and sweaters.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Emilie

texts.en:
Emilie is 34 years old and married with four children, ages 3-12. Her husband works in a private company, and his income helps the family cover their daily expenses.

Emilie raises hogs to earn a living. Her vocation for 2 years now, she would like to sell quality pigs in less time but needs more forage to do so. To meet this goal, she is asking for a loan to purchase pig feed. This will help to boost her income and provide her growing children with quality food and with tuition to continue to attend school.

In the future, Emilie dreams of expanding her hog raising business to be able to build a concrete shelter for her family and live more sustainably.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is grateful that she was previously granted a Php 19,000 loan which she used to buy raw ingredients needed to make her sandwich and bread spread business. Her earnings help support her family and meet their daily basic needs and was able to put up a small general store.

She would like now to apply for Php 15,000 which she will use to buy ingredients such as peanuts, oil, coconut, sugar to make her peanut butter and coco jam for sale. With part of the loan she will pay for some grocery items to sell at her store. She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Gemma believes that with her hard work God will grow and prosper her business. She hopes to be able to save for their old age. She prays for a long and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un padre de familia de 54 años de edad es unido de hecho tiene una familia de seis hijos de las edades entre 8 y 25 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad  de Sololá.
Francisco para darle lo mejor a sus hijos se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, el eligió esta actividad porque le gusta convivir con la naturaleza y porque es a lo que se ha dedicado toda su familia.
Francisco ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de papa y fertilizantes, pues el por ahora no cuenta con el capital suficiente  y necesita cultivar.
El gran sueño de Francisco es comprar más terreno para seguir aumentado su cultivo.
texts.en:
Francisco is the 54-year-old father of a family. He is in a common-law marriage and has a family of six children, with ages between 8 and 25. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

In order to give the best to his children, Francisco has worked in agriculture for 15 years. He chose this work because he likes to live together with nature and because this is what all his family has done.

Francisco now sees the need to apply for a loan to be able to buy his seed potatoes and fertilizers, since for now he doesn't have sufficient capital and he needs to plant.

Francisco's great dream is to buy more land to continue increasing his crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seed potatoes

loans.name: Triwana Sari Group

texts.en:
In their previous loan, one month ago Ni Komang - head of the Triwana Sari group - informed the members to prepare for repayment of their 19.500.000 IDR loan. The group has 13 members. Ni Komang was able to sell 2 pigs at the price of 2.500.000 IDR, and the remaining 1 pig will be sold in a few weeks. With the profit of 1.500.000 IDR, she is very grateful for the fund and will use the profits to provide for her children's education and also their daily needs.

With their 13 members, the Triwana Sari group decided to renew their loan and each receive 1.500.000 IDR. They decided to renew the loan until they have enough savings.

Ni Komang will use her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening. According to her plan, the pigs will b ready to sell in five months. The profit will be used to buy a sow, as she has a plan to become a piglet seller, especially local pigs.

She hopes her plan will come true and she can improve her business by sell piglets to other breeders.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets for fattening

loans.name: Fololina

texts.en: Fololina is a 35-year-old married woman with no children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. that she can sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. Fololina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheel barrow, seeds, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since April this year 2015. With her profits, Fololina hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheel barrow, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Faimalie

texts.en: Faimalie is a 45-year-old married woman with 6 children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, egg plant, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. Faimalie has requested a loan to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, chemicals, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since April this year 2015. With her profits, Faimalie hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to by seeds, a weed sprayer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Augusta

texts.es:
La socia Rosa Augusta se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosa Augusta continues working in her grocery store and restaurant. She sells basic food items such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. 

Rosa Augusta wants to be successful in her business. She is an entrepreneur and hard worker. She hopes to expand her grocery store. She requests a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

Rosa Augusta is happy to receive the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, cookies and crackers

loans.name: Margot Bonifacia

texts.es:
La socia Margot Bonifacia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años, el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,galletas, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Communal bank member Margot Bonifacia continues working in the grocery store and restaurant business. She sells basic necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and crackers. She wants to get ahead through this little business. She has already had [the business] for a number of years. Her dream is to have another grocery store. She is applying for the loan to buy rice, sugar, crackers, and milk.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make the payments on her account.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, crackers, and milk

loans.name: Maria Gladis

texts.es: Gladis es madre soltera, ella tiene 25 años de edad, Gladis vive con su hija de 3 años a la que ama mucho y por la que lucha día a día; ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y chanchos y también comenta que trabaja en el campo ya que lucha sola para sacar adelante a su hija porque el padre de su hija le apoya muy poco económicamente, Gladis necesita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chanchos, Gladis aspira comprar mas chanchos, que su negocio se incremente y que mejoren sus ingreso para darle a su hija lo necesario en el estudio y alimentación.
texts.en:
Gladis is a single mother, and she is 25 years old. Gladis lives with her 3-year-old daughter that she loves very much, and for whom she strives for day after day. She earns a living raising small animals like chickens and pigs, and also mentions that she works in the fields since she labors by herself to get her daughter ahead because her daughter's father provides very little financial support.

Gladis is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of pigs. Gladis hopes to buy more pigs so that her business will grow and her income will improve in order to give her daughter the necessities in education and nutrition.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna, 46, is a resident of Silang, Cavite, and a single mother with one child in elementary school. She has dedicated her life to raising her child and works hard to provide for herself and her child's needs. 

Myrna is in the fish selling business. At the local fish port early in the morning, she buys fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.

To help expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 15000 loan to buy more barrels of fish. Her increased earnings will be a great help in meeting her family's everyday needs and the schooling of her child. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and good return on her investment.

Myrna dreams of having her own stall at her town's public market. She prays that God will help her business prosper to give her child a better future and eventually to send her to a good college. She prays when she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God which she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for various kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer emprendedora y madre de 5 hijos, que se ha dedicado a la caficultura desde muy joven. Actualmente, este rubro es la principal fuente de ingresos con que cuenta para sostener su hogar, por lo que su meta es mejorar sus plantaciones de café para tener incrementar los rendimientos productivos.

Lo anterior, sumado a los constantes ataques de plagas y enfermedades que han sufrido sus cafetos, ha obligado a Virginia a realizar un plan de renovación de café, para estabilizar la producción de café de su finca, lo cual requiere de inversiones a mediano plazo. Por lo tanto, ella está solicitando un financiamiento que le permita asegurar las actividades de renovación de 4 manzanas de café este año, a fin de lograr una mayor producción e ingresos en los futuros ciclos.

Con este plan de desarrollo de su pequeña finca, Virginia logrará dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro al contar con una finca de café productiva y sostenible.
texts.en:
Virginia is an entrepreneurial woman and mother of 5 children that has earned a living in coffee farming since she was young. Currently this work is the main source of income that she relies on to support her home. Her goal is to improve her coffee plantations in order to increase the production yields.

Previously, due to the constant attacks from pests and sicknesses that her coffee trees have suffered, it has forced Virginia to make a coffee renovation plan to stabilize the coffee production on her plantation. This requires some medium-term investments. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will ensure the renovation activities on 4 manzanas [plots of land] of coffee this year in order to achieve greater production and income in future seasons.

With this development plan for her small property, Virginia will be able to give her children a better future by counting on a productive and sustainable coffee plantation.

loans.use: to ensure the renovation activities of 4 manzanas of coffee to achieve greater productivity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farrukh is a handsome man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. He is living in the same district as his family. He is married and responsible for feeding his family. 

Farrukh is a student at University, and is well known among students and friends. He is active in classes and interested to graduating with excellence his studies. Additionally, in order to feed his family he works after classes. He is a master of repairing houses and has permanent clients. He has appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to pay his tuition fees for higher education. He awaits KIVA's lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for higher education

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Mariela pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia sigue vendiendo productos naturales para la salud, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia sigue vendiendo sus productos naturales a sus clientes que le solicitan cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Señora Mariela belongs to the communal bank "San Rafael." She continues selling natural products for health. She is a responsible and hard-working person. She continues selling her natural products to her customers, who come to her every day. She wants to be able to continue working in her business, which is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.

She is applying for the loan to purchase natural products.

loans.use: to purchase natural products

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is thankful that she was granted a 20000 PHP loan which she used to purchase Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes to sell at her store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would like to apply for another 25000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for additional Ready-to-Wear clothes for women to sell. Various designs and styles of RTW clothes will give her customers a wide array of clothes to choose from. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Rosario dreams of having a bigger RTW Store to expand her business. She aims to give her children a good college education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear products, mostly ladies' wear.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is thankful that she was previously granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 20000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Emelia dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children a College Education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, products and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is thankful that she was previoulsy granted a 10000 PHP loan which she used to purchase supplies and merchandise products for her direct selling business. Her earnings support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for another 15000 loan which she will use to buy cosmetics, lotion products, deodorant, perfume, soap, and fabric softener needed in her business. Her income from selling as a dealer helps cover her family’s daily needs. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and a good return on her investment for it will surely fund their everyday needs and her children's education.

Emily dreams to have a store of her own to display her products and attract more customers. She aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like beauty products, clothing, toiletries and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Madai Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Madai Gabina se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia,el sueño de la socia es amplair el negocio de venta de granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Madai Gabina continues to work in the sale of dry grains such as corn, wheat, and quinoa. She wants to support her family with this business. She hopes to expand her sales of dry grains. 

Madai Gabina requests a loan to buy corn, barley and wheat. She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Deogracias

texts.en:
Deogracias has been toiling the land and growing rice for more than five years now. She is 61 years old with seven grown dependents. She needs funds to help her sustain her farming livelihood. She is residing in the town of Trinidad, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings.  These will help improve her harvest and enable her to grow more rice. With this, her income will increase and enable her to balance her finances. Thus, she will be able to expand her business and set aside some savings for emergency use.

She hopes that she will be able to handle her rice farming business so she can purchase a portion of a lot for business expansion in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 54 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 12 y 28 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Miguel para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica  a la compra y venta de verduras, él tiene ya 11 años de realizar esta labor.
Miguel con esfuerzo de su  día a día a logrado que su negocio creciera, pero el ahora cree que es necesario realizar un crédito para poder invertir un poco más y surtirlo mejor, esa es la razón por la cual Miguel solicita un préstamo   para comprar verduras como repollo, cebolla, papa.
El gran sueño de Miguel es poder agrandar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel is a man of 54. He is married and has a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 12 and 28. This humble family lives in a community of Sololá.

In order to generate his income and raise his children, Miguel buys and sells vegetables. He has already been doing this work for 11 years. With his day-to-day effort, Miguel has succeeded in making his business grow, but now he believes that it is necessary to take out a loan in order to be able to invest a little more and stock his business better. This is the reason why Miguel is applying for a loan: to purchase vegetables such as cabbages, onions, and potatoes.

Miguel's great dream is to be able to enlarge his business in order to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables such as cabbages, onions, and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La señora Roxana pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, la socia continua  dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de productos naturales para la salud, la socia sigue vendiendo sus productos naturales a sus clientes que le solicitan cada día, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando en su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Roxana belongs to the community bank SAN RAFAEL. She continues her business of selling natural health products. She continues to sell her natural products to customers who request them every day. She wishes to continue working in this business which is doing well because of the work she puts in every day.

Roxana requests a loan to buy natural products.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a hardworking mother from Aloran. She is 61 years old and a businesswoman who makes copra. She buys whole coconuts for this. Loreta has signed up for her membership in the cooperative to gain access to insurance and credit. She applied for a loan to buy whole coconuts for making copra. Loreta hopes to succeed in this business to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to make copra (dried coconut meat used for oil production)

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is a father of five children at the age of 51. He needs to earn a living to provide the needs of his family. He is engaged in a vegetable garden with the help of his wife. The nature of his business is planting vegetables and after harvesting them, selling them to the market and neighborhood. As his family grows, the family's needs are increasing also and he needs to increase his income. So he decided to avail a loan again to buy fertilizer for the vegetable plants to have plenty of vegetables to harvest.

Ruben's plan for the future is to renovate his house using his business income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the vegetable plants.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Don Pablo es un hombre de 35 años de edad es casado, tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 2 y 12 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Don Pablo con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace 14 años, gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su linda familia.
Don Pablo gracias a la dedicación y esmero que le pone a su trabajo, el elabora unos trajes bonitos y de buena calidad y mucha gente lo busca para comprarle, es por eso que él ahora requiere de un poco más de capital para comprar hilos  de tipo seda, alemán, lustrina, mish.
El gran sueño de Pablo es poder terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Don Pablo is a man of 35. He is married and has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 2 and 12. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

With the goal of generating his income and supporting his family, Don Pablo has been making traditional clothing for 14 years. Thanks to this work, he has managed to raise his beautiful family.

Thanks to the dedication and effort that he puts into his work, he makes lovely dresses of good quality, and many people seek him out in order to buy them. It is for this reason that he now needs a little more capital to buy thread of various types: silk thread, German embroidery thread, cotton thread, and Mish two-ply thread.

Pablo's great dream is to be able to finish the construction of his house.

loans.use: to buy various types of thread: silk, German embroidery, cotton, and Mish two-ply

loans.name: Sombang Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek and the Sombang Lestari group managed to fatten their pigs and keep them for six months. After they reached the maximum weight, the group sold them to the big buyer to make sure they received a good price. After they deducted the costs and made their payment, Ni Kadek earned a profit of 375.000 IDR per month.

Since the pig’s program has proven to support their living, the Sombang Lestari group proposed a new loan for the same loan size. They will use it to purchase superior piglets and feed, renovate the cages and buy some medicines. Ni Kadek plans to keep her piglets for fattening. She will use her loan to purchase three superior piglets for 400.000 IDR each. She will use her own money to purchase feed and renovate the cage. Ni Kadek will save all the profit and use it as working capital. She hopes all the savings will be enough to continue the business without having another loan.

loans.use: to purchase three superior piglets

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en: Roberta, 59 years old, is from Alcantara, Cebu. She is married with six children. Five of them are adults but she is also supporting the needs of her youngest child who is in her last year of college. Her husband is a jeepney driver. Roberta helps her family by raising hogs and producing copra from coconuts. She is asking for a loan to make renovations on her piggery and on her house. She will use the loan to buy plywood, paint, and nails and pay for labor. Roberta hope that she can increase her profits once she can house more piglets to raise. She also dreams of making general repairs and renovation on her house once her youngest child finishes her schooling.

loans.use: to buy plywood, paint, and nails and pay for labor

loans.name: Shumila

texts.en:
Shumila is a 31-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. For many years, her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidery in the nearby town. 

He recruits skilled workers for the embroidery work, giving them daily wages. He also brings some material home for Shumila, because she helps him with the embroidery work. He is an expert in his profession, and he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate for his efforts. 

He wants to cope with the demand for bridal dresses, and for this, he is seeking a loan to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Shumila requires capital to buy the desired inventory for her husband, but she does not have sufficient cash in hand. So she has humbly requested a loan  from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan, her husband would be able to buy the inventory he needs. Shumila is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a resident of the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He is a married man with 10 children. Three of his children are still attending school. He goes fishing and sells fresh fish to the locals in his area. He has been engaged in fishing for more than five years now.

He has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net. These will help improve his catch and enable him to sell more fish to the market.  Thus, he will increase his income and be able to provide his children with the basic needs. He will now be able to pay his obligations and start to expand his fishing business.

He is determined to handle his livelihood properly in order to purchase his own vehicle that is essential in transporting his catch.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 57 years old, single and lives in Tudela, Philippines. In order to earn a living, she takes in and raises pigs. Through Paglaum MPC, she obtained the capital to purchase additional piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of feed

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita, 60, is a resident in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with nine children. Her youngest is 19 years old. She toils the land and grows rice, and this is her main source of income. Together with her husband, she has been engaged in rice farming for a many years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.  With these, she will be able to continue her farming livelihood and be able to grow and harvest quality rice. Slowly, Agapita's earnings will improve and enable her to start to balance her finances. 

In the future, she hopes that she will be successful in handling her sources of income for a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy thread, shawls, bracelets, and güipiles.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela Mayor de edad casada originaria de Managua  con tres hijos, todos mayores de edad casado y trabajan, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Lamentablemente no pudo seguir estudiando por falta de recursos económicos, y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante Ángela tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano dese hace ocho años, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, la rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos.  Ángela agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Angela is married with three children and originally from Managua. All of her children are married and working. She stands out for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve. On her free time, she likes to enjoy spending time with her family. 

Unfortunately she could not continue her studies due to lack of financial resources and the need to work to help with the household expenses.

Because of her desire to succeed, Angela earns a living selling secondhand clothes for eight years. The business is located in her house.  Her routine is to sell her products about ten hours a day.

Angela appreciates the assistance that the kiva investors provide to people in need in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing such as pants, shawls, skirts, shirts, dresses, and blouses.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a 29-year-old married woman with one child. She engages in fruit vending, particularly in mangoes. She buys mangoes and sells them at the market. She aims to increase her income because of the high price of commodities and the increasing needs of her family. Recently, she decided to take a loan to buy more mangoes to sell in her stall.

Concepcion plans in the future to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 30-year-old mother of two children. Her husband owns an electrical shop in which he sells electrical goods. He also provides services to his clients for the maintenance of electrical appliances. For the growth of his business and the desire to generate the maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods. Therefore, Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders and sockets to offer to his customers.

Nargis hopes that her husband will be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods such as bulbs, tubes and energy savers, switches, bulb holders and sockets for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.en:
Ceferino, age 49, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Melba, a general store owner, and has three children. One attends High School, the other one is in the Elementary Level and the eldest is already working. He works hard to provide for his family's daily needs and for his children's schooling.

Ceferino has had a food business for a number of years already. He operates a small snack stall that serves mainly "lugaw" (Filipino version of congee) which is a big favorite of Filipinos. A food stall is a common sight especially in populated areas. He cooks the best "lugaw" in town which makes his stall popular in their area with neighbors and the local working community as his regular customers. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 net income each day.

To help him maintain his business, Ceferino is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 loan to buy raw ingredients such as pork, fish, chicken and seasonings that are needed for his cooking. He trusts that with this financial assistance his sales and earnings will increase. He is thanking God and you in advance for your great help and the good return on his investment.

Ceferino dreams of growing and expanding his food business to secure the College Education of his children. He prays for a loving and healthy family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients to make "lugaw" (congee) to sell at his food stall.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a small gemstones shop, in which he sells precious gemstones for embroidery and for pasting upon rings, ear rings, and necklaces. He presents his jewelry under a glass display case for the attraction of customers.
  
He has only one source of income, and he has to afford the expenses of utility bills, school fees of his children and household expenses. The condition of his house is not sustainable for living.

Therefore, Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can increase his inventory and earnings.

She hopes that she will construct her house soon, so that her family members can live their lives comfortably. Fozia is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: to purchase precious gemstones for reselling.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en: Shamshad is 33 years of age, and the mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a greengrocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh fruit at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh fruits to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income generated from his fruit shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family have increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize fruit sales. Therefore his wife, Shamshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy additional seasonal fruits. Shamshad thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits to sell in her husband's fruit shop.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a cashew nut business, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Hadija is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son to purchase bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and raw material for her husband's business

loans.name: Muhayojon

texts.en: Muhayojon is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has three children. She is a tailor and sews traditional women's dresses. She has three years experience in serving Tajik women. She sews at home and has permanent clients every day. She likes her activity and earns enough money to feed her family. She wants to enlarge her business and buy an electronic sewing machine. She requested a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy the sewing machine. She hopes to be supported and to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two  children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Mwanakombo is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bintimohammed

texts.en:
Bintimohammed is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Bintimohammed operates a grocery vegetable selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is a 47-year-old married man with one child. He farms vegetables as a source of income for his family. He wants to give his family a better life so he aims for better income. He decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for the vegetable plants to have a good harvest and come up with a good quality of vegetables. With this, his garden can generate more income.

Edwin wants to have his own lot for his garden in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for his vegetable plants.

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto earns a living by engaging in a rtw (ready-to-wear) business. He sells items like pants, t-shirts, blouses, whole dresses, skirts and jeans. He is a 43-year-old man living in Bien Unido, Bohol. He has been engaged in the rtw business for less than a year. He is in need of funds to purchase a variety of stock for display.

He is asking for a loan to buy assorted supplies of rtw (ready to wear), like shorts, polo shirts and many others. In this way, he could now purchase more supplies of apparel to attract more buyers to shop. With these, his income will augment and he will be able to balance his finances. He could start to do some business expansion.

Loreto hopes that his business will be successful and productive.

loans.use: to buy assorted supplies of rtw (ready to wear)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine  for her son for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Lilliam Michael

texts.es:
Liliam de 37 años de edad, casada con dos hijos menores de edad, de 14, y 3 años los cuales están en primaria y preescolar respectivamente, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su familia, pasando tiempo de calidad con sus hijos. Lamentablemente no pudo terminar una carrera universitaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería profesional. 
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta  de ropa y productos varios  en su casa de habitación como ropa de niño shores, camisolas, ropa interior, sopa magui, jabón, detergente . Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos varios  para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lilliam agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les bridan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Liliam is 37 years old, married, and has two children ages 14 and 3 years old, both of whom are in school. Liliam is hard-working and responsible; she wants to progress in life. She likes to spend her spare time with her family, enjoying quality time with her children. Unfortunately, Liliam could not go to university but she would have liked to have studied nursing.

As a result of her desire to get ahead, Liliam has a business selling clothes and household products. She sells children’s shorts, sports shirts, underwear, soups, soap and detergent. Liliam works some ten hours per day, selling her products so that in the not-too-distant future she can earn a higher income. Liliam is grateful to Kiva investors for the help that they provide to poor countries such as Nicaragua and to poor people to help them to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy various products such as children's clothes and household goods such as soap and detergent.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo es un hombre de 37 años de edad, es soltero, tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 3 y 12 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Mateo es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado, que para generar sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de consumo diario, este negocio lo tiene el desde hace 10 años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos ella se dedica también a la agricultura.
Mateo desde hace algún tiempo ha empezado a construir su casa, pero ahora el ya no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para terminar la construcción de su casa, es por esa razón que solicita un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, hierro.
El gran sueño de Mateo es poder terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Mateo is 37 years old, single and has a lovely family made up of three children between the ages of twelve and three years old. The family lives in a community in Sololá.

Mateo is very hard-working and dedicated. In order to earn an income and move forward with his family, Mateo makes a living buying a selling groceries. He has had this business for ten years but, in order to earn more money, also works in farming.

Some time ago, Mateo started to build a house but he no longer has enough money to finish the work. He is therefore applying for a loan in order to buy cement, sand and iron rods.

Mateo’s big dream is to be able to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron rods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Vazira

texts.en: Vazira is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1975. She is living in a village where agriculture is common business to do. She is married and has one child. Her husband is an emigrant. She has almost ten years of practice doing business in agriculture. Basically, she plants tomatoes and brown rice in her yard. She knows her activity well and takes care of her land each season. She is planning to widen her activity and appealed to IMON, asking a loan to buy fertilizer and rent land. She hopes after enlarging her business she can get good revenue and have a successful business. She awaits KIVA lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rent land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her son to purchase kinds of plants to resell.

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer trabajadora de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Ella se gana la vida con su pequeño negocio de venta de donas cubiertas con diferentes sabores como: chocolate, moca, caramelo, coco, azúcar, entre otros. Sandra desea invertir en una mayor cantidad de ingredientes para cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina de pan, aceite, azúcar, leche, levadura, chocolate, caramelo, coco, etc., para su negocio de venta de donas, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos económicos y continuar apoyando a sus hijos para que estudien ya que desea que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra, 34, is a hard-working woman who lives with her life partner and two children in their own house where they have been for several years.  She earns a living with her small business selling glazed dounts in different flavors, such as chocolate, mocca, caramel, coconut, sugar, etc.

Sandra wants to buy more ingredients to meet customer demand, but does not have the money to do so.  Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bread flour, oil, sugar, milk, yeast, chocolate, caramel, coconut, etc. for her donut sales.  This will improve her income so she can continue supporting her children in their studies and and give them a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy bread flour, oil, sugar, milk, yeast, chocolate, caramel, coconut, etc. for her donut business.

loans.name: Barbara Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Barbara Hilda se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes y restaurant, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas,

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Barbara Hilda continues with her grocery business and restaurant in order to support her family.  She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying back on time.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María luisa de 58 años de edad, madre soltera con seis hijos mayores de edad.  Independiente económicamente. Es originaria de Managua, y se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en la actualidad lucha, para sacar adelante su negocio y hacer crecer ya que es su medio de trabajo y subsistencia.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva, como. pantalones, shores, faldas, blusas, camisetas, faldas, ropa interior. el cual ofrece al crédito y de contado, ella tiene seis años de dedicarse a dicho negocio negocio que lo desempeña de forma ambulante, por encargo y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en nueva mercadería para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María Luisa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa, 58, is a single mother with six independent, adult children.  She is from Managua and is known for being a hard worker, responsible and determined to improve her situation.  Currently she is struggling to grow her business since it is how she earns a living.

Thanks to her determination to get ahead, she runs a business selling new clothing, such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and lingerie.  She sells on both credit and in cash.  She has been working as a street vendor for six years, and also takes orders at home.  The aim of her loan is to buy new merchandise to offer better customer service and, in the near future, earn more income.

Maria Luis is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping people with low incomes in poor countries like Nicaragua, so they can have respectable work.

loans.use: To buy clothing, such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, t-shirts, and lingerie.

loans.name: Shandy Rocio

texts.es:
La socia Shandy Rocio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de granos secos como maiz, trigo y quinua, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de granos secos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz, cebada y trigo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Shandy Rocio continues active in her dry grain business selling corn, wheat and quinoa.  Through her work she wants to provide for her children.  Her goal is to expand her sales activity.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn, barley and wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la car por tener 27 años y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol y también trabaja en una cooperativa  tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, su padre fue quien le ayudo a iniciar con este trabajo, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida  y su hijo, el est solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. y asi poder seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young man is 27 years old and his face is blurred because he lives in a high risk area.  He grows corn and beans and also works in a co-op.  He has been in this activity for ten years and started out with the help of his father.

He lives in his own house with his partner and son.  The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc. to continue his crop-growing activity and earn more income..

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Elvira has been in this business for 20 years. Elvira earns more income from buying and selling charcoal and rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and married with nine children. With five of her children in school, Gloria must work very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Gloria has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, shampoo, rice, and other groceries. 

In the future, she would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles and other groceries.

Aida has borrowed and paid back 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials like linen, threads, etc. for her tailoring business.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like linen, threads, etc. for her tailoring business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amelita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from raising pigs. Amelita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Amelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anly

texts.en:
Anly is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, cooking oil and other personal care products.

Anly has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, cooking oil and other personal care products.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 28 years old and married with three children. With all three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Brenda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, condiments, home-care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 4 years now. 

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, beverages, condiments, home-care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Arjie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Arjie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell business dealing in spare parts in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from a general store. Arjie is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts to sell in her stall.

Arjie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Sonia Marily

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos varones de 2 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que forma parte del eje connurbano y de metropolización del valle central, de clima templado durante todo el año.
Sonia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Quechua que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su madre que trabaja vendiendo comida en otro lugar y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor ya sabe caminar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia compuesta por 2 cuartos construidos de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba eléctrica, no cuenta con alcantarillado, no tiene vidrios en las ventanas y la cocina, baño y lavandería no tiene agua. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, y esta comida se caracteriza por tener un menú diario de lunes a domingo, como; Lunes: Ají de flores (Flores de ceibo rehogadas con cebolla, tomate y locoto, y papas blancas), Martes: Conejo (Cuy rebozado con pan molido y frito, rociado con chorrillana y con guarniciones de chuño), Miércoles: Chajchu (carne de res, cebolla, habas, chuño, huevo, tomate, locoto, y ají colorado), y así continua los demás días hasta el domingo, “mi negocio no descansa ni un solo día, tengo clientes semanales y otros sólo de fines de semana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la costumbre de sus clientes de comer comida tradicional, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es tener agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que lleva construyendo su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Sonia solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable, en su cocina, baño y lavandería para proporcionar una vivienda segura a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 30 year old woman. She is single and has 2 sons, aged 2 and 6. Her business is selling traditional food. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, strong, and very hardworking. She runs her business is a place called ‘Sacaba’, which is part of the area surrounding the metropolitan central valley. It has a mild climate all year round.  

Sonia has dark skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears in a pony tail. She is of short stature, a robust build, and her mother tongue is Quechua. She speaks it in her family and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. She lives with her mother, who works selling food somewhere else, and with her children. The oldest is in school and the youngest is walking now. They live in a house on family property made up of 2 rooms built from brick and cement. It has electricity and a well with an electric pump. It doesn't have plumbing, glass in the windows and the kitchen, bathroom and laundry don't have water. her business is traditional food and she has a daily menu for Monday through Sunday. For example, Monday: Ají de flores (ceibo flowers braised with onions, tomatoes, locoto peppers and white potatoes), Tuesday: Rabbit: ( or guinea pig, fried with bread crumbs with chorillana and garnished with chuño), Wednesday: Chajchu (beef, onions, beans, chuño, eggs, tomato, locoto peppers and red ají),. She continues like this until Sunday. “My business doesn't rest even for a day. I have weekly customers and others who only come on the weekends…”, she remarks. The advantage of her business is her customers' habit of eating traditional food. The disadvantage is the competition. Her dream is to have potable water in her house. She wants to install plumbing in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry in order to giver her children a better future. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 4 years she has been building her home. 

For these reasons, Sonia is asking for a loan to install plumbing in her kitchen bathroom and laundry to offer a safer home to her children.

loans.use: to install plumbing for potable water in her kitchen, bathroom and laundry in order to have a safe home for her children.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angel

texts.es: Maria de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia tiene aproximadamente 12 años de tener su negocio y gracias a sus ventas es como ha logrado salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
